From On Dispelling Mediocrity by an anonymous author of the Song Dynasty:‘Xie Lingyun once said,“Of the sum of talent under heaven, Cao Zijian possesses eight parts, I have one part, and the remaining one part is shared by the rest.”’

八方
八方[bā fāng] 指东、西、南、北、东南、东北、西南、西北，泛指周围各地 eight points of the compass, i.e. east, west, south, north, southeast, northeast, southwest, northwest; all directions：四面八方 all around一方有难，八方支援。When trouble occurs in one place, help comes from all quarters.

八旗
八旗[bā qí]清代满族的军队组织和户口编制，以旗为号，分正黄、正白、正红、正蓝、镶黄、镶白、镶红、镶蓝八旗。后又增建蒙古八旗和汉军八旗。八旗官员平时管民政，战时任将领，旗民子孙永远当兵。Eight Banners; military organizations and household registration system of the Manchu ethnic people in the Qing Dynasty, distinguished by their banners of different colours - Xulun Xar (Yellow), Xulun Qagan (White), Xulun Ulaan (Red), Xulun Hoh (Blue), Hobot Xar (Bordered Yellow), Hobot Qagan (Bordered White), Hobot Ulaan (Bordered Red) and Hobot Hoh (Bordered Blue). Later, Eight Banners were also established among Mongols and Hans. Officials of the Eight Banners were administrators in peacetime and generals in wartime; descendants of Bannermen were hereditary soldiers.

八月节
八月节[Bā yuè Jié] 中秋 Mid-Autumn Festival (15th day of the 8th lunar month)

八竿子打不着
八竿子打不着[bā gān zi dǎ bù zháo] 形容二者之间关系疏远或毫无关联 far-fetched; unrelated; 竿 又写作 also written as 杆 gān

八股
八股[bā gǔ]明清科举制度的一种考试文体，段落有严格规定，每篇由破题、承题、起讲、入手、起股、中股、后股、束股等部分组成。从起股到束股的四个部分，其中都有两股相互排比的文字，共为八股。内容空泛，形式死板，束缚人的思想。现在多用来比喻空洞死板的文章、讲演等。eight-legged essay; literary form prescribed for the imperial civil service examinations in the Ming and Qing dynasties, known for its rigidity of form and poverty of ideas. Each composition is composed of eight parts: setting the theme, exposition, explanation, proceeding to set hand, the starting leg, the middle leg, the rear leg and the ending leg. Each of the last four paragraphs consists of two pairs of parallel sentences, totalling eight pairs. Now a synonym for stereotyped writing or lecture.

八节
八节[bā jié] 指立春、春分、立夏、夏至、立秋、秋分、立冬、冬至八个节气 eight solar terms or periods - Beginning of Spring, Vernal Equinox, Beginning of Summer, Summer Solstice, Beginning of Autumn, Autumnal Equinox, Beginning of Winter and Winter Solstice：四时八节 four seasons and eight periods

八行书
八行书[bā háng shū] 旧式信纸大多用红线直分为八行，因此称书信为八行书 letter; old-style letter paper divided by red vertical lines into eight columns；简称 abbr. 八行 bāháng

八角
八角[bā jiǎo]1.常绿小乔木，叶子长椭圆形，花红色，果实呈八角形 anise (Pimpinella anisum); star anise; evergreen shrub with prolate ellipsoid leaves, red flowers and octagonal fruits亦 also 八角茴香 bājiǎo huíxiāng 或 or 大茴香 dàhuíxiāng 2.这种植物的果实，是常用的调味香料。内含挥发油，中医入药。是我国特产之一。在不同的地区有大料、茴香等名称。aniseed; seed of anise, often used in cooking, contains volatile oil, and used in traditional Chinese medicine, a special product of China; in some localities also called 大料 dàliào or 茴香 huíxiāng

八路
八路[Bā lù] 指八路军，也指八路军的干部、战士 abbr. for the Eighth Route Army; also referring to cadres and soldiers of the Eighth Route Army

八路军
八路军[Bā Lù Jūn]中国共产党领导的抗日革命武装，原是中国工农红军的主力部队，1937年抗日战争开始后改编为国民革命军第八路军，是华北抗日的主力。第三次国内革命战争时期跟新四军和其他人民武装一起改编为中国人民解放军。Eighth Route Army - revolutionary anti-Japanese armed forces led by the Chinese Communist Party. Its predecessor was the main force of the Chinese Workers‘and Peasants’Red Army, which was re-designated the Eighth Route Army of the National Revolutionary Army after the outbreak of the War of Resistance against Japan in 1937, and became the main army of resistance in North China. During the Third Revolutionary Civil War, the Eighth Route Army, the New Fourth Army and other popular military units were combined to form the Chinese People's Liberation Army.

八辈子
八辈子[bā bèi zi] 好几辈子，形容程度深或时间长 eight lifetimes; long time; extremely：八辈子前的事儿。It happened long ago.倒了八辈子霉。What interminable rotten luck!

八进制
八进制[bā jìn zhì]一种记数法，采用0，1，2，3，4，5，6，7八个数码，逢八进位。如十进制的9，27在八进制中分别记为11，33。八进制的数较二进制的数书写方便，常应用在电子计算机的计算中。octal (number) system; number system with a base of eight, e.g. 9 and 27 in the decimal system are written 11 and 33 in the octal system. Octal numerals, more convenient to use than binary ones, are frequently used in computer computations.

八面玲珑
八面玲珑[bā miàn líng lóng] 原指窗户宽敞明亮，后用来形容人处世圆滑，不得罪任何一方 (formerly) description of large, bright windows; someone smooth and tactful, who never offends

八音盒
八音盒[bā yīn hé] 一种器物，开动匣里的发条后，能奏出各种固定的乐曲 musical (music) box powered by a spiral power spring that plays a fixed tune亦 also 八音琴 bāyīnqín and 八音匣子 bāyīn xiá·zi

公
公1[gōng]（ㄍㄨㄥ）1.属于国家或集体的（跟‘私’相对 as opposed to ‘private’）public; state-owned; collective：公款 public funds公物 public property公事公办。Business is business. 2.共同的；大家承认的 common; general：公分母 common denominator公议 public discussion公约 convention; treaty 3.属于国际间的 of the world; international：公海 high seas; international waters公制 metric system公历 Gregorian calendar 4.使公开 make public：公布 announce公之于世 make known to the world 5.公平；公正 fair; impartial; just：公买公卖 be fair in buying and selling大公无私 selfless秉公办理 handle a matter impartially 6.公事；公务 public affairs; official business：办公 handle official business公余 after work 7.(Gōng) 姓 a surname公2[gōng]（ㄍㄨㄥ）1.封建五等爵位的第一等 duke; first rank of the five ranks of nobility in feudal society：公爵 duke公侯 duke and marquis王公大臣 princes, dukes and ministers 2.对上了年纪的男子的尊称 [respectful term of address for an elderly man]：诸公 all the gentlemen张公 the reverend Mr. Zhang 3.丈夫的父亲；公公 husband's father; father-in-law：公婆 parents-in-law 4.（禽兽）雄性的（跟‘母’相对 as opposed to ‘female’）male (animal)：公羊 ram这只小鸡是公的。This chick is a rooster.相关词组阿公 | 办公 | 包公 | 秉公 | 伯公 | 不公 | 充公 | 奉公 | 归公 | 老公 | 雷公 | 梢公 | 艄公 | 师公 | 叔公 | 太公 | 天公 | 外公 | 王公 | 相公 | 寓公 | 办公室 | 车公里 | 瓷公鸡 | 大公国 | 吨公里 | 鸡公车 | 老公公 | 两公婆 | 女公子 | 蒲公英 | 人公里 | 铁公鸡 | 亲家公 | 文抄公 | 主人公 | 办公会议 | 大公无私 | 奉公守法 | 急公好义 | 假公济私 | 损公肥私 | 天公地道 | 叶公好龙 | 愚公移山 | 巴黎公社 | 高速公路 | 股份公司 | 国际公法 | 国际公制 | 行政公署 | 花花公子 | 贿赂公行 | 跨国公司 | 例行公事 | 罗马公教 | 皮包公司 | 上市公司 | 同业公会 | 无限公司 | 新闻公报 | 有限公司 | 原始公社 | 专员公署 | 衮衮诸公 | 开诚布公 | 克己奉公 | 舍己为公 | 枵腹从公 | 一国三公 | 信息高速公路 | 项庄舞剑，意在沛公公安 | 公案 | 公办 | 公报 | 公布 | 公差 | 公产 | 公称 | 公出 | 公畜 | 公道 | 公德 | 公敌 | 公爹 | 公断 | 公法 | 公方 | 公房 | 公费 | 公愤 | 公干 | 公告 | 公公 | 公共 | 公股 | 公关 | 公馆 | 公国 | 公海 | 公害 | 公函 | 公会 | 公祭 | 公家 | 公举 | 公决 | 公开 | 公款 | 公了 | 公理 | 公历 | 公立 | 公例 | 公粮 | 公路 | 公论 | 公民 | 公墓 | 公派 | 公判 | 公平 | 公婆 | 公仆 | 公然 | 公认 | 公设 | 公社 | 公审 | 公使 | 公示 | 公式 | 公事 | 公输 | 公司 | 公私 | 公诉 | 公孙 | 公所 | 公堂 | 公帑 | 公推 | 公文 | 公务 | 公物 | 公心 | 公休 | 公演 | 公议 | 公益 | 公营 | 公映 | 公用 | 公有 | 公余 | 公寓 | 公元 | 公园 | 公约 | 公允 | 公债 | 公章 | 公正 | 公证 | 公职 | 公制 | 公众 | 公主 | 公助 | 公转 | 公子 | 公积金 | 公开信 | 公民权 | 公母俩 | 公平秤 | 公式化 | 公诉人 | 公务员 | 公信力 | 公益金 | 公有制 | 公债券 | 公报私仇 | 公共关系 | 公共积累 | 公共汽车 | 公教人员 | 公私合营 | 公用事业 | 公诸同好 | 公子哥儿 | 公子王孙

公主
公主[gōng zhǔ] 君主的女儿 princess

公举
公举[gōng jǔ] 共同推举 elect by referendum：公举代表 elect a representative

公了
公了[gōng liǎo] 双方发生纠纷，通过上级或主管部门调解或判决了结（跟‘私了’相对 as opposed to ‘settle in private’）dispute arbitrated or judged by a higher level or by the department in charge

公事
公事[gōng shì]1.公家的事；集体的事（区别于‘私事’ as distinguished from ‘private affairs’）public affairs; official business：公事公办。Business is business.先办公事，后办私事。Public affairs should come before private ones. 2.〈方 dial.〉指公文 official documents：每天上午看公事 read official documents every morning

公产
公产[gōng chǎn] 公共财产 public property：侵吞公产 gobble up public property

公仆
公仆[gōng pú] 为公众服务的人 public servant：社会公仆 servant of society人民公仆 servant of the people

公休
公休[gōng xiū] 星期日、节日等集体的休假 public holiday; Sunday and other festivals; official holiday：公休日 general holiday

公众
公众[gōng zhòng] 社会上大多数的人；大众 public：公众领袖 leader of the public公众利益 public interest

公会
公会[gōng huì] 同业公会 trade council; trade association

公余
公余[gōng yú] 办公时间以外的时间 leisure hours (after work)：公余以写字、画画儿作为消遣 relax by writing and drawing after work

公使
公使[gōng shǐ] 由一国派驻在另一国的次于大使一级的外交代表，全称是特命全权公使 envoy; envoy extraordinary and minister plenipotentiary; diplomatic envoy second to the ambassador to a country

公例
公例[gōng lì] 一般的规律 general rule

公信力
公信力[gōng xìn lì] 使公众信任的力量 public credibility; ability to win public trust：提高政府部门的公信力 improve government departments' capacity to win public trust

公债
公债[gōng zhài] 国家向公民或外国借的债 public or government debt; debt a state owes to its citizens or foreign countries

公债券
公债券[gōng zhài quàn] 公债债权人取本息的证券 public or government bond; securities with which bond creditors can reclaim their capital and interest

公允
公允[gōng yǔn] 公平恰当 just and sound; fair and equitable：持论公允 be just and fair in argument

公元
公元[gōng yuán] 国际通用的公历的纪元，是大多数国家纪年的标准，从传说的耶稣诞生那一年算起。我国从1949年正式规定采用公元纪年。 Christian era, the internationally adopted periodization of eras, beginning from the alleged birth year of Christ. China formally adopted the system in 1949.

公公
公公[gōng gong]1.丈夫的父亲 husband's father; father-in-law 2.〈方 dial.〉祖父 paternal grandfather 3.〈方 dial.〉外祖父 maternal grandfather 4.尊称年老的男子 [respectful term of address for an elderly man] grandpa：刘公公 Grandpa Liu老公公 old grandpa 5.对太监的称呼（多见于早期白话 oft. used in early vernacular）form of address for a court eunuch

公共
公共[gōng gòng] 属于社会的；公有公用的 public; common：公共卫生 public health公共汽车 bus公共场所 public places爱护公共财产 take good care of public property

公共关系
公共关系[gōng gòng guān xì] 指团体、企业或个人在社会活动中的相互关系 (of organizations, enterprises or individuals) public relations (PR). 简称 abbr. 公关 gōngguān

公共汽车
公共汽车[gōng gòng qì chē] 供乘客乘坐的汽车。有固定的路线和停车站。 bus; public conveyance having a regular route and fixed stops

公共积累
公共积累[gōng gòng jī lěi] 同 same as 公积金 gōngjījīn

公关
公关[gōng guān] 公共关系的简称 abbr. for 公共关系 gōnggòng guān·xì：公关部门 department of public relations公关小姐（从事公关工作的女职员）female PR staff

公决
公决[gōng jué] 共同决定 referendum：全民公决 referendum这件事须经大家讨论公决。This matter should be decided through public discussion.

公出
公出[gōng chū] 因办理公事而外出 be away on official business：我要公出一个月，家里的事就拜托你了。I'll be away on official business for a month, so I need to ask you to take care of family matters.

公函
公函[gōng hán] 平行及不相隶属的部门间的来往公文（区别于‘便函’ as compared with ‘informal letter’）official letter between parallel or unaffiliated departments

公判
公判[gōng pàn]1.公开宣判，就是法院在群众大会上向当事人和公众宣布案件的判决 (of the court) pronounce a judgement in public before the parties 2.公众评判 verdict of the public

公制
公制[gōng zhì] 国际公制的简称 abbr. for 国际公制 guójì gōngzhì

公办
公办[gōng bàn] 国家创办 state-run; established by the state：公办学校 public school公办企业 state-owned enterprise

公务
公务[gōng wù] 关于国家或集体的事务 public affairs; official business：办理公务 handle official business公务人员 government functionary公务繁忙 busy with official business

公务员
公务员[gōng wù yuán]1.政府机关的工作人员 government office worker; civil servants 2.〈旧时 old〉称机关、团体中做勤杂工作的人员 non-clerical personnel employed in institutions and organizations

公助
公助[gōng zhù]1.共同资助 finance jointly：社会公助 financial support from society 2.国家资助 subsidized by the state：这是一座民办公助的学校。This is a school run by the local people and subsidized by the state.

公历
公历[gōng lì] 阳历的一种，是现在国际通用的历法。一年365天，分为十二个月，一、三、五、七、八、十、十二月为大月，每月31天，四、六、九、十一月为小月，每月30天，二月是28天。因地球绕太阳一周实际为365.24219天（太阳年），所以每400年中有97个闰年，闰年在二月末加一天，全年是366天。闰年的计算法是：公元年数能够用4整除的是闰年（如1960年），能够用100整除的是平年（如1900年），能够用100整除也能用400整除的是闰年（如2000年）。纪元是从传说的耶稣生年算起。 Gregorian calendar; internationally used solar calendar, with 365 days and 12 months in a year, with January, March, May, July, August, October and December as solar months of 31 days, April, June, September and November as solar months of 30 days, and February of 28 days. A solar year, i.e., the time it takes for the earth to move round the sun once, is equivalent to 365.24219 days, so there are 97 leap years in every 400 years; in a leap year, an extra day is added to February, to make 366 days in that year. Leap years occur in years where the year number is evenly divisible by 4 (e.g. 1960) or where it is evenly divisible by 100 and 400 (e.g. 2000). Non-leap years occur in those evenly divisible by 100 (e.g. 1900). The first year of the Gregorian calendar begins with the alleged birth year of Christ.亦 also 格里历 gélǐlì；通称 commonly called 阳历 yánglì

公司
公司[gōng sī] 一种工商业组织，经营产品的生产、商品的流转或某些建设事业等 company; corporation; industrial or commercial organizations dealing with manufacturing, distribution of goods or construction

公告
公告[gōng gào]1. 同 same as 通告 tōnggào ①：以上通令，公告全体公民周知。The above announcement is hereby made known to all citizens. 2.政府或机关团体等向公众发出的通告 public announcement made by the government or other institutions

公园
公园[gōng yuán] 供公众游览休息的园林 (public) park; place for the public to visit and relax in

公国
公国[gōng guó] 欧洲封建时代的诸侯国家，以公爵为国家元首 duchy; European kingdoms in feudal times, with dukes as rulers

公堂
公堂[gōng táng]1.指官吏审理案件的地方 law court：私设公堂 set up a kangaroo court对簿公堂 confront sb. before a court of law; take sb. to court 2.指祠堂 ancestral hall (or temple)

公墓
公墓[gōng mù] 公共坟地（区别于一姓一家的坟地 as distinguished from ‘private or family cemetery’）public cemetery

公婆
公婆[gōng pó]1.丈夫的父亲和母亲；公公和婆婆 husband's father and mother; parents-in-law 2.〈方 dial.〉指夫妻，夫妻两人叫两公婆 husband and wife; couple

公子
公子[gōng zǐ]〈古代 arch.〉称诸侯的儿子，后称官僚的儿子，也用来尊称人的儿子 son of a duke in ancient times; son of a high official; also a respectful term for sb. else's son

公子哥儿
公子哥儿[gōng zǐ gē r] 原称官僚和有钱人家不知人情世故的子弟，后泛指娇生惯养的年轻男子 dandy; pampered, unsophisticated son of a wealthy or influential family; spoiled young men in general

公子王孙
公子王孙[gōng zǐ wáng sūn]〈旧时 old〉泛指贵族、官僚的子弟 (in a broad sense) sons of princes and nobles; sons of the aristocracy and the bureaucrats

公孙
公孙[gōng sūn] 姓 a surname

公安
公安[gōng ān] 社会整体（包括社会秩序、公共财产、公民权利等）的治安 public security, covering social order, public property, civil rights, etc.：公安局 police station; public security bureau公安人员 public security officer

公审
公审[gōng shěn] 我国人民法院公开审判案件的一种方式，在群众参加下审判有重大社会意义的案件 public (or open) trial by the People's Court in China, usu. for important cases of great social significance

公害
公害[gōng hài]1.各种污染源对社会公共环境造成的污染和破坏 environmental hazard 2.〈比喻 fig.〉对公众有害的事物 public hazard：赌博是一大公害。Gambling is a major social illness.

公家
公家[gōng jia] 指国家、机关、企业、团体（区别于‘私人’ as compared with ‘private’）state; public; organization：不能把公家的东西据为己有。One cannot take over public property.

公寓
公寓[gōng yù]1.〈旧时 old〉租期较长、房租论月计算的旅馆，住宿的人多半是谋事或求学的 lodging houses for long-term boarders paying by the month, mainly used by people seeking work or students 2.能容许多人家居住的房屋，多为楼房，房间成套，设备较好 apartment building; housing complex shared by many families, usu. with suites of rooms and well-equipped

公差
公差[gōng chā] 机器制造业中，对机械或机器零件的尺寸许可的误差 (of machine-building) tolerance for error公差[gōng chāi]1.临时派遣去做的公务 official errand; public business：出公差 go on a business trip 2.〈旧时 old〉在衙门里当差的人 bailiff in a yamen

公布
公布[gōng bù]（政府机关的法律、命令、文告，团体的通知事项）公开发布，使大家知道 (of laws, orders and statements of governmental institutions, notices of organizations, etc.) promulgate; announce; make known to the public：公布于众 make public公布新宪法 promulgate a new constitution食堂的账目每月公布一次 publish the cafeteria accounts once a month

公帑
公帑[gōng tǎng]〈书 fml.〉 同 same as 公款 gōngkuǎn：靡费公帑 squander public funds

公干
公干[gōng gàn]1. 同 same as 公事 gōngshì：有何公干？What important business brings you here? 2.办理公事 deal with official business：外出公干 go out on official business来京公干 take a business trip to Beijing

公平
公平[gōng píng] 处理事情合情合理，不偏袒哪一方面 fair; just; impartial; equitable：公平合理 fair and reasonable公平交易 fair deal裁判公平 judge fairly

公平秤
公平秤[gōng píng chèng] 商业单位设置的供顾客检验所购商品分量是否准确的标准秤 fair scale; standard scale provided by commercial administrations to enable consumers to check the weights of what they've bought

公开
公开[gōng kāi]1.不加隐蔽；面对大家（跟‘秘密’相对 as opposed to ‘secret’）open; public; transparent：公开活动 open activity 2.使秘密的成为公开的 make public; come out of the closet：这件事暂时不能公开。We cannot make this matter public for the time being.

公开信
公开信[gōng kāi xìn] 写给个人或集体，但作者认为有使公众知道的必要，因而公开发表的信 letter to an individual or a collective that the author thinks necessary to make public

公式
公式[gōng shì]1.用数学符号或文字表示各个数量之间的关系的式子，具有普遍性，适合于同类关系的所有问题。如圆面积公式是S=πR2 ，长方形面积公式是面积＝长×宽。 formula; set form of mathematical symbols or words indicating the relationship among variables. It is universal and can be applied to a group of things of the same relationship. For example, the formula for the area of a circle is S=πR2 , and for a rectangle length×breadth. 2.泛指可以应用于同类事物的方式、方法 (in a broad sense) any method that can be applied to a group of similar things

公式化
公式化[gōng shì huà]1.指文艺创作中套用某种固定格式来描写现实生活和人物性格的不良倾向 formulism; undesirable trend in art and literature to portray real life and characters according to fixed conventions 2.指不针对具体情况而死板地根据某种固定方式处理问题 formulistic; rigid adherence to convention without regard for actual conditions

公德
公德[gōng dé] 公共道德 public ethics：讲公德 stress on social morality社会公德 social ethics

公心
公心[gōng xīn]1.公正之心 sense of justice：秉持公心 uphold justice处以公心 handle sth. with fairness 2.为公众利益着想的心意 consideration for public interests：他这样做是出于公心。He did this out of consideration for public interests.

公愤
公愤[gōng fèn] 公众的愤怒 public indignation：激起公愤 arouse public indignation

公房
公房[gōng fáng] 属于公家的房屋 public housing

公所
公所[gōng suǒ]1.〈旧时 old〉区、乡、村政府办公的地方 office of the government at district, township and village levels：区公所 district office乡公所 township office村公所 village office 2.〈旧时 old〉同业或同乡组织办公的地方 office of a trade association or association of fellow provincials：布业公所 association of textile merchants

公报
公报[gōng bào]1.公开发表的关于重大会议的决议、国际谈判的进展、国际协议的成立、军事行动的进行等的正式文告 public announcement; communiqué; published formal statements on resolutions made at important meetings, progress of international negotiations, conclusion of international agreements, progress of military actions, etc.：新闻公报 press release; communiqué联合公报 joint communiqué 2.由政府编印的刊物，专门登载法律、法令、决议、命令、条约、协定及其他官方文件 gazette; bulletin, compiled and published by government, focusing on laws, regulations, resolutions, orders, treaties, agreements; other official documents

公报私仇
公报私仇[gōng bào sī chóu] 借公事来报个人的仇 avenge personal wrongs in the name of public interest; abuse public power to retaliate against a personal enemy亦 also 官报私仇 guān bào sī chóu

公推
公推[gōng tuī]共同推举（某人担任某种职务或做某事）recommend sb. for a post or task by consensus：大家公推他当代表。He was recommended by consensus to be the representative.

公敌
公敌[gōng dí] 共同的敌人 public enemy：人民公敌 enemy of the people; public enemy

公教人员
公教人员[gōng jiào rén yuán] 对机关工作人员和学校教员的合称 government employees and teachers

公文
公文[gōng wén] 机关相互往来联系事务的文件 official document, exchanged between institutions：公文袋 official envelope公文要求简明扼要。Official documents should be concise and to the point.

公断
公断[gōng duàn]1.由非当事人居中裁断 arbitrate by a non-party：听候众人公断 await verdict of the public 2.秉公裁断 arbitrate impartially：执法部门自会公断。The law enforcement department will certainly decide impartially.

公方
公方[gōng fāng] 指公私合营企业中国家的一方（跟‘私方’相对 as opposed to ‘private party’）party representing the state in a public-private joint enterprise：公方代表 representatives of state ownership公方人员 staff representing state ownership

公映
公映[gōng yìng]（影片）公开放映 (of a movie) publicly show：这部影片即将公映。The movie will soon open.

公有
公有[gōng yǒu] 集体或全民所有 publicly owned; public：公有制 public ownership公有财产 public property

公有制
公有制[gōng yǒu zhì] 生产资料归公共所有的制度。现在我国存在着两种公有制，即社会主义的全民所有制和社会主义的集体所有制。 public ownership of the means of production. Currently, there are two such systems in China: socialist ownership by all the people and socialist ownership by the collective.

公案
公案[gōng àn]1.指官吏审理案件时用的桌子 court desk (used by a judge) 2.指疑难案件，泛指有纠纷的或离奇的事情 complicated legal case; disputed or strange issue：一桩公案 a complicated case公案小说 detective story or novel

公款
公款[gōng kuǎn] 属于国家、机关、企业、团体的钱 public money (or fund) owned by the state, an organization, enterprise or group

公正
公正[gōng zhèng] 公平正直，没有偏私 just; fair; impartial; fair-minded：为人公正 fair-minded公正的评价 fair evaluation

公母俩
公母俩[gōng mu liǎ]〈方 dial.〉夫妻二人 husband and wife：老公母俩的感情可真好。The old couple have a loving relationship.

公民
公民[gōng mín] 具有或取得某国国籍，并根据该国法律规定享有权利和承担义务的人 citizen; sb. having a state's nationality, and enjoying rights and accepting responsibilities according to that state's laws

公民权
公民权[gōng mín quán] 公民根据宪法规定所享受的权利 citizenship; civil rights stipulated by the constitution

公法
公法[gōng fǎ]1.西方法学中指与国家利益有关的法律，如宪法、行政法等（区别于‘私法’ as compared with ‘private law’）public law; according to Western law, laws concerned with national interest, such as constitutional and administrative laws 2.指调整国际关系的准则 norms for adjusting international relations：国际公法 public international law

公派
公派[gōng pài] 由国家派遣 state dispatched：公派留学 sent by the state to study overseas

公海
公海[gōng hǎi] 各国都可使用的不受任何国家权力支配的海域 high seas; sea areas that any country can use and not subject to any country's control

公演
公演[gōng yǎn] 公开演出 perform in public; give a performance：这出新戏将于近期公演。This new drama will open soon.

公然
公然[gōng rán] 公开地；毫无顾忌地 openly; undisguisedly; brazenly：公然作弊 undisguised fraud公然撕毁协议 brazenly tear up an agreement

公爹
公爹[gōng diē]〈方 dial.〉 同 same as 公公 gōng·gong ①

公物
公物[gōng wù] 属于公家的东西 public property：爱护公物 take good care of public property

公理
公理[gōng lǐ]1.经过人类长期反复实践的考验，不需要再加证明的命题，如：如果A=B，B=C，则A=C axiom; generally acknowledged truth, e.g., if A=B and B=C, then A=C 2.社会上多数人公认的正确道理 truth acknowledged by the majority of the public

公用
公用[gōng yòng] 公共使用；共同使用 for public use; public; common：公用电话 public telephone公用事业 public utilities两家公用一个厨房。The two families shared a kitchen.

公用事业
公用事业[gōng yòng shì yè] 城市和乡镇中供居民使用的电报、电话、电灯、自来水、公共交通等企业的统称 public utility; public services for urban residents; general term for enterprises concerned with urban and township telecommunications, electricity, water supply and public transportation

公畜
公畜[gōng chù] 雄性牲畜，畜牧业上通常指留种用的 male animal; stud (kept for breeding)

公益
公益[gōng yì] 公共的利益（多指卫生、救济等群众福利事业 usu. regarding health and relief work）public good; public welfare：热心公益 be public-spirited

公益金
公益金[gōng yì jīn] 企业单位、生产单位用来兴办本单位的文化事业和公共福利事业的资金 public welfare fund (provided by enterprise, factory, etc. to support cultural activities and other social benefits)

公示
公示[gōng shì] 公开宣示，让公众了解并征求意见 make known to the public and seek opinions：实行干部任前公示制度 implement the system whereby the appointment of cadres is made public and opinions are sought before they take up office

公社
公社[gōng shè]1.原始社会中，人们共同生产、共同消费的一种结合形式，如氏族公社等。在阶级社会中也保持了很长一个时期。 commune; primitive commune; a system in which people work and consume together, such as a clan commune, and which has been in existence for a long time in class society 2.欧洲历史上的城市自治机关，如法国、意大利等国早期的公社。它是资产阶级政权的初级形式。 commune, an organ of city self-rule in Europe, such as the early communes in France and Italy, which were the initial form of power of the bourgeoisie 3.无产阶级政权的一种形式，如法国1871年的巴黎公社，我国1927年的广州公社 commune, a form of power of the proletariat, e.g. the Paris Commune of 1871, and the Guangzhou Commune in 1927 4.特指人民公社 esp. China's people's commune

公祭
公祭[gōng jì]1.公共团体或社会人士举行祭奠，向死者表示哀悼 public memorial：公祭死难烈士 public memorial service in honour of martyrs 2.这种祭礼 public memorial ceremony：公祭在哀乐声中开始。The public memorial ceremony began with funeral music.

公私
公私[gōng sī] 公家和私人 public and private：公私兼顾 give consideration to both public and private interests公私合营 joint state-private ownership

公私合营
公私合营[gōng sī hé yíng] 我国对民族资本主义工商业实行社会主义改造的一种形式，分为个别企业公私合营和全行业公私合营两个阶段 joint state-private ownership (the principal form adopted during the socialist transformation of industry and commerce in China, carried out in two phases: individual company joint state-private ownership, and sector-wide joint state-private ownership)

公积金
公积金[gōng jī jīn] 生产单位从收益中提取的用做扩大再生产的资金 (of a factory) accumulation fund for expansion of production

公称
公称[gōng chēng] 机器性能、图纸尺寸等的规格或标准 specifications or standards for machine functions, blueprint dimensions, etc.

公立
公立[gōng lì] 政府设立 established and maintained by the government; public：公立学校 public school

公章
公章[gōng zhāng] 机关、团体使用的印章 official seal

公粮
公粮[gōng liáng] 农业生产者或农业生产单位每年缴纳给国家的作为农业税的粮食 annual agricultural tax paid in grain by farmers or agriculture units to the state

公约
公约[gōng yuē]1.条约的一种名称。一般指三个或三个以上的国家缔结的某些政治性的或关于某一专门问题的条约。convention; usu. ratified by three or more countries regarding political or specific issues 2.机关、团体或街道居民内部拟订的共同遵守的章程 joint pledge made internally by institutions, organizations or residents：爱国公约 patriotic pledge卫生公约 public health pledge

公职
公职[gōng zhí] 指国家机关或公共企业、事业单位中的正式职务 public employment; formal post in state institutions or enterprises：担任公职 hold public office开除公职 discharge sb. from public service公职人员 civil servant

公股
公股[gōng gǔ] 公私合营的工商企业中，国家所有的股份 state share in a public-private joint enterprise

公营
公营[gōng yíng] 由国家或地方经营 publicly owned; publicly operated; public：公营企业 public-owned enterprise

公认
公认[gōng rèn] 大家一致认为 generally acknowledge (or recognize); universally accept：他的刻苦精神是大家公认的。His spirit of hardwork is generally acknowledged.

公议
公议[gōng yì] 大家在一起评议 have a public discussion

公论
公论[gōng lùn] 公众的评论 public opinion; verdict of the masses：尊重公论 respect public opinion是非自有公论。Public opinion will decide what is right and wrong.

公设
公设[gōng shè] 不需要证明就可以认为是真的假设，例如，由一点到另一点可以引一条直线 postulation that can be assumed true without proof, e.g. a straight line can be drawn from any one point to another

公证
公证[gōng zhèng] 法院或被授以权力的机关对于民事上权利义务关系所做的证明，如对合同、遗嘱等都可进行公证 notarise; certify a contract, will, etc.; certify through a court or a notary public

公诉
公诉[gōng sù] 刑事诉讼的一种方式，由检察机关代表国家对认为确有犯罪行为、应负刑事责任的人向法院提起的诉讼（区别于‘自诉’ as distinguished from ‘private prosecution’）public prosecution; procuratorial organs representing the state and taking legal proceedings against an offender

公诉人
公诉人[gōng sù rén] 代表国家向法院提起公诉的人 public prosecutor, representing the state

公诸同好
公诸同好[gōng zhū tóng hào] 把自己喜爱的东西给有同样爱好的人共同享受 let others with the same taste share things one loves

公费
公费[gōng fèi] 由国家或团体供给的费用 funds supplied by the state or the collective：公费医疗 public health services公费留学 study abroad on a state scholarship

公路
公路[gōng lù] 市区以外的可以通行各种车辆的宽阔平坦的道路 highway; wide, well-paved road outside of the city limits

公转
公转[gōng zhuàn] 一个天体绕着另一个天体转动叫做公转。如太阳系的行星绕着太阳转动，行星的卫星绕着行星转动。地球绕太阳公转一周的时间是365天6小时9分10秒；月球绕地球公转一周的时间是27天7小时43分11.5秒。 revolution - the circling of one heavenly body around another, e.g. in the solar system, planets revolving around the sun, and satellites around the planets. The period of the earth going a circle around the sun is 365 days, 6 hours, 9 minutes and 10 seconds; the moon's revolution around the earth is 27 days, 7 hours, 43 minutes and 11.5 seconds.

公输
公输[gōng shū] 姓 a surname

公道
公道[gōng dào] 公正的道理 justice：主持公道 uphold justice公道自在人心。Justice is on everybody's mind.公道[gōng dao] 公平；合理 fair; just; reasonable; impartial：说句公道话 be fair办事公道 be impartial in handling matters价钱公道 reasonable price

公馆
公馆[gōng guǎn] 官员、富人的住宅 mansion (of a rich person or important official)

六
六1[liù]（ㄌㄧㄡˋ）〈数目 numeral〉五加一后所得 six; sum of five plus one另见  数字 shùzì六2[liù]（ㄌㄧㄡˋ）我国民族音乐音阶上的一级，乐谱上用做记音符号，相当于简谱的‘5’note of the musical scale in traditional Chinese music, corresponding to 5 in the numbered musical notation另见  工尺 gōngchě另见  lù六[lù]（ㄌㄨˋ）1.六安 (Lù'ān)，山名，又地名，都在安徽 Lu'an, name of both a mountain and a place in Anhui Province 2.六合 (Lùhé)，地名，在江苏 Luhe, name of a place in Jiangsu Province另见  liù相关词组四六体 | 三六九等 | 三姑六婆 | 三亲六故 | 三头六臂 | 五黄六月 | 五颜六色 | 呼幺喝六 | 吆五喝六 | 板板六十四 | 三百六十行 | 一退六二五六部 | 六朝 | 六畜 | 六腑 | 六根 | 六合 | 六甲 | 六路 | 六轮 | 六亲 | 六壬 | 六神 | 六书 | 六艺 | 六欲 | 六弦琴 | 六指儿 | 六亲不认 | 六神无主 | 六一儿童节

六一儿童节
六一儿童节[Liù Yī ?r tóng Jié]全世界儿童的节日。国际民主妇女联合会为保障全世界儿童的权利，反对帝国主义者对儿童的虐杀和毒害，于1949年在莫斯科举行的会议上，决定以6月1日为国际儿童节。International Children's Day (June 1). In order to safeguard the rights of children throughout the world and oppose the killing and harming of children by imperialists, the International Democratic Women's Federation made a decision at a meeting held in Moscow in 1949, at which June 1 was adopted as the International Children's Day.亦 also 六一国际儿童节 Liù-Yī Guójì ?rtóng Jié, 国际儿童节 Guójì ?rtóng Jié 或 or 儿童节 ?rtóng Jié

六书
六书[liù shū] 古人分析汉字而归纳出来的六种条例，即指事、象形、形声、会意、转注、假借 six categories of Chinese characters summarized by ancient Chinese: self-explanatory, pictographic, pictographic-phonetic, ideographic, mutually explanatory and phonetic loan

六亲
六亲[liù qīn] 六种亲属，究竟指哪些亲属说法不一，较早的一种说法是指父、母、兄、弟、妻、子。泛指亲属 six relations; (in a broad sense) relative. Opinions are divided on which are the six relations, and one of the earliest versions is father, mother, elder brothers, younger brothers, wife, and children; one's kin：六亲不认 unsympathetic; impersonal

六亲不认
六亲不认[liù qīn bù rèn] 形容人没有情义或不讲情面 refuse to have anything to do with all one's relatives and friends; disown all one's relatives and friends; be unfeeling, cold or arrogant

六合
六合[liù hé]〈书 fml.〉指上下和东西南北四方，泛指天下或宇宙 six directions - north, south, east, west, the above and the below; world; universe

六壬
六壬[liù rén]〈旧时 old〉一种占卜方法，用阴阳五行来推算吉凶祸福（六十组干支中，起头是‘壬’字的有六组，故称六壬） six ren-headed Stem-Branch pairs; a kind of divination by which yin and yang and the five elements of metal, wood, water, fire and earth are used to tell one's good luck, ill luck, misfortune and fortune. (Among the 60 pairs of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches, there are six pairs beginning with ren, hence the ‘six ren-headed Stem-Branch pairs’.) ：精于六壬 good at practising divination

六弦琴
六弦琴[liù xián qín]弦乐器，有六根弦。一手按弦，一手拨弦。guitar; six-stringed musical instrument plucked or strummed with the fingers or a plectrum; 亦 also 吉他 jítā

六指儿
六指儿[liù zhǐ r]1.长了六个指头的手或脚 six-fingered hand or six-toed foot 2.有六指儿的人 person with a six-fingered hand or six toed foot

六朝
六朝[Liù Cháo]1.吴、东晋、宋、齐、梁、陈，先后建都于建康（吴称建业，今南京），合称六朝 Six Dynasties; the Wu, Eastern Jin, Song, Qi, Liang and Chen dynasties, which all had their capital city in Jiankang (Nanjing of today) 2.泛指南北朝时期 Southern and Northern Dynasties (420-589)：六朝文 literary style of the Six Dynasties; rhythmical prose style with special emphasis on the art of parallelism六朝书法 calligraphy of the Six Dynasties另见  南北朝 Nán-Běi Cháo

六根
六根[liù gēn]〈佛教 Budd.〉指眼、耳、鼻、舌、身、意，认为这六者是罪孽的根源 six roots of sins - eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body and mind：六根清净 be free from human desires and passions

六欲
六欲[liù yù]〈佛教 Budd.〉指色欲、形貌欲等六种欲望，泛指人的各种欲望 six desires originating from six senses - eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body and mind; six attractions arising from colour, form, carriage, voice, softness and features; all kinds of desires：七情六欲 the seven human emotions of joy, anger, sorrow, fear, love, hate and desire and the six desires of colour, form, carriage, voice, softness and features

六甲
六甲[liù jiǎ]1.〈古代 arch.〉用甲、乙、丙、丁、戊、己、庚、辛、壬、癸十干和子、丑、寅、卯、辰、巳、午、未、申、酉、戌、亥十二支依次相配成六十组干支，其中起头是‘甲’字的有六组，故称六甲。因笔画比较简单，多为儿童练字之用 six jia-headed Stem-Branch pairs; 60 Stem-Branch pairs formed alternately by the 10 Heavenly Stems of jia, yi, bing, ding, wu, ji, geng, xin, ren, gui and the 12 Earthly Branches of zi, chou, yin, mao, chen, si, wu, wei, shen, you, xu, hai. There are six pairs each beginning with jia, hence the six jia-headed Stem-Branch pairs. As these characters have fewer strokes, it is easier for children to practise calligraphy：学六甲 learn calligraphy 2.〈旧时 old〉妇女怀孕称身怀六甲 (of a woman) be pregnant

六畜
六畜[liù chù] 指猪、牛、羊、马、鸡、狗，也泛指各种家畜、家禽 six domestic animals (pig, ox, goat, horse, chicken and dog); all domestic animals and poultry：五谷丰登，六畜兴旺。An abundant harvest of all food crops accompanies the thriving of all domestic animals.

六神
六神[liù shén] 古人指主宰心、肺、肝、肾、脾、胆六脏之神，泛指心神 gods believed by ancient Chinese to govern the six internal organs of heart, lungs, liver, kidneys, spleen and gallbladder; mind; state of mind：六神不安 have no peace of mind; be disturbed六神无主 be at a loss what to do

六神无主
六神无主[liù shén wú zhǔ] 形容惊慌或着急而没有主意 distracted; be frightened or worried out of one's wits; be at a loss what to do

六腑
六腑[liù fǔ]〈中医 Chin. med.〉称胃、胆、三焦、膀胱、大肠、小肠为六腑 six hollow organs of stomach, gall bladder, three visceral cavities, bladder, large intestine and small intestine

六艺
六艺[liù yì]1.〈古代 arch.〉指礼（礼仪）、乐（音乐）、射（射箭）、御（驾车）、书（识字）、数（计算）等六种科目 six arts: rites, music, archery, charioteering, reading and writing, and arithmetic 2.〈古代 arch.〉指《诗》、《书》、《礼》、《乐》、《易》、《春秋》六种儒家经书 six classics: The Book of Songs, The Classic of Documents, The Book of Rites, The Book of Music, The Book of Changes, and The Spring and Autumn Annals

六路
六路[liù lù] 指上、下、前、后、左、右。泛指周围、各个方面 above, below, front, rear, left and right; around; all aspects：眼观六路，耳听八方 have sharp eyes and keen ears; be observant and watchful

六轮
六轮[liù lún] 转轮手枪的一种，转轮上有六个装子弹的孔 six-shooter; revolver with six cartridges

六部
六部[liù bù] 从隋唐开始，中国封建王朝的中央行政机构一般分为吏、户、礼、兵、刑、工各部，统称六部 Six Ministries, which formed the central government in the feudal dynasties since the Sui and Tang dynasties, arranged in order of importance: Ministry of Personnel, Board of Revenues or Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Rites, Ministry of War, Ministry of Justice, and Ministry of Works

兮
兮[xī]（ㄒㄧ）〈书 fml.〉〈助词 aux.〉跟现代的‘啊’相似 akin to 啊 ā in modern Chinese：大风起兮云飞扬。The high wind rises, and the clouds scud.力拔山兮气盖世。By uprooting the mountain by sheer muscle, the strength of man is unrivalled under heaven.

兰
兰[lán]（ㄌㄢˊ）（蘭）1. 同 same as 兰花 lánhuā 2. 同 same as 兰草 láncǎo 3.古书上指木兰 lily magnolia, as mentioned in ancient books：兰桨 oar made of lily magnolia wood 4.(Lán) 姓 a surname相关词组春兰 | 建兰 | 金兰 | 马兰 | 佩兰 | 玉兰 | 芝兰 | 阿兰若 | 白兰地 | 古兰经 | 荷兰豆 | 可兰经 | 玉兰片 | 君子兰 | 紫罗兰 | 春兰秋菊 | 盂兰盆会 | 伊斯兰教 | 伊斯兰教历兰草 | 兰花 | 兰谱 | 兰若 | 兰章 | 兰花指

兰章
兰章[lán zhāng]〈书 fml.〉美好的文辞（多用于称颂 usu. polite）Your Excellency's beautiful writings

兰花
兰花[lán huā]1.多年生草本植物，叶子丛生，条形，先端尖，春季开花,淡绿色，味芳香，供观赏。花可制香料。orchid (Cymbidium goeringii); perennial plant with narrow, pointed leaves growing in a cluster, blooming in spring, with light green, fragrant flowers, which are appreciated for their beauty and used for making perfume; 亦 also 春兰 chūnlán 2. 同 same as 建兰 jiànlán俗称 popularly called 兰草 láncǎo

兰花指
兰花指[lán huā zhǐ] 拇指和中指相对拳曲、其余三个手指翘起的姿势 orchid fingers; hand gesture with the tips of the thumb and the middle finger touching and the other three fingers raised (usu. made on the stage by a lady to show delicacy and grace)亦 also 兰花手 lánhuāshǒu

兰若
兰若[lán rě] 寺庙 temple; monastery [梵 Sanskrit: āranyakah; 阿兰若：树林，寂静处 forest; quiet place]

兰草
兰草[lán cǎo]1.佩兰 fragrant thoroughwort (Eupatorium fortunei) 2.兰花的俗称 popular name for 兰花 lánhuā

兰谱
兰谱[lán pǔ]结拜盟兄弟时互相交换的帖子，上面写着自己家族的谱系（兰味香，比喻情投意合，《易经·系辞》：同心之言，其臭如兰）genealogical records exchanged by those who have sworn brotherhood (The fragrance of orchid is a token of like-mindedness. The Book of Changes·Great Treatise: ‘The oath of likeminded people is as fragrant as the orchid flower.’)

共
共[gòng]（ㄍㄨㄥˋ）1.相同的；共同具有的 common; general; identical：共性 common character; generality共通 generally applicable, applicable to all 2.共同具有或承受 share：同甘苦，共患难 share weal and woe; go through thick and thin together 3.在一起；一齐 together; at the same time：共鸣 resonance; sympathetic response和平共处 peaceful coexistence 4.一共；总计 altogether; in all; amount to：这两个集子共收小说十二篇。There are altogether 12 novels in these two collections.全书共十卷。The whole book contains 10 volumes. 5.共产党的简称 abbr. for 共产党 gòngchǎndǎng：中共 Communist Party of China〈古 arch.〉 同 same as 恭 gōng; 又同 also same as 供 gōng相关词组公共 | 合共 | 拢共 | 满共 | 通共 | 统共 | 一共 | 与共 | 总共 | 不共戴天 | 公共关系 | 公共积累 | 公共汽车 | 国际共管 | 和平共处 | 和衷共济 | 核磁共振 | 奇文共赏 | 同甘共苦 | 同舟共济 | 雅俗共赏 | 有目共睹 | 有目共赏 | 患难与共 | 生死与共 | 民族共同语 | 科学共产主义 | 和平共处五项原则共处 | 共存 | 共度 | 共犯 | 共管 | 共和 | 共计 | 共居 | 共聚 | 共勉 | 共鸣 | 共栖 | 共生 | 共识 | 共事 | 共通 | 共同 | 共性 | 共议 | 共振 | 共总 | 共产党 | 共和国 | 共和制 | 共青团 | 共同体 | 共产主义 | 共同市场 | 共同语言 | 共产主义青年团

共事
共事[gòng shì] 在一起工作 work together; be fellow workers：我和他共事多年，对他比较了解。I have worked with him for many years and therefore know him quite well.

共产主义
共产主义[gòng chǎn zhǔ yì]1.指无产阶级的整个思想体系 whole system of proletarian ideology; 另见  科学社会主义 kēxué shèhuì zhǔyì 2.人类最理想的社会制度。它在发展上分两个阶段，初级阶段是社会主义，高级阶段是共产主义。通常所说的共产主义，指共产主义的高级阶段。在这个阶段，生产力高度发展，社会产品极大丰富，人们具有高度的思想觉悟，劳动成为生活的第一需要，消灭了三大差别，实行共产主义公有制，分配原则是‘各尽所能，按需分配’。 communism; the most ideal social system of mankind. It is divided into two stages of development, the primary stage being socialism and the advanced stage being communism. Communism in the general sense refers to the advanced stage, in which the productive force is highly developed, social products are in great abundance, the people have a high level of political consciousness, working becomes the first need of their life, the ‘three major differences’ are eliminated, communist public ownership is practised, and the principle of distribution is ‘from each according to his ability, to each according to his needs’.

共产主义青年团
共产主义青年团[gòng chǎn zhǔ yì qīng nián tuán] 在共产党领导下的先进青年的群众性组织。中国共产主义青年团是党的有力助手，它团结和教育青年一代为共产主义事业而奋斗。 Communist Youth League; mass organization of progressive youth under the leadership of the Communist Party. The Communist Youth League of China is a powerful assistant to the Communist Party; it unites and educates the young generation to strive for the Communist cause. 简称 abbr. 共青团 gòngqīngtuán

共产党
共产党[gòng chǎn dǎng] 无产阶级的政党。共产党是无产阶级的先锋队，是无产阶级的阶级组织的最高形式。它的指导思想是马克思列宁主义，目的是领导无产阶级和其他一切被压迫的劳动人民，通过革命斗争夺取政权，用无产阶级专政代替资产阶级专政，实现社会主义和共产主义。中国共产党成立于1921年7月。 Communist Party; proletarian political party. The Communist Party is the vanguard of the proletariat and the highest form of the class organization of the proletariat. Its guiding thought is Marxism-Leninism; its aim is to lead the proletariat and all other oppressed working people to seize political power through revolutionary struggle, replace the dictatorship of the bourgeoisie with the dictatorship of the proletariat and achieve socialism and communism. The Communist Party of China was founded on July 1, 1921.

共勉
共勉[gòng miǎn] 共同努力；互相勉励 make joint efforts; encourage each other：提出这一希望，并与你共勉。I propose this expectation as our mutual encouragement.

共同
共同[gòng tóng]1.属于大家的；彼此都具有的 belonging to, or shared by all：共同点 common ground共同语言 common language搞好经济建设是全国人民的共同心愿。It is the common desire of the people of the whole country to carry out economic construction well. 2.大家一起（做） work together：共同努力 make joint efforts

共同体
共同体[gòng tóng tǐ]1.人们在共同条件下结成的集体 community; group of people living together as a social unit and having interests, work, etc. in common 2.由若干国家在某一方面组成的集体组织 commonwealth; group of nations associated for the same interests in a certain field

共同市场
共同市场[gòng tóng shì chǎng] 若干国家为了共同的政治、经济利益而组成的相互合作的统一市场 common market; a unified market of mutual cooperation formed by several countries bound by common political and economic interests

共同语言
共同语言[gòng tóng yǔ yán] 指相同的思想、认识和生活情趣等 common language; same ideas, understanding and interests：他俩缺乏共同语言，难以长期在一起生活。As the two of them lack common language, it is difficult for them to live together.

共和
共和[gòng hé]1.历史上称西周从厉王失政到宣王执政之间的十四年为共和。共和元年为公元前841年。 The intervening 14 years between the loss of power by King Li and the takeover of the power by King Xuan in the Western Zhou Dynasty is historically called the reign of Gonghe. The first year of the Gonghe reign is 841 B.C. 2. 同 same as 共和制 gònghézhì

共和制
共和制[gòng hé zhì] 国家元首和国家权力机关定期由选举产生的一种政治制度 republicanism; political system under which the head of state and the organ of state power are elected periodically

共和国
共和国[gòng hé guó] 实施共和政体的国家 republic; country in which the republican form of government is adopted

共处
共处[gòng chǔ] 相处；共同存在 live together, get along with each other; coexist：共处一室 live in the same room和平共处 peaceful coexistence

共存
共存[gòng cún] 共同存在 coexist; exist together

共居
共居[gòng jū] 同时存在（多指抽象事物 oft. of sth. abstract）exist simultaneously; exist together; coexist：矛盾的两个方面因一定的条件共居于一个统一体中。The two aspects of a contradiction coexist in a single entity.

共度
共度[gòng dù] 共同度过 spend time together; tide over together：共度难关 tide over a difficulty (crisis) together全国各民族共度佳节。The people of different ethnic groups throughout the country celebrate the festival together.

共性
共性[gòng xìng] 指不同事物所共同具有的普遍性质 general character shared by different things：各种地方戏都有其个性，但作为戏曲又有其共性。Each local opera has its own individuality, but they share some general characteristics as operas.

共总
共总[gòng zǒng] 一共；总共 altogether; add up to; in all; in the aggregate：这几笔账共总多少？How much do all these accounts add up to? or How much do all these accounts come to?

共振
共振[gòng zhèn] 两个振动频率相同的物体，当一个发生振动时，引起另一个物体振动的现象 resonance; vibration produced in one object by another object vibrating at the same frequency

共栖
共栖[gòng qī] 两种不同的生物生活在一起，不是相依生存，只对其中一种有利，这种生活方式叫做共栖。如文鸟专在胡蜂窝的附近筑巢，因为胡蜂有毒刺，许多动物不敢接近，文鸟也就得到保护。 commensalism; (of two species of organisms) live together not in mutual dependence but with one getting benefits from the other. For example, mannikins like to build their nests near wasp honeycombs, because wasps have vicious stings which many animals are afraid of, thus providing protection to the mannikins.

共犯
共犯[gòng fàn]1.共同犯罪 joint crime; joint offence 2.共同犯罪中的罪犯 accomplice

共生
共生[gòng shēng] 两种不同的生物生活在一起，相依生存，对彼此都有利，这种生活方式叫做共生。如白蚁肠内的鞭毛虫帮助白蚁消化木材纤维，白蚁给鞭毛虫提供养料，如果分离，二者都不能独立生存。 intergrowth; symbiosis; two species of organisms living together in mutual beneficial dependence. For example, the flagellate in the intestine of the termite helps to digest wood fibre, while the termite supplies nutriment to the flagellate. If separated, neither can survive.

共管
共管[gòng guǎn]1.共同管理 joint rule; joint control; joint management：社会治安需要动员全社会的力量齐抓共管。The maintenance of the public order calls for the joint efforts of the whole society. 2.国际共管的简称 abbr. for 国际共管 guójì gòngguǎn

共聚
共聚[gòng jù] 两种或两种以上的单体聚合成高分子化合物。如丁二烯和苯乙烯聚合成丁苯橡胶。 copolymerization; two or more monomers polymerize into a high molecular compound. For example, butadiene and styrene form styrene-butadiene rubber by polymerization.

共计
共计[gòng jì]1.合起来计算 add up to：共计三千万元 total 30 million yuan 2.共同计议；共议 discuss together：共计大事 discuss an important matter together

共议
共议[gòng yì] 共同商议 discuss together：共议国是 discuss state affairs together

共识
共识[gòng shí] 共同的认识 common understanding; consensus：经过多次讨论，双方消除了分歧，达成共识。The two sides eliminated their differences and reached a common understanding after many discussions.对国家前途的共识使他们成为挚友。The common understanding of the future of the nation brings them together as true friends.

共通
共通[gòng tōng]1.通行于或适用于各方面的 applicable to all aspects; generally applicable：共通的道理 generally applicable argument 2. 同 same as 共同 gòngtóng ①：这三篇习作有一个共通的毛病。There is a common problem in the three compositions.

共青团
共青团[gòng qīng tuán] 共产主义青年团的简称 abbr. for 共产主义青年团 gòngchǎn zhǔyì qīngniántuán

共鸣
共鸣[gòng míng]1.物体因共振而发声的现象，如两个频率相同的音叉靠近，其中一个振动发声时，另一个也会发声 resonance; sound produced in an object by sound or vibrations of a similar frequency from another object. For example, when two tuning forks are brought close to each other, and if one of them is vibrating and emitting a sound, the other produces a sound as well. 2.由别人的某种情绪引起的相同的情绪 sympathetic feeling; same feeling aroused by a certain feeling of another person：诗人的爱国主义思想感染了读者，引起了他们的共鸣。The patriotic feelings of the poet affected his readers and aroused their sympathy.

关
关[guān]（ㄍㄨㄢ）（關、関）1.使开着的物体合拢 shut; close：关窗户 close the window把抽屉关上。Close the drawer. 2.使机器等停止运转；使电气装置结束工作状态 turn off; switch off an electrical device：关机 switch off the machine关灯 turn off the light关电视 turn off the television set 3.放在里面不使出来 shut in; lock up：鸟儿关在笼子里。The bird is shut up in the cage.监狱是关犯人的。A prison is where criminals are jailed. 4.（企业等）倒闭；歇业 close down; shut a business：有一年，镇上关了好几家店铺。There was a year in which quite a few shops in the town were closed down. 5.〈古代 arch.〉在交通险要或边境出入的地方设置的守卫处所 pass; guard post set up at a strategically located point and frontier point of entrance and exit：关口 strategic pass关防 military installation at a strategical point on the border山海关 Shanhai Pass嘉峪关 Jiayu Pass我的责任就是不让废品混过关去。My duty is to prevent rejects from passing the checks. 6.城门外附近的地区 area just outside a city gate：城关 suburban area北关 north suburbs关厢 neighbourhood outside of a city gate 7.门栓 door bolt：门插关儿 bolt; latch斩关落锁 cut down the bolt and padlock 8.‘关上’的简称 short form for 关上 guānshàng 9.货物出口和入口收税的地方 place where customs are paid and freight is cleared for entering and leaving：海关 customs关税 customs duty; tariff 10.〈比喻 fig.〉重要的转折点或不容易度过的一段时间 barrier; critical juncture：难关 barrier; difficulty只要突破这一关，就好办了。Once we have got over this difficulty, it will be plain sailing. or It will be smooth sailing once you overcome this hurdle. 11.起转折关联作用的部分 key part; crucial part：机关 central part of a machinery关节 joint关键 key 12.牵连；关系 concern; involve：这些见解很关重要。These views are extremely important.此事与他无关。This has nothing to do with him.交有关部门处理 leave it to the department concerned 13.发放或领取（工资）give out or draw (pay)：关饷 (of soldiers, policemen, etc.) get paid 14.(Guān) 姓 a surname相关词组把关 | 报关 | 闭关 | 边关 | 城关 | 闯关 | 公关 | 攻关 | 过关 | 海关 | 机关 | 交关 | 结关 | 开关 | 难关 | 年关 | 双关 | 通关 | 无关 | 险关 | 相关 | 雄关 | 牙关 | 验关 | 有关 | 插关儿 | 闯关东 | 机关报 | 机关枪 | 拉关系 | 买关节 | 卖关节 | 卖关子 | 没关系 | 阳关道 | 转关系 | 打通关 | 鬼门关 | 浒墅关 | 闭关锁国 | 闭关自守 | 过关斩将 | 机关刊物 | 无关宏旨 | 无关痛痒 | 保护关税 | 公共关系 | 临终关怀 | 门插关儿 | 漠不关心 | 轻机关枪 | 群众关系 | 社会关系 | 生产关系 | 贼走关门 | 重机关枪 | 国家机关 | 生死攸关 | 痛痒相关 | 息息相关 | 性命交关 | 自治机关 | 高射机关枪关爱 | 关隘 | 关碍 | 关闭 | 关尺 | 关东 | 关防 | 关乎 | 关怀 | 关键 | 关节 | 关津 | 关紧 | 关卡 | 关口 | 关里 | 关连 | 关联 | 关门 | 关内 | 关切 | 关塞 | 关山 | 关上 | 关涉 | 关书 | 关税 | 关说 | 关头 | 关外 | 关系 | 关厢 | 关饷 | 关心 | 关押 | 关于 | 关张 | 关照 | 关中 | 关注 | 关子 | 关东糖 | 关联词

关上
关上[guān shàng]另见  寸口 cùnkǒu

关东
关东[guān dōng] 指山海关以东一带地区，泛指东北各省 area east of Shanhai Pass; (in a broad sense) provinces in northeast China：闯关东 go to northeast China to earn a living; make a difficult journey to northeast China to eke out a living亦 also 关外 Guānwài

关东糖
关东糖[guān dōng táng] 一种麦芽糖，用麦芽和米或杂粮制成，白色或带黄色 north-eastern candy; a kind of malt candy made of malt and rice or other cereals, white or yellowish

关中
关中[guān zhōng] 指陕西渭河流域一带 area in the Weihe River basin; the Central Shaanxi Plain

关乎
关乎[guān hū] 关系到；涉及 concern; relate to; involve：调整物价是关乎人民生活的一件大事。Price adjustment is a matter of vital importance to the life of the people.

关书
关书[guān shū]〈旧时 old〉聘请教师或幕僚的文书 contract for employing a teacher or an assistant

关于
关于[guān yú]1.〈介词 prep.〉引进某种行为的关系者，组成介词结构做状语 [used as a relation or function word, such as ‘about’, ‘on’, ‘with regard to’, and ‘concerning’, that connects an action to form a prepositional phrase as an adverbial modifier] about; with regard to：关于兴修水利，上级已经做了指示。The higher authorities have issued an instruction on building water conservancy projects. 2.〈介词 prep.〉引进某种事物的关系者，组成介词结构做定语（后面要加‘的’），或在‘是…的’式中做谓语 [used as a relation or function word that connects a thing to form a prepositional phrase as an attribute or a predicate]：他读了几本关于政治经济学的书。He read a few books on political economy.今天在厂里开了一个会，是关于爱国卫生运动的。A meeting was held in the factory concerning the patriotic public sanitation campaign.注意 NOTE：(a) 表示关涉，用‘关于’不用‘对于’，如：关于织女星，民间有个美丽的传说。 when indicating ‘related to’ or ‘relating to’, use 关于 instead of 对于 duìyú，e.g. There is a beautiful legend about the Vega. 指出对象，用‘对于’不用‘关于’ when indicating an object, use 对于 instead of 关于，如 e.g. 对于文化遗产，我们必须进行研究分析。Speaking of cultural legacy, we must study and analyse it. 兼有两种情况的可以用‘关于’，也可以用‘对于’ in a situation involving both cases, use either 关于 or 对于，如 e.g. 关于（对于）订立公约，大家都很赞成。As to concluding a public agreement, everybody said yes. (b)‘关于’有提示性质，用‘关于’组成的介词结构，可以单独作文章的题目 prepositional structure using 关于 can be used as the title of an article, 如 e.g. 关于人生观 on outlook on life关于杂文 on essays；用‘对于’组成的介词结构，只有跟名词组成偏正词组，才能作题目 prepositional structure using 对于 can be used as the title of an article only when it is combined with a noun to form a word group consisting of a modifier and the word it modifies,如 e.g. 对于百花齐放政策的认识 on (our) understanding of the policy of ‘letting a hundred flowers blossom’

关内
关内[guān nèi] 指山海关以西或嘉峪关以东一带地区 area to the west of Shanhai Pass or to the east of Jiayu Pass

关切
关切[guān qiè]1.亲切 considerate; thoughtful：他待人非常和蔼、关切。He's very kind and considerate (or thoughtful). 2.关心 be deeply concerned about; show one's concern over; feel concern over：感谢同志们对我的关切。I'm grateful to you comrades for your deep concern.对他的处境深表关切。We feel deep concern over his circumstances.

关卡
关卡[guān qiǎ] 为收税或警备在交通要道设立的检查站、岗哨 toll gate or a checkpoint at a vital communication line

关厢
关厢[guān xiāng] 城门外大街和附近的地区 street and its adjoining area just outside a city gate; neighbourhood outside of a city gate

关口
关口[guān kǒu]1.来往必须经过的处所 strategic pass：把守关口 guard a strategic pass 2.关键地方；关头 crucial point; juncture

关塞
关塞[guān sài] 关口上的要塞 frontier fortress

关外
关外[guān wài] 指山海关以东或嘉峪关以西一带地区 areas to the east of Shanhai Pass or to the west of Jiayu Pass

关头
关头[guān tóu] 起决定作用的时机或转折点 decisive juncture; turning point; key moment：紧要关头 critical moment危急关头 critical moment (or juncture)

关子
关子[guān zi] 小说、戏剧情节中最紧要、最吸引人的地方 climax in a novel or drama；〈比喻 fig.〉事情的关键 key to sth.另见  卖关子 mài guān·zi

关尺
关尺[guān chǐ]〈旧时 old〉海关收税用的标准尺，1关尺合0.358米 customs unit for measuring the length, with one unit equal to 0.358 metre

关山
关山[guān shān] 关口和山岳 frontier passes and mountains：关山迢递（形容路途遥远）remote passes and mountains

关张
关张[guān zhāng] 指商店停止营业，也指商店倒闭 (of a shop) close for the day; go out of business

关心
关心[guān xīn]（把人或事物）常放在心上；重视和爱护 have sb. or sth. on one's mind; pay great attention to and care for; be concerned about; show solicitude for; care for; be interested in：关心群众生活 care for the livelihood of the masses这是厂里的大事，希望大家多关点儿心。This is a matter of importance to our factory. I hope that everyone will show more interest in it.

关怀
关怀[guān huái] 同 same as 关心 guān∥xīn：关怀备至 show the utmost solicitude亲切关怀 show loving care for; pay kind attention to关怀青年人的成长 show concern for the growth of the young people

关押
关押[guān yā] 把犯罪的人关起来 lock up; imprison; put under detention; put in prison：关押犯人 put a criminal in prison

关注
关注[guān zhù] 关心重视 follow with interest; pay close attention to; show solicitude for：多蒙关注。Thanks for your concern (or interest).这件事引起了各界人士的关注。This happening has aroused concern among all walks of life.

关津
关津[guān jīn]〈书 fml.〉关口和渡口，也指设在关口或渡口的关卡 pass and ferry; checkpoint of a tax office at a pass or ferry

关涉
关涉[guān shè] 关联；牵涉 involve; concern; be related to：他与此案毫无关涉。He is not at all involved in the case.

关照
关照[guān zhào]1.关心照顾 look after; take care of; keep an eye on：我走后，这里的工作请你多多关照。When I'm gone, would you please look after the work here. 2.互相照应，全面安排 look after each other and make an overall arrangement 3.口头通知 notify by word of mouth; tell：你关照食堂一声，给开会的人留饭。Tell the cafeteria to save some food for those attending the meeting.

关爱
关爱[guān ài] 关怀爱护 express solicitude for the well-being of：老师的关爱使她很受感动。She was greatly moved by the solicitude of the teacher.

关碍
关碍[guā nài] 妨碍；阻碍 obstruct; hinder：这次事故对公司信誉大有关碍。The company's prestige was greatly damaged by the accident.

关税
关税[guān shuì] 国家对进出口商品所征收的税 tax imposed on import and export goods by a government; customs duty; customs; tariff

关系
关系[guān xì]1.事物之间相互作用、相互影响的状态 relation; relationship：正确处理科学技术普及和提高的关系 correctly handle the relationship between the popularization and the development of science and technology这个电门跟那盏灯没有关系。This switch has nothing to do with the light. 2.人和人或人和事物之间的某种性质的联系 connection between or among persons or between a person and a thing; connections; relations; relationship：拉关系 try to establish a relationship with sb.; cotton up to关系户 persons or groups having dealings with each other that promote their common interests同志关系 comradeship军民关系 relationship between the army and the people社会关系 social connections 3.对有关事物的影响或重要性；值得注意的地方（常跟‘没有、有’连用 oft. used together with 没有 méi·yǒu, 有 yǒu）impact on; importance to; sth. worth noting; relevance; bearing; influence; significance：这一点很有关系。This matters a lot.没有关系，修理修理照样儿能用。It doesn't matter. After some repair, it can be used again all the same. 4.泛指原因、条件等 cause; condition：由于时间关系，暂时谈到这里为止。Since time is limited, the talk has to stop here this time. 5.表明有某种组织关系的证件 document showing identity, membership in or connection with an organization：随身带上团的关系。Bring your Youth League credentials with you. 6.关联；牵涉 relating to; involve; concern; affect; have a bearing on; have to do with：棉花是关系到国计民生的重要物资。Cotton is a major material that has an important bearing on the national economy and the people's livelihood.

关紧
关紧[guān jǐn]〈方 dial.〉要紧 important; essential

关联
关联[guān lián] 事物相互之间发生牵连和影响 interrelation among different things; be related; be connected：国民经济各部门是互相关联互相依存的。The various sectors of the national economy are interrelated and interdependent.这可是关联着生命安全的大事。This is a matte of vital importance, with life at stake.

关联词
关联词[guān lián cí] 在语句中起关联作用的词语。如‘因为…所以…’、‘一方面…，另一方面…’、‘总而言之’等。 conjunction; word used to connect words, phrases, clauses, sentences, such as ‘because ...’, ‘therefore’, ‘on the one hand ..., on the other hand ...’, ‘in short’, etc.

关节
关节[guān jié]1.骨头互相连接的地方。根据构造可分为三种，不动的如头骨的各关节，稍动的如椎骨的关节，活动的如四肢的关节。 joint; joint of bones. There are three kinds of joints: the immovable joints of the skull, the slightly movable joints of the vertebra and the movable joints of the limbs. 2.起关键性作用的环节 crucial link; key (or crucial) link; key (or crucial) point：这是问题关节的所在。This is the crux of the problem.认真分析，找出关节。Find out the crucial link through a careful analysis. 3.指暗中行贿勾通官府或官员的事 bribe an official：打关节 practise bribery暗通关节 bribe covertly

关说
关说[guān shuō]〈书 fml.〉代人陈说；从中给人说好话 put in a word for sb.; speak in sb.'s favour

关连
关连[guān lián] 同 same as 关联 guānlián

关里
关里[guān lǐ] 同 same as 关内 Guānnèi

关键
关键[guān jiàn]1.门闩或功能类似门闩的东西 door bolt; door bar 2.〈比喻 fig.〉事物最关紧要的部分；对情况起决定作用的因素 crucial part of a matter; decisive factor; key; hinge; crux：摸清情况是解决问题的关键。A clear knowledge of the situation is the key to solving the problem.办好学校关键在于提高教学质量。The decisive factor for running the school well is to improve teaching quality. 3.最关紧要的 the most important：关键问题 crucial problem关键时刻 critical moment

关门
关门[guān mén]1.〈比喻 fig.〉停业 (of a shop, etc.) close; close down 2.〈比喻 fig.〉把话说死，无商量余地 refuse discussion or consideration 3.〈比喻 fig.〉不愿容纳 refuse to admit others：关门主义 closed-doorism; exclusionism 4.指最后的 final：关门之作 final piece of writing关门弟子 final disciple关门[guān mén] 关口上的门 gate of a pass

关闭
关闭[guān bì]1. 同 same as 关 guān ①：门窗都紧紧关闭着。The doors and windows were all tightly closed.关闭机场 close the airport 2.企业、商店、学校等歇业或停办 (of an enterprise, a shop, a school, etc.) close down; shut down：关闭了几所学校。Some schools were closed down.

关防
关防[guān fáng]1.防止泄漏机密的措施 security measures：关防严密 tight security measures 2.〈旧时 old〉政府机关或军队用的印信，多为长方形 government or army seal (usu. rectangular in shape) 3.〈书 fml.〉有驻军防守的关口要塞 guarded fortress at a strategic point

关隘
关隘[guān ài]〈书 fml.〉险要的关口 strategic pass

关饷
关饷[guān xiǎng]（军队）发饷，泛指发工资 pay (esp. of soldiers)

兴
兴[xīng]（ㄒㄧㄥ）（興）1.兴盛；流行 prosper; rise; prevail; become popular：复兴 rejuvenate; revive; reinvigorate新兴 newly emerging; rising现在已经不兴这种式样了。This style is no longer in vogue. 2.使盛行 encourage; promote：大兴调查研究之风 energetically encourage the practice of investigation and study 3.开始；发动；创立 start; begin：兴办 run; set up; build; establish兴工 start work兴利除弊 promote what is beneficial and get rid of what is harmful百废俱兴。All neglected tasks are being undertaken. 4.起；起来 get up; rise：晨兴（早晨起来）get up in the morning夙兴夜寐 rise early and retire late 5.〈方 dial.〉准许（多用于否定式 oft. used in the negative）permit; allow：说话要有根据，不兴胡说。Any statement should be based on facts. Don't talk on the hoof. 6.〈方 dial.〉或许 maybe; perhaps：明天他也兴来，也兴不来。Maybe he'll come tomorrow, maybe not. 7.(Xīng) 姓 a surname另见  xìng兴[xìng]（ㄒㄧㄥˋ）（興）兴致；兴趣 interest; mood or desire to do sth.; excitement：豪兴 high spirits; keep interest助兴 add to the fun; make things more lively; liven up things败兴 disappointed; dampen one's enthusiasm雅兴 interest in refined pursuits游兴 interest in travelling另见  xīng相关词组败兴 | 背兴 | 勃兴 | 不兴 | 乘兴 | 复兴 | 高兴 | 豪兴 | 即兴 | 尽兴 | 酒兴 | 扫兴 | 诗兴 | 时兴 | 谈兴 | 喜兴 | 新兴 | 雅兴 | 意兴 | 游兴 | 余兴 | 振兴 | 中兴 | 助兴 | 作兴 | 绍兴酒 | 大兴土木 | 方兴未艾 | 夙兴夜寐 | 多难兴邦 | 科教兴国 | 望洋兴叹 | 百废俱兴 | 文艺复兴兴办 | 兴兵 | 兴奋 | 兴革 | 兴工 | 兴国 | 兴会 | 兴建 | 兴隆 | 兴起 | 兴趣 | 兴盛 | 兴师 | 兴衰 | 兴叹 | 兴头 | 兴亡 | 兴旺 | 兴味 | 兴修 | 兴许 | 兴学 | 兴致 | 兴冲冲 | 兴风作浪 | 兴高采烈 | 兴利除弊 | 兴师动众 | 兴头儿上 | 兴妖作怪

兴亡
兴亡[xīng wáng]兴盛和灭亡（多指国家 of a nation）rise and fall：天下兴亡，匹夫有责。Everyone of its citizens is responsible for the fate of the nation.

兴会
兴会[xìng huì] 因偶然有所感受而发生的意趣 sudden flash of inspiration; brain wave：乘一时的兴会，信手写了这首诗。This poem was improvised on the spur of the moment.

兴修
兴修[xīng xiū]开始修建（多指规模较大的）start construction (on a large project); start building (on an extensive scale)：兴修铁路 start railway construction兴修水利 undertake water conservancy projects

兴兵
兴兵[xīng bīng] 起兵 start military operations; send an army：兴兵讨伐 send a punitive expedition against; declare war on sb.

兴冲冲
兴冲冲[xìng chōng chōng]（～的 xìngchōngchōng·de）形容兴致很高 feel elated; (do sth.) with joy and excitement; excitedly

兴利除弊
兴利除弊[xīng lì chú bì] 兴办有利的事业，除去弊端 promote what is beneficial and abolish what is harmful

兴办
兴办[xīng bàn]创办（事业）initiate; set up：兴办学校 set up a school兴办企业 start up an enterprise

兴叹
兴叹[xīng tàn]〈书 fml.〉发出感叹声 heave a sigh; lament; bemoan：望洋兴叹 lament one's smallness before a vast ocean; feel powerless and frustrated in the face of a gigantic task

兴味
兴味[xìng wèi] 兴趣 interest：饶有兴味 with keen interest兴味索然 be not interested in; have no interest in; lose interest; be bored stiff

兴国
兴国[xīng guó] 使国家振兴 rejuvenate a country：科学兴国 make a country strong by developing sciences; rejuvenate a country through science

兴头
兴头[xìng tou]1.因为高兴或感兴趣而产生的劲头 enthusiasm; keen interest：兴头十足 keen interest; be full of interest; be highly interested in 2.〈方 dial.〉高兴；得意 be elated; be delighted：前呼后拥，好不兴头。How pleased he was to be accompanied by a large number of retainers!

兴头儿上
兴头儿上[xìng tóu r shang] 兴头正足的时候 at the height of one's enthusiasm; in high spirits：人家正在兴头儿上，你干吗要泼冷水！They are in high spirits; why should you pour cold water on their enthusiasm?

兴奋
兴奋[xīng fèn]1.振奋；激动 be excited 2.大脑皮层的两种基本神经活动过程之一，是在外部或内部刺激之下产生的。兴奋引起或增强皮层和相应器官机能的活动状态，如肌肉的收缩、腺体的分泌等。excitation; one of two basic processes of activity of the cerebral cortex resulting from external or internal stimulation. Excitation causes or increases the activity of the functions of the cortex and the corresponding organs, as contraction of the muscles and secretion of glands. 3.使兴奋 excite; stimulate：兴奋剂 stimulant; excitant; dope

兴妖作怪
兴妖作怪[xīng yāo zuò guài]〈比喻 fig.〉坏人进行捣乱，坏思想扩大影响 conjure up demons to make trouble; stir up trouble; make trouble or spread a pernicious idea

兴学
兴学[xīng xué] 兴办学校，振兴教育 (of an individual or groups of people) set up schools to rejuvenate education：捐资兴学 make donations for the setting up of schools

兴工
兴工[xīng gōng] 动工；开工 start work; start construction：破土兴工 break ground to start construction

兴师
兴师[xīng shī]〈书 fml.〉兴兵；起兵 send an army; dispatch troops：兴师问罪 send a punitive expedition

兴师动众
兴师动众[xīng shī dòng zhòng]发动很多人做某件事（多含不值得意）get a lot of people involved; mobilize one's forces (usu. for sth. not worth the effort)

兴建
兴建[xīng jiàn]开始建筑（多指规模较大的）begin to build; construct ( usu. a large project)：兴建钢铁基地 build an iron and steel complex

兴旺
兴旺[xīng wàng] 兴盛；旺盛 prosper; flourish; thrive：人丁兴旺 thriving population六畜兴旺 thriving of the domestic animals

兴盛
兴盛[xīng shèng] 蓬勃发展 prosper; flourish; thrive; be in the ascendant：国家兴盛。The nation is prosperous.事业兴盛。Business is thriving.

兴致
兴致[xìng zhì] 兴趣 interest; mood to enjoy：兴致勃勃 full of zest; in high spirits

兴衰
兴衰[xīng shuāi] 兴盛和衰落 rise and decline; rise and fall

兴许
兴许[xīng xǔ] 也许；或许 perhaps; maybe：你问问老王，他兴许知道。Ask Lao Wang. He knows it perhaps.

兴起
兴起[xīng qǐ]1.开始出现并兴盛起来 rise; give rise to; spring up; emerge：各地兴起绿化热潮。A tree-planting upsurge has sprung up in different parts of the country. 2.〈书 fml.〉因感动而奋起 rise in excitement; be aroused：闻风兴起 spring to action upon hearing the news

兴趣
兴趣[xìng qù] 喜好的情绪 interest：我对下棋不感兴趣。I'm not interested in chess.人们怀着极大的兴趣参观了画展。People visited the exhibition of paintings with great interest.

兴隆
兴隆[xīng lóng] 兴盛 prosperous; thriving; flourishing; brisk：生意兴隆。Business is brisk.

兴革
兴革[xīng gé]〈书 fml.〉兴办和革除 initiation (of the new) and abolition (of the old); reform

兴风作浪
兴风作浪[xīng fēng zuò làng]〈比喻 fig.〉挑起事端或进行破坏活动 stir up trouble or carry out sabotaging activities; make trouble; fan the flames of disorder

兴高采烈
兴高采烈[xìng gāo cǎi liè] 兴致高，情绪热烈 in high spirits; excited; jubilant

兵
兵[bīng]（ㄅㄧㄥ）1.兵器 weapons; arms：短兵相接 fight at close quarters秣马厉兵 feed the horses and sharpen the weapons - prepare for battle 2.军人；军队 soldier; army; troops：当兵 join the army; be a soldier兵种 branch of one of the services骑兵 cavalry; horse soldier; cavalryman 3.军队中的最基层成员 members of the army at the grassroots level; rank-and-file soldier; private：上等兵 Private First Class 4.关于军事或战争的 military; related to war：兵法 art of war; military strategy and tactics兵书 book or treatise on the art of war相关词组败兵 | 搬兵 | 标兵 | 步兵 | 裁兵 | 残兵 | 撤兵 | 陈兵 | 称兵 | 出兵 | 大兵 | 刀兵 | 动兵 | 发兵 | 分兵 | 伏兵 | 工兵 | 官兵 | 号兵 | 护兵 | 甲兵 | 尖兵 | 交兵 | 进兵 | 精兵 | 救兵 | 礼兵 | 练兵 | 列兵 | 乱兵 | 弭兵 | 民兵 | 募兵 | 炮兵 | 奇兵 | 骑兵 | 起兵 | 伞兵 | 哨兵 | 士兵 | 收兵 | 水兵 | 逃兵 | 天兵 | 退兵 | 屯兵 | 卫兵 | 宪兵 | 兴兵 | 雄兵 | 养兵 | 疑兵 | 用兵 | 援兵 | 阅兵 | 招兵 | 征兵 | 重兵 | 抓兵 | 募兵制 | 工程兵 | 航空兵 | 雷达兵 | 排头兵 | 勤务兵 | 上等兵 | 坦克兵 | 特种兵 | 通信兵 | 义务兵 | 志愿兵 | 装甲兵 | 子弟兵 | 哀兵必胜 | 按兵不动 | 短兵相接 | 缓兵之计 | 精兵简政 | 厉兵秣马 | 穷兵黩武 | 散兵游勇 | 损兵折将 | 虾兵蟹将 | 招兵买马 | 志愿兵制 | 草木皆兵 | 老弱残兵 | 秣马厉兵 | 先礼后兵 | 纸上谈兵 | 雇佣兵役制 | 义务兵役制 | 赔了夫人又折兵兵变 | 兵差 | 兵车 | 兵船 | 兵丁 | 兵法 | 兵符 | 兵戈 | 兵革 | 兵火 | 兵家 | 兵舰 | 兵谏 | 兵力 | 兵乱 | 兵痞 | 兵棋 | 兵器 | 兵权 | 兵戎 | 兵士 | 兵书 | 兵团 | 兵燹 | 兵饷 | 兵役 | 兵营 | 兵勇 | 兵员 | 兵源 | 兵灾 | 兵站 | 兵种 | 兵卒 | 兵工厂 | 兵马俑 | 兵役法 | 兵油子 | 兵不血刃 | 兵不厌诈 | 兵贵神速 | 兵荒马乱 | 兵临城下 | 兵强马壮 | 兵来将挡，水来土掩

兵丁
兵丁[bīng dīng] 士兵的旧称 old name for rank-and-file soldier

兵不厌诈
兵不厌诈[bīng bù yàn zhà] 用兵打仗可以使用欺诈的办法迷惑敌人 deception is justified in war; in war nothing is too deceitful; there can never be too much deception in war; all is fair in war；（不厌 bu yan：不排斥；不以为非 it is justifiable to; it is not incorrect to; 语本《韩非子·难一》：‘战阵之间，不厌诈伪’Hanfeizi·Rebuttals (I):‘There can never be too much deception in war.’）

兵不血刃
兵不血刃[bīng bù xuè rèn] 兵器上面没有沾血，指未经交锋而取得胜利 with blades innocent of blood - win victory without shedding a drop of blood or firing a shot

兵临城下
兵临城下[bīng lín chéng xià]指大军压境城被围困。形容形势危急。the enemy has reached the city gates; the city is under siege; enemy troops are at the city gate; the situation is dangerous

兵书
兵书[bīng shū] 讲兵法的书 book on the art of war

兵乱
兵乱[bīng luàn] 由战争造成的骚扰和灾害；兵灾 turmoil caused by war：屡遭兵乱 repeatedly ravaged by war

兵力
兵力[bīng lì] 军队的实力，包括人员和武器装备等 armed forces; troops; military strength including troops and weaponry：兵力雄厚 formidable military strength集中兵力 concentrate one's forces or troops

兵勇
兵勇[bīng yǒng]〈旧指 old〉士兵 rank-and-file soldier; armyman

兵卒
兵卒[bīng zú] 士兵的旧称 old name for soldier

兵变
兵变[bīng biàn] 军队哗变 mutiny：发动兵变 commit mutiny

兵员
兵员[bīng yuán] 兵；战士 ①（总称 collect.）soldiers; troops：补充兵员 replenish with more troops五十万兵员 500,000 troops; 500,000-strong army

兵器
兵器[bīng qì] 同 same as 武器 wǔqì ①

兵团
兵团[bīng tuán]1.军队的一级组织，下辖几个军或师 large military unit consisting of several armies or divisions; army group; formation; corps 2.泛指团以上的部队 army units above the regimental level; troop formation; armed force：主力兵团 main force地方兵团 local armed forces

兵士
兵士[bīng shì] 士兵 private; rank-and-file soldier

兵家
兵家[bīng jiā]1.〈古代 arch.〉指军事家 military strategist 2.用兵的人 military commander：胜败乃兵家常事。For a military commander, winning or losing a battle is commonplace.徐州历来为兵家必争之地。Xuzhou has long been a bone of contention among warring strategists.

兵工厂
兵工厂[bīng gōng chǎng] 制造武器装备的工厂 arsenal; munitions or ordnance factory; factory for manufacturing military equipment or munitions

兵差
兵差[bīng chāi]〈旧时 old〉军队强迫人民替他们做的劳役，主要是从事运输等 army corvée; conscript labour; corvée labour that civilians were forced into by the army in former times, mainly transport, etc.

兵强马壮
兵强马壮[bīng qiáng mǎ zhuàng] 形容军队实力强，富有战斗力 strong soldiers and sturdy horses - a well-trained and powerful army

兵役
兵役[bīng yì] 指当兵的义务 military service：服兵役 serve in the army; be conscripted or drafted into the army

兵役法
兵役法[bīng yì fǎ] 国家根据宪法规定公民服兵役的法律制度 military service law; conscription law; law formulated by the government in accordance with the Constitution that defines national military service

兵戈
兵戈[bīng gē]〈书 fml.〉兵器，指战争 weapons; arms：不动兵戈 without resorting to force兵戈四起。There is war everywhere.

兵戎
兵戎[bīng róng] 指武器、军队 arms; weapons：兵戎相见（武装冲突的婉辞 euph. for armed conflict）resort to arms; open hostilities; cross swords with; meet on the battleground

兵权
兵权[bīng quán] 指挥和调动军队的权力 military leadership; military power：掌握兵权 hold military power

兵来将挡，水来土掩
兵来将挡，水来土掩[bīng lái jiàng dǎng, shuǐ lái tǔ yǎn]〈比喻 fig.〉不管对方使用什么计策、手段，都有对付办法。也比喻针对具体情况采取相应对策。counter measure for measure; confront soldiers with generals and stem flood water with earth - take such measures as the situation calls for; counter move for move

兵棋
兵棋[bīng qí] 特制的军队标号图型和人员、兵器、地物等模型，供各级指挥员在沙盘上研究作战和训练等情况时使用 war model; model of military symbols, troops, weapons, topographical features, etc., made for officers at various levels in order for them to study operations and carry out training

兵油子
兵油子[bīng yóu zi] 指久在行伍而油滑的兵 oily seasoned sergeant; army riffraff; army ruffian

兵法
兵法[bīng fǎ]〈古代 arch.〉指用兵作战的策略和方法 art of war; military strategy and tactics：熟谙兵法 be well acquainted with the art of war

兵源
兵源[bīng yuán] 士兵的来源 manpower resources for military service; sources of troops：兵源充足 abundant sources of troops

兵火
兵火[bīng huǒ] 战火，指战争 flames of war; war：兵火连天 raging flames of war书稿毁于兵火。The manuscripts were destroyed in war and turmoil.

兵灾
兵灾[bīng zāi] 战乱带来的灾难 disaster of war; scourge of war

兵燹
兵燹[bīng xiǎn]〈书 fml.〉战争造成的焚烧破坏等灾害 ravages of war：藏书毁于兵燹。The books were destroyed in the war.

兵痞
兵痞[bīng pǐ] 指在旧军队中长期当兵、品质恶劣、为非作歹的人 wicked seasoned soldier; army riff-raff; army ruffian

兵种
兵种[bīng zhǒng] 军种内部的分类，如步兵、炮兵、装甲兵、工程兵等是陆军的各兵种 branch of one of the services, e.g. the army is subdivided into infantry, artillery, armoured forces, and engineering troops

兵站
兵站[bīng zhàn] 军队在后方交通线上设置的供应、转运机构，主要负责补给物资、接收伤病员、接待过往部队等 army service station; military depot; supply and transfer station set up by an army along a line of communication, mainly in charge of supplies, caring for sick and wounded soldiers, and receiving passing troops

兵符
兵符[bīng fú]1.〈古代 arch.〉调兵遣将的符节 military tally (used in former times as evidence of authority) 2.兵书 book or treatise on the art of war

兵舰
兵舰[bīng jiàn] 军舰 warship

兵船
兵船[bīng chuán] 指军舰 man-of-war; naval vessel; warship

兵荒马乱
兵荒马乱[bīng huāng mǎ luàn] 形容战时社会动荡不安的景象 war and turmoil

兵营
兵营[bīng yíng] 军队居住的营房 military camp; barracks

兵谏
兵谏[bīng jiàn] 用武力胁迫君主或当权者接受规劝 coerce the monarch or ruler by force of arms into accepting one's exhortations; exhortations backed up by force of arms：发动兵谏 coerce the monarch or ruler by force of arms into accepting one's exhortations

兵贵神速
兵贵神速[bīng guì shén sù]用兵以行动特别迅速最为重要（见于《三国志·魏书·郭嘉传》）Records of Three Kingdoms·Kingdom of Wei·Biography of Guo Jia: speed is what counts in war; in war it is speed that counts

兵车
兵车[bīng chē]1.〈古代 arch.〉作战用的车辆 war chariot 2.指运载军队的列车 troop vehicle; troop train; military vehicle

兵革
兵革[bīng gé]〈书 fml.〉兵器和甲胄，借指战争 war; weapons and armour：兵革未息 the war is still on; hostilities have not ceased

兵饷
兵饷[bīng xiǎng] 军饷 soldier's pay and provisions

兵马俑
兵马俑[bīng mǎ yǒng]〈古代 arch.〉用来殉葬的兵马形象的陶俑 terracotta warrior; terracotta warriors and horses buried with the dead in ancient China

其
其[jī]（ㄐㄧ）用于人名，郦食其(Lì Yìjī)，汉朝人 ji, used as part of a person's name, e.g. Li Yiji, a man of the Han Dynasty另见  qí其1[qí]（ㄑㄧˊ）1.他（她、它）的；他（她、它）们的 his; her; its; their：各得其所 to the satisfaction of one and all; each is properly provided for; each is in his proper place自圆其说 give a good explanation of what one has said or done; make out a good case 2.他（她、它）；他（她、它）们 he; she; it; they：促其早日实现 bring sth. to fruition at an early date不能任其自流。On no account should we let the matter go along its natural course. 3.那个；那样 that; such：查无其事。Investigation indicates that nothing of the sort has happened.不厌其烦 go to great lengths; take great pains; be very patient 4.虚指 [used as a functional word]：忘其所以 forget oneself; get swell-headed其2[qí]（ㄑㄧˊ）〈书 fml.〉〈助词 aux.〉1.表示揣测、反诘 [indicating conjecture or retort]：岂其然乎？Is this really the case?其奈我何？What can they do about me? 2.表示命令 [indicating an instruction]：子其勉之！Work to the best of your ability please!其3[qí]（ㄑㄧˊ）〈词尾 suffix〉：极其 extremely尤其 in particular如其 if; in case大概其。That's about it.另见  jī相关词组更其 | 何其 | 极其 | 卡其 | 如其 | 惟其 | 尤其 | 与其 | 充其量 | 乔其纱 | 萨其马 | 大概其 | 出其不意 | 得其所哉 | 攻其不备 | 听其自然 | 望其项背 | 不计其数 | 瞠乎其后 | 洞烛其奸 | 独善其身 | 各得其所 | 各行其是 | 果不其然 | 夸大其词 | 夸夸其谈 | 两全其美 | 勉为其难 | 名副其实 | 莫名其妙 | 恰如其分 | 若无其事 | 三缄其口 | 上下其手 | 神乎其神 | 适得其反 | 适逢其会 | 首当其冲 | 死得其所 | 突如其来 | 微乎其微 | 物伤其类 | 虚有其表 | 言过其实 | 自行其是 | 自食其果 | 自食其力 | 自食其言 | 自圆其说 | 坐享其成 | 反其道而行之 | 万变不离其宗 | 无所不用其极 | 盛名之下，其实难副其次 | 其间 | 其实 | 其他 | 其它 | 其余 | 其中 | 其貌不扬

其中
其中[qí zhōng] 那里面 among; in; of：果园里一共有五万棵果树，其中梨树占30%。Pears account for 30 per cent of the 50,000 fruit trees in the orchard.

其他
其他[qí tā] 别的 other than; apart from：今天的文娱晚会，除了京剧、曲艺以外，还有其他精彩节目。The variety show today has got a lot of good stuff apart from Peking Opera, ballad singing and comic dialogues.

其余
其余[qí yú] 剩下的 other (persons or things); rest; remainder：除了有两人请假，其余的人都到了。Everybody is here except two who have asked for leave.

其它
其它[qí tā] 同 same as 其他 qítā（用于事物 referring to things rather than people）

其实
其实[qí shí]〈副词 adv.〉表示所说的是实际情况（承上文而含转折） in fact; as a matter of fact; actually：这个问题从表面上看似乎很难，其实并不难。This problem looks like a hard nut to crack, but actually it is not really so difficult.

其次
其次[qí cì]1.次第较后；第二（用于列举事项 when enumerating items, events, etc.）next; then; on the other hand：他第一个发言，其次就轮到了我。He's the first to speak, and I am the next.你这次下去，首先要做好社会调查工作，其次要参加一些劳动。During your stay at the grass-roots level this time, first, do a good job in social investigation, and second, take part in some physical labour. 2.次要的地位 secondary：内容是主要的，形式还在其次。Content is more important than anything else, and form is secondary.

其貌不扬
其貌不扬[qí mào bù yáng] 指人的容貌平常或丑陋 be unimpressive in looks; look homely

其间
其间[qí jiān]1.那中间；其中 between; among; amidst; in the midst of：厕身其间 find oneself among ...其间定有缘故。There must be a reason for this. 2.指某一段时间 during this or that period; in the intervening years：离开学校已经好几年了，这其间，他的科学研究工作成绩显著。During the years since he left school he has distinguished himself in research work.

具
具1[jù]（ㄐㄩˋ）1.用具 utensil; tool; implement：农具 farm tools文具 stationery家具 furniture雨具 rain gear卧具 bedding餐具 table ware; dinner set 2.〈书 fml.〉才干；才能 talent; ability：才具 capability; ability干城之具 heroic defender of the nation 3.〈书 fml.〉〈量词 classifier〉用于棺材、尸体和某些器物 [for coffins, corpses and certain instruments or machines]：座钟一具 a desk clock具2[jù]（ㄐㄩˋ）1.具有 possess; have：具备 possess; have; be provided with初具规模 begin to take shape略具轮廓 begin to take shape 2.〈书 fml.〉备；办 provide; furnish：具呈 submit to a superior具结 sign an undertaking敬具菲酌 allow me to cordially invite you to a simple dinner with wine 3.〈书 fml.〉陈述；写出 state; write down：具名 put one's name (to a document, etc.); affix one's signature条具时弊 list the ills of the times相关词组才具 | 餐具 | 茶具 | 出具 | 厨具 | 炊具 | 刀具 | 道具 | 灯具 | 钓具 | 赌具 | 工具 | 画具 | 火具 | 机具 | 家具 | 傢具 | 夹具 | 教具 | 卡具 | 开具 | 量具 | 面具 | 模具 | 农具 | 皮具 | 器具 | 刃具 | 胎具 | 玩具 | 挽具 | 文具 | 卧具 | 刑具 | 牙具 | 烟具 | 用具 | 鱼具 | 渔具 | 雨具 | 战具 | 坐具 | 工具书 | 假面具 | 别具匠心 | 别具一格 | 别具只眼 | 独具匠心 | 独具只眼 | 防毒面具 | 交通工具 | 生产工具具保 | 具备 | 具结 | 具名 | 具体 | 具文 | 具有 | 具体而微 | 具体劳动

具体
具体[jù tǐ]1.细节方面很明确的；不抽象的；不笼统的 concrete; particular：具体化 concretize具体计划 detailed plan深入群众，具体地了解情况。Go deep among the masses and learn where things stand.事件的经过，他谈得非常具体。He talked in detail about the course of the incident. 2.特定的 specific：具体的人 specific person你担任什么具体工作？What is your specific job? 3.把理论或原则结合到特定的人或事物上（后面带‘到’followed by the word 到 dào）concretize a theory or principle in terms of a specific person or matter：贯彻增产节约的方针具体到我们这个单位，应该采取下列各种有效措施。To carry out the principle of increasing production and practising economy in our working unit, the following effective measures should be taken.

具体劳动
具体劳动[jù tǐ láo dòng] 按一定形式和目的创造使用价值的劳动，如木工做家具，纺织工人纺纱织布等（跟‘抽象劳动’相对 as opposed to ‘abstract labour’）concrete labour; labour that creates use value according to given forms and aims, e.g. a carpenter makes furniture, or a textile worker spins thread and weaves cloth, etc.

具体而微
具体而微[jù t ǐér wēi] 内容大体具备而形状或规模较小 miniature; small but complete

具保
具保[jù bǎo] 指找人担保 find surety：具保释放 release on surety

具名
具名[jù míng] 在文件上署名 sign; put one's name (to a document, etc.)：由双方共同具名 signed by both parties

具备
具备[jù bèi] 具有；齐备 possess; have; be provided with：具备条件 satisfy the conditions青年必须具备建设祖国和保卫祖国的双重本领。Young people should have the dual talents to both build and defend the motherland.

具文
具文[jù wén] 指徒有形式而无实际作用的规章制度 mere formality; dead letter; regulations and rules that have no practical functions：一纸具文 a mere scrap of paper

具有
具有[jù yǒu] 有（多用于抽象事物 oft. sth. immaterial）have; possess：具有信心 be confident具有伟大的意义 of great significance

具结
具结[jù jié]〈旧时 old〉对官署提出表示负责的文件 sign an undertaking; sign a document to honour one's official obligations：具结完案 enter into a bond on closing a case具结领回失物 sign a receipt for restored lost property

典
典1[diǎn]（ㄉㄧㄢˇ）1.标准；法则 standard; canon：典范 example典章 laws and rules 2.典范性书籍 standard work of scholarship：词典 dictionary引经据典 quote from classics 3.典故 allusion：用典 (use of) allusion出典 source of an allusion 4.典礼 ceremony：盛典 grand ceremony开国大典 founding ceremony of a sovereign state 5.〈书 fml.〉主持；主管 be in charge of：典试 examiner典狱 warden 6.(Diǎn) 姓 a surname典2[diǎn]（ㄉㄧㄢˇ）一方把土地或房屋等押给另一方使用，换取一笔钱，不付利息，议定年限，到期还款，收回原物 pawn; give land or real estate as security for the payment of money borrowed free of interest, with the two parties retrieving their money and property respectively by the end of the agreed period相关词组操典 | 出典 | 词典 | 辞典 | 大典 | 恩典 | 法典 | 佛典 | 古典 | 会典 | 婚典 | 经典 | 庆典 | 盛典 | 事典 | 释典 | 药典 | 应典 | 字典 | 活字典 | 古典文学 | 古典主义 | 数典忘祖 | 明正典刑 | 引经据典典当 | 典范 | 典故 | 典籍 | 典借 | 典礼 | 典型 | 典押 | 典雅 | 典章

典借
典借[diǎn jiè]另见  典2  diǎn

典型
典型[diǎn xíng]1.具有代表性的人物或事件 model; typical person or event：用典型示范的方法推广先进经验 popularize advanced experience by exemplification 2.具有代表性的 typical; representative：这件事很典型，可以用来教育群众。This is a typical case, which can be cited to educate the people. 3.文学艺术作品中用艺术概括的手法，表现出人的某种社会特征的艺术形象，它既表现了人的一定的阶级特征，同时又具有鲜明的个性特征 typical figure; character depicted by literary generalization, featuring certain social characteristics of a person who is representative not only of his social class but also of his own personality

典当
典当[diǎn dàng]1.典和当(dàng) pawn亦 also 典押 diǎnyā 2.〈方 dial.〉当铺pawn shop

典押
典押[diǎn yā] 同 same as 典当 diǎndàng ①

典故
典故[diǎn gù] 诗文里引用的古书中的故事或词句 allusion or quotation from classical works

典礼
典礼[diǎn lǐ] 郑重举行的仪式，如开幕典礼、结婚典礼、毕业典礼等 ceremony, such as opening, wedding or graduation ceremony

典章
典章[diǎn zhāng] 法令制度 laws and decrees：文物典章 cultural relics and ancient documents《元典章》（书名，元朝的法令汇编）The Code of Yuan (collection of decrees of the Yuan Dynasty)

典籍
典籍[diǎn jí] 记载古代法制的图书，也泛指古代图书 ancient records of laws and decrees; ancient books：文献典籍 documents and historical records

典范
典范[diǎn fàn] 可以作为学习、仿效标准的人或事物 model; example：树立典范 set up an example典范作品 model work

典雅
典雅[diǎn yǎ] 优美不粗俗 refined; elegant：词句典雅 polished wording风格典雅 graceful style

兹
兹[cí]（ㄘˊ）龟兹(Qiūcí)，古代西域国名，在今新疆库车县一带 Kuqa, an ancient kingdom in the Western Regions, in present-day Kuqa County of Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region另见  zī兹[zī]（ㄗ）（茲）〈书 fml.〉1.这个 this：兹事体大（这是件大事情）。This is indeed a serious matter.念兹在兹（念念不忘某件事）always remember this; bear this in mind 2.现在 now; at present; at this time：于兹已有三载。Three years have passed since then.兹订于9月1日上午9时在本校礼堂举行开学典礼。This is to announce that the school's opening ceremony will be held at the assembly hall at 9 a.m. on September 1. 3.年 year：今兹 this year来兹 next year另见  cí相关词组赫兹 | 华尔兹

养
养[yǎng]（ㄧㄤˇ）（養）1.供给生活资料或生活费用 support; provide for：抚养 foster赡养 support养家活口 support a family 2.饲养（动物）；培植（花草）raise (animals); grow (plants)：养猪 raise pigs养蚕 raise silkworms养花 grow flowers 3.生育 give birth to：她养了一个儿子。She gave birth to a boy. 4.抚养的（非亲生的）foster; adoptive：养子 adopted son养女 adopted daughter养父 foster father养母 foster mother 5.培养 form; acquire; cultivate：他从小养成了爱劳动的习惯。He has cultivated a good habit of loving physical labour. 6.使身心得到滋补或休息，以增进精力或恢复健康 rest; convalesce; recuperate one's health; heal：保养 take good care of one's health休养 recuperate疗养 convalesce营养 nutrition养料 nourishment养精蓄锐 conserve strength and store up energy 7.修养 accomplishment：教养 upbringing学养有素 well trained in learning and cultivation 8. 同 same as 养护 yǎnghù ①：养路 maintain a road or railway 9.（毛发）留长；蓄起不剪 let (one's hair) grow long 10.扶植；扶助 support; help：以农养牧，以牧促农 use agriculture to support animal husbandry, and use animal husbandry to promote agriculture相关词组包养 | 保养 | 抱养 | 补养 | 哺养 | 畜养 | 放养 | 奉养 | 扶养 | 抚养 | 给养 | 供养 | 涵养 | 护养 | 豢养 | 寄养 | 家养 | 将养 | 娇养 | 教养 | 静养 | 鞠养 | 疗养 | 领养 | 轮养 | 培养 | 弃养 | 圈养 | 认养 | 赡养 | 生养 | 侍养 | 收养 | 饲养 | 素养 | 调养 | 喂养 | 限养 | 休养 | 修养 | 蓄养 | 学养 | 驯养 | 颐养 | 营养 | 滋养 | 教养员 | 疗养院 | 童养媳 | 营养素 | 休养生息 | 营养元素 | 富营养化 | 姑息养奸 | 韬光养晦 | 娇生惯养 | 劳动教养养兵 | 养病 | 养地 | 养分 | 养父 | 养护 | 养活 | 养老 | 养廉 | 养料 | 养路 | 养母 | 养女 | 养气 | 养人 | 养伤 | 养神 | 养生 | 养性 | 养育 | 养殖 | 养子 | 养老院 | 养媳妇 | 养虎遗患 | 养痈成患 | 养尊处优

养人
养人[yǎng rén] 对人体有保养作用 nourishing：喝粥养人。Eating porridge is nourishing.

养伤
养伤[yǎng shāng] 因受伤而休养 nurse one's injuries or wounds

养兵
养兵[yǎng bīng] 指供养和训练士兵 maintain an army：养兵千日，用兵一时。The maintenance of an army for 1,000 days boils down to the use of a single battle.

养分
养分[yǎng fèn] 物质中所含的能供给有机体营养的成分 nutrient; sth. that nourishes or promotes growth of organic life

养地
养地[yǎng dì] 采取施肥、轮作等措施提高土地肥力 increase soil fertility (through fertilization, crop rotation, etc.)

养女
养女[yǎng nǚ] 指领养的女儿 adopted daughter

养媳妇
养媳妇[yǎng xí fù]〈方 dial.〉童养媳 child bride; girl taken into a family as an intended daughter-in-law

养子
养子[yǎng zǐ] 指领养的儿子 adopted son

养尊处优
养尊处优[yǎng zūn chǔ yōu]生活在优裕的环境中（多含贬义 usu. derog.）enjoy high position and live in comfort; live in clover

养廉
养廉[yǎng lián]〈书 fml.〉培养廉洁的操守 (of government officials) nourish honesty; refrain from corruption and graft：俭以养廉 nourish honesty by living a frugal life

养性
养性[yǎng xìng] 陶冶本性 nourish one's nature：修真养性 cultivate one's native sensibility and nourish one's inborn nature

养护
养护[yǎng hù]1.保养维护 maintain; conserve：养护公路 maintain a road加强设备养护工作 strengthen the maintenance of equipment精心养护古树名木 take good care of famous ancient trees 2.调养护理 take good care of one's health after an illness; build up one's health by taking good rest and nourishing food：经过一段时间养护，伤口就愈合了。After a period of curing, the wound has healed.

养料
养料[yǎng liào] 能供给有机体营养的物质 nutriment; nourishment; sth. that nourishes or promotes the growth of organic life

养殖
养殖[yǎng zhí]培育和繁殖（水产动植物）breed (aquatics)：养殖业 fish breeding and poultry raising; aquaculture养殖海带 cultivate kelp

养母
养母[yǎng mǔ] 指抚养自己的非生身母亲 foster mother; woman who gives parental care to sb. not related by blood

养气
养气[yǎng qì]〈书 fml.〉1.培养品德；增进涵养功夫 foster moral value (by cultivation or through a moral life) 2.〈古代 arch.〉道家的一种修炼方法 conserve one's vital powers (by avoiding conflict with the unchangeable laws of nature, as practised by Taoists)

养活
养活[yǎng huo]1.供给生活资料或生活费用 support; provide for：他还要养活老母亲。He has, among other things, to provide for his old mother. 2.饲养（动物）raise (animals)：农场今年养活了上千头猪，上万只鸡。This year the farm has raised over 1,000 pigs and 10,000 chickens. 3.〈方 dial.〉生育 give birth to

养父
养父[yǎng fù] 指抚养自己的非生身父亲 foster father; man who gives parental care to sb. not related by blood

养生
养生[yǎng shēng] 保养身体 care for life; conserve one's vital powers; preserve one's health; keep in good health：养生之道 way to conserve one's vitals; way to stay healthy

养病
养病[yǎng bìng] 因患病而休养 take rest and nourishment to regain one's health; recuperate：安心养病 ease one's mind and recuperate

养痈成患
养痈成患[yǎng yōng chéng huàn]〈比喻 fig.〉姑息坏人坏事，结果受到祸害 a boil neglected becomes the bane of one's life;leaving evil unchecked spells trouble亦 also 养痈遗患 yǎng yōng yí huàn

养神
养神[yǎng shén] 保持身体和心理的平静状态，以消除疲劳 rest to attain mental tranquility; repose：闭目养神 sit in repose with one's eyes closed

养老
养老[yǎng lǎo]1.奉养老人 provide for the aged (usu. one's parents)：养老送终 look after one's parents in their old age and give them a proper burial after they die 2.指年老闲居休养 live out one's life in retirement：居家养老 live out one's retirement at home

养老院
养老院[yǎng lǎo yuàn] 由公家或集体办的收养孤独老人的机构 old people's home; nursing home for the elderly run by the state or collective亦 also 敬老院 jìnglǎoyuàn

养育
养育[yǎng yù] 抚养和教育 bring up; rear：养育子女 bring up children养育之恩 parents' love and care in bringing up a child

养虎遗患
养虎遗患[yǎng hǔ yí huàn]〈比喻 fig.〉纵容敌人，给自己留下后患 to rear a tiger is to court calamity; appeasement brings disaster

养路
养路[yǎng lù] 养护公路或铁路 maintain a road or railway：养路工 road maintenance worker养路费 road toll

兼
