冲撞[chōng zhuàng]1.撞击 collide; bump; jostle：海浪冲撞着山崖。Ocean waves beat against the cliffs. 2. 同 same as 冲犯 chōngfàn：我很后悔不该失言冲撞她。I regret bitterly for offending her by speaking out of turn.

冲服
冲服[chōng fú] 服药的一种方式，用水或酒等调药吃下去 take medicine after mixing it with water or wine

冲杀
冲杀[chōng shā] 在战场上迅速前进，杀伤敌人 rush ahead; charge and fight the enemy on the battlefield：奋勇冲杀 fight heroically in a battle; fight desperately

冲模
冲模[chòng mú] 装在冲床上用来使被加工的材料成型的模型，一般都是凹凸成对的 die or mould; incorporated into a punching machine with which to work on materials, usu. in a pair, one concave and the other convex

冲洗
冲洗[chōng xǐ]1.用水冲，使附着的东西去掉 rinse off; scour; wash：路面经大雨冲洗后，显得格外干净了。The road looked much cleaner after the rain. 2.把已经曝光的胶片，进行显影、定影等的总称 develop; treat photographic film so as to make the latent image visible：冲洗放大 develop and enlarge (a film)

冲浪
冲浪[chōng làng]水上体育运动之一。运动员脚踏特制的冲浪板随海浪快速滑行，用全身的协调动作保持身体的平衡。surfing; surf-riding, a sports event where the competitor stands on a surfboard and is carried rapidly along the crest of surging waves, while attempting to maintain balance through body movements

冲淡
冲淡[chōng dàn]1.加进别的液体，使原来的液体在同一个单位内所含成分相对减少 dilute; water down; reduce the strength of a fluid by adding water or other solvents：把80度酒精冲淡为50度 dilute the alcohol from 80 degrees to 50 degrees 2.使某种气氛、效果、感情等减弱 weaken the atmosphere, effect and feelings; water down; play down; downgrade：加了这一场，反而把整个剧本的效果冲淡了。This added scene has weakened the effect of the whole play instead.

冲犯
冲犯[chōng fàn] 言语或行为与对方抵触，冒犯了对方 offend; affront; cause offence or resentment by one's words and behaviour：他一时不能够控制自己，说了几句话，冲犯了叔父。He lost control of himself and spoke a few words that offended his uncle.

冲田
冲田[chōng tián] 丘陵地区的谷地水稻田，地势较平缓 paddy fields or other cultivated lands in hilly areas, with a relatively level topography

冲盹儿
冲盹儿[chòng dǔn r]〈方 dial.〉打盹儿 doze off; have a nap

冲破
冲破[chōng pò] 突破某种状态、限制等 break through (a certain situation, limitation, etc.); breach：冲破封锁 breach a blockade冲破禁区 break into a forbidden zone冲破障碍物 surmount obstacles火光冲破漆黑的夜空。Flames penetrated the pitch-dark firmament.

冲积
冲积[chōng jī] 高地的砂砾、泥土被水流带到河谷低洼地区沉积下来 alluvium; sand and soil from high areas washed down to river valleys or low-lying areas

冲程
冲程[chōng chéng] 内燃机工作时活塞在汽缸中往复运动，从汽缸的一端到另一端叫做一个冲程 stroke; (of operation of an internal combustion engine) one of a series of alternating continuous movements of pistons back and forth through the same line within a cylinder亦 also 行程 xíngchéng

冲突
冲突[chōng tū]1.矛盾表面化，发生激烈争斗 conflict; clash; intense fight caused by contradiction：武装冲突 armed conflict言语冲突 conflict of words 2.互相矛盾；不协调 contradiction; be out of harmony with; inconsistent：文章的论点前后冲突。The arguments in an article are inconsistent.因时间冲突，会开不成了。Owing to a time clash, this meeting has been cancelled.

冲腾
冲腾[chōng téng]（气体等）向上冲；升腾 (of air, vapour, steam, etc.) rush out; leap up; rise up：热气冲腾而出。Hot steam shot upwards.

冲要
冲要[chōng yào]1.处于全国的或某一个地区的重要道路的会合点，因而形势重要 place of strategic importance, usu. the hub of transportation in a region or a state：徐州地处津浦铁路和陇海铁路的交叉点，是个十分冲要的地方。Located at the intersection of the Tianjin-Nanjing and Lanzhou-Lianyungang railways, Xuzhou is a place of strategic importance. 2.〈书 fml.〉指重要的职位 important position：久居冲要 hold an important post for a long time; be in a key position for a long time

冲账
冲账[chōng zhàng] 收支账目互相抵消，或两户应支付的款项互相抵消 balance income and expense accounts; balance accounts

冲量
冲量[chōng liàng] 作用在物体上的力和力的作用时间的乘积叫做冲量 impulse, momentum; the product of average force acting upon an object and the time it takes

冲销
冲销[chōng xiāo] 会计上指将有关账户内原记的数额部分或全部减除 write off; abate; partly or fully reverse an entry in an account

冲锋
冲锋[chōng fēng] 进攻的部队向敌人迅猛前进，用冲锋枪、手榴弹、刺刀等和敌人进行战斗 (of troops) charge at the enemy in a sweeping manoeuvre and fight with tommy-guns, grenades and bayonets, etc.

冲锋枪
冲锋枪[chōng fēng qiāng]单人使用的自动武器。枪身较短，用于近战和冲锋，有效射程约300-400米。submachine gun; tommy-gun; small in size and used by a single person in face-to-face combat and assault, with a shooting range of 300-400 metres.

冲锋陷阵
冲锋陷阵[chōng fēng xiàn zhèn]1.向敌人冲锋，深入敌人阵地。形容作战英勇。charge towards the enemy and into the enemy's domain; fight bravely in a battle 2.泛指为正义事业英勇斗争 (in a broad sense) fight heroically for a just cause

冲顶
冲顶1[chōng dǐng] 足球比赛时运动员向前跃起用头顶球 (of a player) jump up to head the ball in a football match冲顶2[chōng dǐng] 登山中临近顶峰时奋力攀登 (of mountaineering) scale the summit; make a particularly strenuous effort when the summit is at close hand

冲龄
冲龄[chōng líng]〈书 fml.〉幼年（多用于帝王 generally of an emperor）at tender age, very young：冲龄登基 ascend the throne at a tender age

决
决1[jué]（ㄐㄩㄝˊ）（決）1.决定 decide; determine：表决 decide by vote; vote on判决 sentence; make a court decision; pass a judgement犹豫不决 hesitate决一雌雄 have a showdown with sb.; fight it out 2.一定（用在否定词前面 used before a negative word）definitely; certainly; under any circumstances：决不退缩 never yield to sth. or sb.决无异言 have no disagreement whatsoever 3.决定最后胜败 decide the final result：决赛 finals决战 decisive battle今日乒乓球赛要决出前三名。Today's table tennis match will decide the first three winners. 4.执行死刑 execute (a person); carry out a death sentence：枪决 execute by a firing squad处决 put to death立决 immediately carry out a death sentence决2[jué]（ㄐㄩㄝˊ）（決）决口 (of a dyke, etc.) be breached; burst：溃决 (of a dam) burst相关词组表决 | 裁决 | 冲决 | 处决 | 否决 | 公决 | 果决 | 坚决 | 解决 | 溃决 | 立决 | 判决 | 枪决 | 取决 | 速决 | 先决 | 议决 | 勇决 | 自决 | 表决权 | 否决权 | 判决书 | 速决战 | 未决犯 | 已决犯 | 委决不下 | 民族自决 | 刑事判决决策 | 决定 | 决斗 | 决断 | 决计 | 决绝 | 决口 | 决裂 | 决然 | 决赛 | 决胜 | 决死 | 决算 | 决心 | 决议 | 决意 | 决战 | 决雌雄 | 决定性 | 决一死战

决一死战
决一死战[jué yī sǐ zhàn] 不怕牺牲，对敌人作你死我活的战斗 fight a life-and-death battle; fight to the finish

决口
决口[jué kǒu]（河堤）被水冲出缺口 burst; (of a dyke) be breached by floods

决定
决定[jué dìng]1.对如何行动做出主张 decide; make up one's mind; resolve：领导上决定派他去学习。His leader decided to send him away to study.这件事情究竟应该怎么办，最好是由大家来决定。It would be better for all of us to sit together and decide how to deal with this matter. 2.决定的事项 decision; resolution：这个问题尚未做出决定。A decision has yet to be made regarding this issue.组长们回去要向本组传达这项决定。On their return, group leaders should convey this resolution to the members of his group. 3.某事物成为另一事物的先决条件；起主导作用 (of sth.) be the prerequisite (of sth. else); determine; decide：存在决定意识。Man's social being determines his consciousness.这件事决定了他未来的生活道路。This incident has decided his future life path. 4.客观规律促使事物一定向某方面发展变化 decide; determine; (of sth.) change or develop in a certain direction due to objective laws：决定性 decisiveness决定因素 decisive factor; determinant

决定性
决定性[jué dìng xìng] 对产生某种结果起决定作用的性质 decisiveness; determining or having the power to determine the outcome：决定性的胜利 decisive victory在生产中起决定性作用的是人。Man plays the decisive part in production.

决心
决心[jué xīn]1.坚定不移的意志 determination; resolution：决心书 statement of one's determination; written pledge to show one's determination下定决心 make up one's mind; resolve 2.一心一意，坚定不移地 resolute：决心钻研学问 be determined to gain professional knowledge

决意
决意[jué yì] 拿定主张；决计 ① have one's mind made up; be determined：他决意明天一早就动身。He has made up his mind to set off tomorrow morning.

决战
决战[jué zhàn] 敌对双方使用主力以决胜负的战役或战斗 decisive battle; decisive engagement; battle between major forces of two contending sides to determine which side shall win

决斗
决斗[jué dòu]1.过去欧洲流行的一种风俗，两人发生争端，各不相让，约定时间地点，并邀请证人，彼此用武器对打 duel; custom popular in Europe until the mid-19th century when two men, along with their witnesses, or ‘seconds’, would settle a point of honour by arranging combat at a fixed time and place 2.泛指进行你死我活的斗争 (in a broad sense) life-and-death struggle; decisive struggle

决断
决断[jué duàn]1.拿主意；做决定 make a decision：无从决断 unable to make a decision请您最后决断。It's up to you to make the final decision. 2.决定事情的魄力 resolve; resolution; determination：他做事很有决断。He is a man of determination.

决死
决死[jué sǐ]敌我双方你死我活的（斗争）life-and-death struggle between two contending parties：决死战 cut-throat battle决死的斗争 life-and-death struggle; last-ditch fight

决然
决然[jué rán]〈书 fml.〉1.形容很坚决 firmly; resolutely; determinedly：毅然决然 resolutely and determinedly决然返回 return resolutely 2.必然；一定 definitely; inevitably; surely：东张西望，道听途说，决然得不到什么完全的知识。One can never acquire real knowledge by flitting around and listening to hearsay.

决策
决策[jué cè]1.决定策略或办法 formulate a policy; make a strategic decision：运筹决策 devise strategies 2.决定的策略或办法 decision of strategic importance：明智的决策 wise decision

决算
决算[jué suàn] 根据年度预算执行的结果而编制的年度会计报告 final accounts; final accounting report on implementation of the annual budget

决绝
决绝[jué jué]1.断绝关系 break off; cut off; sever：与不良嗜好决绝 be determined to break oneself of bad habits决绝一切往来 break off all relations 2.非常坚决 firm; resolute：态度决绝 resolute attitude话说得十分决绝。His words are resolutely spoken.

决胜
决胜[jué shèng] 决定最后的胜负 decide the final outcome; determine the victory：决胜千里之外 ensure a victory 1,000 li away

决裂
决裂[jué liè]（谈判、关系、感情）破裂 (of negotiation, relationship or feeling) break up; rupture：自她和我决裂之后，再没有见过面。We have not met each other since she broke off with me.五四时代的青年开始和封建主义的传统决裂。During the May 4th Movement, the youth began to break with feudal traditions.

决计
决计[jué jì]1.表示主意已定 decide; make up one's mind：无论如何，我决计明天就走。I am determined to leave tomorrow, no matter what. 2.表示肯定的判断 definitely; certainly：这样办决计没错儿。This method is absolutely foolproof.

决议
决议[jué yì] 经一定会议讨论通过的决定 resolution; statement or opinions discussed and passed by an assembly

决赛
决赛[jué sài] 体育运动等竞赛中决定名次的最后一次或最后一轮比赛 finals; final match or final round of matches in a sport competition or other contest which decides the positions

决雌雄
决雌雄[jué cí xióng] 决定胜负、高下 fight to see who is the stronger; fight it out

况
况1[kuàng]（ㄎㄨㄤˋ）（況）1.情形 condition; situation：情况 situation状况 condition概况 general situation盛况 grand occasion近况 recent situation 2.比方 compare：比况 draw an analogy以古况今 draw parallels from history 3.(Kuàng) 姓 a surname况2[kuàng]（ㄎㄨㄤˋ）（況）〈书 fml.〉况且；何况 moreover; besides; furthermore相关词组病况 | 车况 | 而况 | 概况 | 海况 | 何况 | 简况 | 近况 | 景况 | 境况 | 窘况 | 路况 | 情况 | 赛况 | 盛况 | 实况 | 市况 | 状况 | 每况愈下况且 | 况味

况且
况且[kuàng qiě]〈连词 conj.〉表示更进一层 moreover; in addition; besides：上海地方那么大，况且你又不知道他的地址，一下子怎么能找到他呢？How do you expect to find him quickly, since Shanghai is so big? Besides, you don't have his address.

况味
况味[kuàng wèi]〈书 fml.〉境况和情味 circumstance; condition and situation：个中况味，难以尽言。It's hard to state every detail of the situation.

冶
冶1[yě]（ㄧㄝˇ）1.熔炼（金属）smelt (metal)：冶金 metallurgy 2.(Yě) 姓 a surname冶2[yě]（ㄧㄝˇ）〈书 fml.〉形容女子装饰艳丽（含贬义 derog.）seductively dressed or made up：妖冶 seductive; bewitching冶容 seductive looks相关词组熔冶 | 陶冶 | 妖冶冶金 | 冶炼 | 冶容 | 冶艳 | 冶游

冶容
冶容[yě róng]〈书 fml.〉1.打扮得很妖媚 be seductively made up 2.妖媚的容貌 seductive looks

冶游
冶游[yě yóu] 原指男女在春天或节日里外出游玩，后来专指嫖妓 (orig.) men and women go on a spring or holiday outing; (now) frequent brothels; go whoring

冶炼
冶炼[yě liàn] 用焙烧、熔炼、电解等方法把矿石中所需要的金属提取出来 smelt; separate metals from their ores by smelting, refining or electrolysis, etc.

冶艳
冶艳[yě yàn]〈书 fml.〉妖艳 seductive and bewitching

冶金
冶金[yě jīn] 冶炼金属 metallurgy：冶金工业 metallurgical industry

冷
冷[lěng]（ㄌㄥˇ）1.温度低；感觉温度低（跟‘热’相对 as opposed to ‘hot’）cold：冷水 cold water现在还不算冷，雪后才冷呢。It's not cold yet. It will be cold after it snows.你冷不冷？Do you feel cold? 2.〈方 dial.〉使冷（多指食物）cool (oft. of food)：太烫了，冷一下再吃。It's too hot. Let it cool off before you take it. 3.不热情；不温和 cold in manner; frosty：冷言冷语 sarcastic comments; ironical remarks冷冷地说了声‘好吧’。‘All right,’ he said coldly. 4.寂静；不热闹 unfrequented; deserted; out-of-the-way：冷落 unfrequented; deserted; cold-shoulder someone; treat someone coldly冷清清 desolate; deserted and quiet 5.生僻；少见的 strange; rare：冷僻 out-of-the-way; secluded 6.不受欢迎的；没人过问的 receiving little attention; unwelcome：冷货 goods in little demand冷门 unexpected winner; profession or branch of learning that receives little attention 7.乘人不备的；暗中的；突然的 shot from hiding; unexpected：冷箭 unexpected arrow shot; arrow shot from hiding冷枪 gun shot from hiding; sniper's shot冷不防 suddenly; unexpectedly; by surprise 8.〈比喻 fig.〉灰心或失望 disheartened; disappointed：心灰意冷 be disheartened看到他严厉的目光，我的心冷了半截。I felt disheartened at the sight of his stern glare. 9.(Lěng) 姓 a surname相关词组冰冷 | 齿冷 | 干冷 | 寒冷 | 清冷 | 生冷 | 湿冷 | 阴冷 | 制冷 | 爆冷门 | 炒冷饭 | 抽冷子 | 吹冷风 | 打冷颤 | 打冷枪 | 打冷战 | 放冷风 | 放冷箭 | 浇冷水 | 泼冷水 | 坐冷板凳 | 残杯冷炙冷布 | 冷藏 | 冷场 | 冷床 | 冷淡 | 冷丁 | 冷冻 | 冷风 | 冷锋 | 冷敷 | 冷宫 | 冷光 | 冷柜 | 冷害 | 冷汗 | 冷荤 | 冷货 | 冷寂 | 冷箭 | 冷噤 | 冷静 | 冷峻 | 冷库 | 冷酷 | 冷厉 | 冷落 | 冷门 | 冷漠 | 冷凝 | 冷暖 | 冷盘 | 冷僻 | 冷气 | 冷枪 | 冷峭 | 冷清 | 冷泉 | 冷却 | 冷色 | 冷杉 | 冷食 | 冷水 | 冷烫 | 冷笑 | 冷眼 | 冷饮 | 冷遇 | 冷战 | 冷字 | 冷板凳 | 冷冰冰 | 冷不丁 | 冷不防 | 冷处理 | 冷碟儿 | 冷加工 | 冷脸子 | 冷气团 | 冷清清 | 冷热病 | 冷森森 | 冷丝丝 | 冷飕飕 | 冷嘲热讽 | 冷若冰霜 | 冷血动物 | 冷言冷语 | 冷眼旁观 | 冷语冰人

冷丁
冷丁[lěng dīng]〈方 dial.〉 同 same as 冷不防 lěng·bufáng：冷丁地从草丛里跳出一只兔子来。Suddenly, a rabbit jumped out of the grass.

冷不丁
冷不丁[lěng bu dīng]〈方 dial.〉 同 same as 冷不防 lěng·bufáng：冷不丁吓了一跳 be started unexpectedly

冷不防
冷不防[lěng bu fáng] 没有预料到；突然 suddenly; unexpectedly; without warning; by surprise：冷不防摔了一跤 fall suddenly

冷丝丝
冷丝丝[lěng sī sī]（～的 lěngsīsī·de）形容有点儿冷 a bit chilly亦 also 冷丝儿丝儿的 lěngsīrsīr·de

冷僻
冷僻[lěng pì]1.冷落偏僻 deserted; out-of-the-way：地段冷僻 deserted section of an area冷僻的山乡 out-of-the-way mountain village 2.不常见的（字、名称、典故、书籍等）(words, names, allusions, books, etc.) rare; unfamiliar：冷僻字 rarely used word

冷光
冷光[lěng guāng]1.指荧光和磷光，因为这种光线所含的热量极少，所以叫冷光 cold light; light not accompanied by the heat of combustion or incandescence, such as fluorescent light and phosphorescent light 2.指冷酷严峻的目光 cold and stern look：眼里闪烁着逼人的冷光。His eyes glistened with a threatening look.

冷冰冰
冷冰冰[lěng bīng bīng]（～的 lěngbīngbīng·de）1.形容不热情或不温和 cold in manner; frosty：冷冰冰的脸色 cold expression; frosty looks 2.形容物体很冷 (of objects) ice-cold; icy：冷冰冰的石凳 icy stone bench

冷冻
冷冻[lěng dòng] 降低温度使肉、鱼等所含的水分凝固 freeze：冷冻设备 freezing equipment把鲜菜冷冻起来 freeze the fresh vegetables

冷凝
冷凝[lěng níng] 气体或液体遇冷而凝结，如水蒸气遇冷变成水，水遇冷变成冰 condensation; change of a gas or a liquid after becoming cold, e.g. steam changes to water or water changes to ice when it becomes cold

冷加工
冷加工[lěng jiā gōng] 指对在常温下的金属进行加工 cold working (of metal in normal temperature)

冷却
冷却[lěng què] 物体的温度降低或使物体的温度降低 cool; become cool; make cool

冷厉
冷厉[lěng lì] 冷峻严厉 grave and stern：冷厉的目光 grave and stern look

冷嘲热讽
冷嘲热讽[lěng cháo rè fěng] 尖刻的嘲笑和讥讽 with freezing irony and burning satire; with biting sarcasm

冷噤
冷噤[lěng jìn] 冷战;寒噤 shiver：打了个冷噤 shiver with cold

冷场
冷场[lěng chǎng]1.戏剧、曲艺等演出时因演员迟到或忘记台词造成的场面 awkward silence on the stage when an actor enters late or forgets his lines 2.开会时没有人发言的局面 awkward silence at a meeting

冷处理
冷处理[lěng chǔ lǐ]1.工件淬火后立即放进低温空气(0-80℃)中，叫做冷处理。工件经过冷处理以后，其机械性能较高，规格比较稳定。cold treatment; put a work-piece immediately into low-temperature (0-80℃) air after quenching so that its mechanical property is better and more stable 2.〈比喻 fig.〉事情发生后暂时搁置起来，等适当机会再作处理 shelve sth. that has happened for later treatment at a proper time

冷字
冷字[lěng zì] 冷僻的字 rarely used word; unfamiliar word

冷宫
冷宫[lěng gōng] 戏曲、旧小说中指君主安置失宠的后妃的地方，现在比喻存放不用的东西的地方 (in Chinese operas and old novels) cold palace - place to which disfavoured queens and concubines were banished; limbo; place where the idle goods are deposited：打入冷宫 put sth. in the limbo; put sth. on the back shelf

冷害
冷害[lěng hài] 由于气温降低，使某些植物体遭受的破坏或死亡 damage to plants caused by a sudden drop in temperature

冷寂
冷寂[lěng jì] 清冷而寂静 cold and still：冷寂的秋夜 cold and still autumn night

冷峭
冷峭[lěng qiào]1.形容冷气逼人 biting cold：北风冷峭。The northern wind is biting. 2.形容态度严峻，话语尖刻 scathing remarks

冷峻
冷峻[lěng jùn] 冷酷严峻；沉着而严肃 grave and stern：神色冷峻 grave and stern expression冷峻的目光 grave and stern look

冷布
冷布[lěng bù] 防蚊蝇、糊窗户等用的很稀疏的布 (cotton) gauze; loosely woven cotton cloth for windows against mosquitoes and flies

冷床
冷床[lěng chuáng]农业上指避风、向阳、保温而不进行人工加温的苗床。适用于不太寒冷的地区。cold bed; cold frame; unheated seedling bed used in warmer areas

冷库
冷库[lěng kù] 冷藏食物或药品的仓库 cold storage; storage for keeping frozen foods or medicines亦 also 冷藏库 lěngcángkù

冷战
冷战[lěng zhàn] 指国际间进行的战争形式之外的敌对行动 cold war; international hostile activities other than an actual war冷战[lěng zhan] 因寒冷或害怕浑身突然发抖 shiver：打了一个冷战 shiver with cold亦 also 冷颤 lěng·zhan

冷敷
冷敷[lěng fū] 用冰袋或冷水浸湿的毛巾放在身体的局部以降低温度、减轻疼痛或炎症 cold compress; put an ice bag or a cold wet towel on a certain part of the body to reduce the temperature and alleviate pain or inflammation

冷暖
冷暖[lěng nuǎn] 寒冷和温暖。泛指人的生活起居 cold and warm; day-to-day life：关心群众的冷暖 be concerned with the livelihood of the masses

冷杉
冷杉[lěng shān]常绿乔木，茎高大，树皮灰色，小枝红褐色，有光泽，叶子条形，果实椭圆形，暗紫色。木材可制器具。fir (Abies); evergreen tree with a tall trunk, grey bark, lustrous red-brown twigs, flattened single needles and dark purple oval fruits; 亦 also 枞 cōng

冷板凳
冷板凳[lěng bǎn dèng]另见  坐冷板凳 zuò lěngbǎndèng

冷枪
冷枪[lěng qiāng] 乘人不备暗中射出的枪弹 sniper's shot：打冷枪 fire a sniper's shot; snipe; stab in one's back

冷柜
冷柜[lěng guì] 冰柜 freezer

冷森森
冷森森[lěng sēn sēn]（～的 lěngsēnsēn·de）形容寒气逼人 cold; chilly; chilling：山洞里冷森森的。It's very cold (or chilly) inside the cave.

冷气
冷气[lěng qì]1.利用制冷设备，把空气冷却，通入建筑物、交通工具等内部，以降低其温度。所通的冷却的空气叫做冷气。air conditioning; method of cooling the air by means of cooling equipment to keep its humidity and temperature at desired levels in buildings, vehicles, etc. 2.通常也指上述设备 usually also such equipment

冷气团
冷气团[lěng qì tuán] 一种移动的气团，本身的温度比到达区域的地面温度低，多在极地和西伯利亚大陆上形成 cold air mass; moving air mass with its temperature lower than the ground temperature in an area it reaches, mostly formed at the polar regions and the Siberian continent

冷水
冷水[lěng shuǐ]1.凉水 cold water：泼冷水 pour cold water on; dampen the enthusiasm of冷水浇头（比喻受到意外的打击或希望突然破灭）cold water pouring on one's head; splashing the head with cold water; (fig.) rude shock or a bitter disappointment 2.生水 unboiled water：喝冷水容易得病。If you drink unboiled water, you're likely to get sick.

冷汗
冷汗[lěng hàn] 由惊恐或休克等原因而出的汗，出汗时手足发冷，所以叫冷汗 cold sweat; sweat caused by fear or shock, accompanied by cold limbs

冷泉
冷泉[lěng quán] 温度在当地年平均气温以下的泉水 cold spring; spring, the water of which is colder than the annual average temperature in the local area

冷淡
冷淡[lěng dàn]1.不热闹；不兴盛 not brisk; slack; desolate：生意冷淡。The trade is slack. 2.不热情；不亲热；不关心 cold; indifferent：态度冷淡 indifferent attitude 3.使受到冷淡的待遇 treat coldly; cold-shoulder; slight：他强打着精神说话，怕冷淡了朋友。He forced himself to perk up and keep the conversation going for fear that his friend would feel he'd been cold-shouldered.

冷清
冷清[lěng qing] 冷静而凄凉 cold and cheerless; desolate; lonely; deserted：冷冷清清 very quiet冷清的深夜 be quiet late at night后山游人少，显得很冷清。The backside of the hill is less visited and looks very quiet.

冷清清
冷清清[lěng qīng qīng]（～的 lěngqīngqīng·de）形容冷落、幽静、凄凉、寂寞 deserted; quiet; desolate; solitary; lonely：冷清清的小巷 deserted lane; quiet lane冷清清的月色 quiet moonlight通跨院儿的月亮门冷清清地开着。The moon-shaped gate to the courtyard is quietly open.

冷漠
冷漠[lěng mò]（对人或事物）冷淡，不关心 cold and detached; unconcerned; indifferent：神情冷漠 indifferent expression; indifferent look冷漠的态度 indifferent attitude

冷烫
冷烫[lěng tàng] 烫发的一种方法，用药水而不用热能，所以叫冷烫 cold perm; (of hair style) permanent wave produced by applying chemical preparations

冷热病
冷热病[lěng rè bìng]1.〈方 dial.〉疟疾 malaria 2.〈比喻 fig.〉情绪忽高忽低 blow cold and hot; capricious changes in mood

冷盘
冷盘[lěng pán]（～儿 lěngpánr）盛在盘子里的凉菜（多作下酒用 oft. served with wine）cold dish; hors d'oeuvres

冷眼
冷眼[lěng yǎn]1.冷静客观的态度 with a calm and objective attitude; (with) a cold eye; (with) cool detachment：他坐在墙角里，冷眼观察来客的言谈举止。He sat in a corner, watching with a cold eye how the guests were conducting themselves. 2.冷淡的待遇 cold shoulder：冷眼相待 give someone the cold shoulder

冷眼旁观
冷眼旁观[lěng yǎn páng guān]用冷静或冷淡的态度从旁观看（多指可以参加而不愿意参加） (unwilling to take part in sth. while one should) look on with a cold eye

冷碟儿
冷碟儿[lěng dié r]〈方 dial.〉凉碟儿 cold dish; hors d'oeuvres

冷笑
冷笑[lěng xiào] 含有讽刺、不满意、无可奈何、不屑于、不以为然等意味或怒意的笑 sneer; laugh grimly; grin with dissatisfaction, helplessness, bitterness, anger, etc.：嘴角挂着一丝冷笑。There was a sneer in the corner of his mouth.

冷箭
冷箭[lěng jiàn]乘人不备暗中射出的箭。也用来比喻暗地里害人的手段。arrow shot from hiding; sniper's shot; (fig.)hidden means of hurting sb.

冷脸子
冷脸子[lěng liǎn zi] 冷淡的脸色；不温和的脸色 cold face; severe expression

冷色
冷色[lěng sè] 给人以凉爽的感觉的颜色，如白、绿、蓝 cool colours, as white, green, blue; colour that gives someone a feeling of coolness

冷若冰霜
冷若冰霜[lěng ruò bīng shuāng]形容人不热情、不温和。也形容态度严肃，使人不易接近。 be as cold as ice; have a cold (icy or chilly) manner

冷荤
冷荤[lěng hūn] 荤的凉菜 cold meat; cold buffet

冷落
冷落[lěng luò]1.不热闹 unfrequented; desolate：门庭冷落 unfrequented house过去这里很冷落，现在变得很热闹了。It was very desolate here in the past. Now it has become very busy. 2.使受到冷淡的待遇 treat coldly; cold-shoulder; leave out in the cold：别冷落了他。Don't give him a cold shoulder.受到冷落 be cold-shouldered

冷藏
冷藏[lěng cáng] 把食物、药品等贮存在低温设备里，以免变质、腐烂 refrigeration; cold storage; keep food, medicines, etc. in a low-temperature box：冷藏库 cold storage; freezer

冷血动物
冷血动物[lěng xuè dòng wù]1.变温动物的俗称 popular term for 变温动物 biànwēn dòngwù 2.〈比喻 fig.〉没有感情的人 unfeeling person; cold-hearted person

冷言冷语
冷言冷语[lěng yán lěng yǔ] 含有讥讽意味的冷冰冰的话 sarcastic comments; ironical remarks

冷语冰人
冷语冰人[lěng yǔ bīng rén] 用尖酸刻薄的话伤害人 hurt sb. with sarcastic remarks

冷货
冷货[lěng huò] 不容易卖出去的货物 unmarketable goods; goods in little demand亦 also 冷门货 lěngménhuò

冷遇
冷遇[lěng yù] 冷淡的待遇 let-down; cold shoulder：遭到冷遇 be given the cold shoulder; be left out in the cold

冷酷
冷酷[lěng kù]（待人）冷淡苛刻 unfeeling; callous; grim：冷酷无情 unfeeling; cold-blooded

冷锋
冷锋[lěng fēng] 冷气团插入暖气团的底部，并推着暖气团向前移动，在这种情况下，冷、暖气团接触的地带叫做冷锋 cold front; forward edge of a cold air mass advancing under a warmer air mass

冷门
冷门[lěng mén]（～儿 lěngménr）原指赌博时很少有人下注的一门。现比喻很少有人从事的、不时兴的工作、事业等。 (of gambling) stake to which few people choose to place a bet; (fig.)profession, trade or branch of learning that receives little attention; rarefied undertaking, programme, etc.：过去地质学是冷门儿。In the past, geology was a branch of learning that received little attention.

冷静
冷静[lěng jìng]1.人少而静；不热闹 (of a place) quiet：夜深了，街上显得很冷静。It's late in the night, and the street was evidently very quiet. 2.沉着而不感情用事 keep cool; sober; calm：头脑冷静 sober-minded; cool-headed; level-headed冷静下来，好好儿想想。Calm down and think it over.

冷风
冷风[lěng fēng]〈比喻 fig.〉背地里散布的消极言论 cold wind-rumour; gossip：吹冷风 spread rumour (or gossip)刮冷风 spread rumour

冷飕飕
冷飕飕[lěng sōu sōu]（～的 lěngsōusōu·de）形容很冷 cold; chilling; chilly

冷食
冷食[lěng shí] 凉的食品，大多是甜的，如冰棍儿、冰淇淋等 cold snacks, mostly sweet, such as popsicle, ice-cream, etc.：病人忌冷食。Patients should avoid cold snacks.

冷饮
冷饮[lěng yǐn] 凉的饮料，大多是甜的，如汽水、酸梅汤等 cold drinks, mostly sweet, as soda water, sweet-sour plum juice, etc.

冻
冻[dòng]（ㄉㄨㄥˋ）（凍）1.（液体或含水分的东西）遇冷凝固 (of liquid or things containing water) freeze; change from liquid to solid due to extreme cold：不冻港 ice-free port; open port缸里的水冻了。The water in the urn froze.白菜要抢收入窖，不能让它冻坏。(We) have to do an emergency harvest of Chinese cabbage and store them in cellars, since we can't let them be damaged by frost. 2.（冻儿 dòngr）汤汁等凝结成的半固体 jelly; savoury food made from juice or gelatin, which jiggles when moved：肉冻儿 meat jelly鱼冻儿 fish jelly 3.受冷或感到冷 feel very cold; freeze; be frostbitten：我的脚冻了。My feet were frostbitten.今天衣服穿少了，真冻得慌。I did not put on enough clothes and really froze today.相关词组冰冻 | 防冻 | 封冻 | 化冻 | 解冻 | 开冻 | 冷冻 | 凝冻 | 上冻 | 霜冻 | 速冻 | 不冻港 | 果冻儿 | 冰冻三尺，非一日之寒冻疮 | 冻害 | 冻结 | 冻馁 | 冻伤 | 冻雨 | 冻瘃 | 冻豆腐

冻伤
冻伤[dòng shāng]机体的组织由于低温而引起的损伤。轻的皮肤红肿，灼痛或发痒，重的皮肤起水泡，最重的引起皮肤、肌肉甚至骨骼坏死。frostbite; injury to tissue caused by extreme cold, characterized by red and swollen skin, causalgia, itching, blisters, and even necrosis of the skin, muscle or bone

冻害
冻害[dòng hài] 农业上指由于气温下降使植物体的组织受到破坏 (of agriculture) frost damage; tissue damage to plants caused by a sharp decline in temperature

冻疮
冻疮[dòng chuāng] 局部皮肤因受低温损害而成的疮 chilblain; frostbite; painful swelling on the skin caused by overexposure to cold

冻瘃
冻瘃[dòng zhú]〈方 dial.〉冻疮 chilblain

冻结
冻结[dòng jié]1.液体遇冷凝结；使物体受冻凝结 congeal; freeze; change or be changed from liquid to solid by cold 2.〈比喻 fig.〉阻止流动或变动（指人员、资金等）freeze; not allow (money or personnel) to be used or changed：冻结存款 freeze a deposit 3.〈比喻 fig.〉暂不执行或发展 freeze; withhold：协议冻结 freeze the agreement冻结双方关系 freeze the bilateral relations

冻豆腐
冻豆腐[dòng dòu fu] 经过冰冻的豆腐 frozen bean curd

冻雨
冻雨[dòng yǔ] 一种特殊的降水现象，这种雨从天空落下时是0℃以下的过冷却水滴，一落地就结为固态的冰 sleet; freezing rain; rain that freezes as it falls

冻馁
冻馁[dòng něi]〈书 fml.〉寒冷饥饿；受冻挨饿 cold and hunger; be cold and hungry

冼
冼[Xiǎn]（ㄒㄧㄢˇ） 姓 a surname

冽
冽[liè]（ㄌㄧㄝˋ）〈书 fml.〉冷 cold; chilly; icy：凛冽 piercingly cold山高风冽。Cold winds blow in the high mountains.相关词组凛冽 | 清冽

净
净1[jìng]（ㄐㄧㄥˋ）（淨）1.清洁；干净 clean：净水 clean water脸要洗净。One's face must be washed clean. 2.擦洗干净 make sth. clean：净一净桌面儿。Clean the top of the table. 3.没有余剩 with nothing left：细收净打 harvest carefully and thresh thoroughly碗里的水没喝净。The water in the bowl has not been drunk up. 4.纯 net：净重 net weight净利 net profit 5.〈副词 adv.〉表示单纯而没有别的；只 all; all the time：书架上净是科技书籍。The bookshelves are full of books on science and technology.这几天净下雨。It's been raining these last few days.别净说些没用的话。Don't engage in such useless talk all the time.净2[jìng]（ㄐㄧㄥˋ）（淨）戏曲角色行当，扮演性格刚烈或粗暴的男性人物 painted-face role; one of the main roles in traditional opera, representing a man of virile or rough character; 通称 generally called 花脸 huāliǎn相关词组白净 | 纯净 | 副净 | 干净 | 红净 | 洁净 | 明净 | 清净 | 素净 | 匀净 | 自净作用 | 窗明几净净菜 | 净化 | 净角 | 净尽 | 净口 | 净利 | 净手 | 净桶 | 净土 | 净余 | 净值 | 净重 | 净产值

净产值
净产值[jìng chǎn zhí] 生产单位、生产部门或整个国民经济在一定时期内新创造的价值 net output value; newly created value in a given period of time by a production unit, a production department, or the entire national economy

净余
净余[jìng yú]除去用掉的剩余下来的（钱或物）(of money or things) net balance; remainder; surplus; amount that remains when use or need is satisfied

净值
净值[jìng zhí] 生产部门在一定时期内投入生产的活劳动所新创造的价值，是总产值减去物质消耗后的余额 net worth; net value; newly created value by a production department through investment in live labour for a given period of time, which is what remains of gross production after deducting material costs

净利
净利[jìng lì] 企业总收入中除去一切消耗费用和税款、利息等所剩下的利润（区别于‘毛利’as compared with ‘gross profit’）net profit; excess of income over expenditure, taxes and interest, as in a business

净化
净化[jìng huà] 清除杂质使物体纯净 purify; eliminate material impurities or imperfections：净化污水 purify sewage净化城市空气 purify the air of the city净化心灵 purify one's soul净化社会风气 purify public morality

净口
净口[jìng kǒu] 曲艺表演中指去掉低级、庸俗的语言（区别于‘荤口’as compared with ‘dirty language’）clean language; quyi performance without vulgar, indecent language

净土
净土[jìng tǔ]1.〈佛教 Budd.〉认为佛、菩萨等居住的世界，没有尘世的污染，所以叫净土 Pure Land (the world resided by Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, free from worldly contamination) 2.泛指没有受污染的干净地方 (in a broad sense) unpolluted place

净尽
净尽[jìng jìn] 一点儿不剩 completely used up; with nothing left：消灭净尽 utterly annihilate

净手
净手[jìng shǒu]1.〈方 dial.〉洗手 wash one's hands：净一净手 wash one's hands净净手 wash one's hands 2.〈婉辞 euph.〉指排泄大小便 relieve oneself

净桶
净桶[jìng tǒng]〈婉辞 euph.〉马桶 nightstool; closestool; commode

净菜
净菜[jìng cài] 经过择洗等加工处理后出售的蔬菜 cleaned vegetable; vegetable sold after being washed and trimmed：净菜上市。Cleaned vegetables are available on the market.

净角
净角[jìng jué]（～儿 jìngjuér） 同 same as 净2 jìng

净重
净重[jìng zhòng] 货物除去包装的封皮、盛器或牲畜家禽等除去毛皮或毛的重量（区别于‘毛重’as compared with ‘gross weight’）net weight; weight of goods after deducting all tare or the like; weight of livestock or domestic poultry excluding their hides or feathers

凄
凄[qī]（ㄑㄧ）（淒、悽）1.寒冷 icy; frigid; chilly：风雨凄凄 chilly wind and endless rain 2.形容冷落萧条 disheartening; somber; grim; dismal：凄凉 desolate凄清 bloomy 3.形容悲伤难过 lamentable; heartbroken; woebegone：凄然 mournful; sad凄切 melancholy相关词组悲凄凄惨 | 凄恻 | 凄楚 | 凄怆 | 凄厉 | 凄凉 | 凄迷 | 凄切 | 凄清 | 凄然 | 凄婉 | 凄惘 | 凄风苦雨

凄凉
凄凉[qī liáng]1.寂寞冷落（多用来形容环境或景物 oft. used to describe environment or scenery）desolate; dreary：残垣断壁，一片凄凉。There was something utterly dreary about these crumbling walls. 2.凄惨 sad; miserable：身世凄凉 life experience steeped in misery凄凉的岁月 years of poverty and misery

凄切
凄切[qī qiè] 凄凉而悲哀，多形容声音 afflicting; grievous：寒蝉凄切。Cicadas were wailing woefully over the chill of the day.

凄厉
凄厉[qī lì]（声音）凄凉而尖锐 (of voice) sad and shrill：凄厉的喊叫声 heartrending wail风声凄厉。The wind moaned dismally over the fields.

凄婉
凄婉[qī wǎn]1.哀伤 doleful：流露出不胜凄婉之情 pitiful outpouring of sorrowful feelings 2.（声音）悲哀而婉转 (of sound) plaintively melodious：凄婉的笛声 heartrending notes of a flute

凄怆
凄怆[qī chuàng]〈书 fml.〉凄惨；悲伤 piteous; painful; lugubrious

凄恻
凄恻[qī cè]〈书 fml.〉哀伤；悲痛 heartbroken; sorrowful

凄惘
凄惘[qī wǎng] 悲伤失意；怅惘 distracted; listless：凄惘之情 feeling of frustration and sadness

凄惨
凄惨[qī cǎn] 凄凉悲惨 plaintive; dreary：歌声凄惨 mournful tone of a song晚境凄惨 spend one's remaining years in poverty and melancholy

凄楚
凄楚[qī chǔ]〈书 fml.〉凄惨痛苦 wretched; miserable

凄清
凄清[qī qīng]1.形容清冷 sombre; cheerless：凄清的月光 cheerless moonlight秋景凄清 dreary autumn scene 2.凄凉 sad; lamentable：琴声凄清 plaintive tune of a zither

凄然
凄然[qī rán]〈书 fml.〉形容悲伤 distressing：凄然泪下。Tears of sorrow roll down the cheeks.

凄迷
凄迷[qī mí]〈书 fml.〉1.（景物）凄凉而模糊 (of scenes and sights) fuzzy and dreary：月色凄迷 the moon donning a dreary cue and a fuzzy image 2.悲伤；怅惘 grief-stricken：神情凄迷 woebegone looks

凄风苦雨
凄风苦雨[qī fēng kǔ yǔ] 形容天气恶劣 moaning wind and pattering rain;〈比喻 fig.〉境遇悲惨凄凉 in wretched circumstances; distress亦 also 凄风冷雨 qī fēng lěng yǔ

准
准1[zhǔn]（ㄓㄨㄣˇ）准许 allow; grant; permit：批准 approve; sanction不准迟到或早退。Neither arriving late nor leaving early is permitted.准2[zhǔn]（ㄓㄨㄣˇ）（準）1.标准 standard; norm; criterion：准绳 criterion水准 level准则 norms; standard以此为准。Take this as the standard (or criterion). 2.依据；依照 in accordance with; follow：准此办理。Settle by following this precedent. 3.准确 accurate; exact：瞄准 aim at钟走得不准。This clock does not keep good time.他投球很准。He is a crack basketball shooter. 4.一定 definitely; certainly：我明天准去。I'll definitely be there tomorrow.他不准能来。He may not be able to come.任务准能完成。The task is sure to be accomplished. 5.程度上虽不完全够，但可以作为某类事物看待的 quasi-; para-：准将 (US Army, Air Force and Marine Corps) brigadier general; (British Army and Royal Marines) brigadier; (US and Royal Navy) commodore; (Royal Air Force) air commodore准平原 peneplain相关词组保准 | 标准 | 吃准 | 定准 | 核准 | 获准 | 基准 | 精准 | 靠准 | 隆准 | 瞄准 | 批准 | 水准 | 校准 | 一准 | 音准 | 允准 | 作准 | 标准粉 | 标准化 | 标准时 | 标准音 | 标准语 | 没准儿 | 水准仪 | 吃不准 | 标准时区 | 标准大气压准保 | 准备 | 准点 | 准定 | 准儿 | 准话 | 准将 | 准确 | 准绳 | 准时 | 准头 | 准尉 | 准信 | 准星 | 准许 | 准予 | 准则 | 准稿子 | 准平原 | 准谱儿

准予
准予[zhǔn yǔ] 公文用语，表示准许 (used in official documents) grant; permit; approve; allow：成绩合格，准予毕业。Academic records up to standards, and graduation approved.

准保
准保[zhǔn bǎo]〈副词 adv.〉表示可以肯定或保证 certainly; for sure：准保没错儿 for sure他准保不会来。He is definitely not coming.

准信
准信[zhǔn xìn]（～儿 zhǔnxìnr）准确可靠的消息 accurate information; definite and reliable information：你哪天能来，赶快给我个准信。Let me know as soon as possible exactly when you can come.

准儿
准儿[zhǔn r]确定的主意、方式、规律等（大多用在‘有、没有’后面 usu. following 有 yǒu or 没有 méi·yǒu）certain; sure; positive; definite (idea, method, law, etc.)：心里有准儿 feel sure; know what one is doing; be quite positive about他到底来不来，还没有准儿。We are not sure yet whether he will come.

准则
准则[zhǔn zé] 言论、行动等所依据的原则 norm; standard; criterion; principle that serves as the basis for one's statements, actions, etc.：行动准则 code of conduct国际关系准则 basic norms of international relations

准备
准备[zhǔn bèi]1.预先安排或筹划 prepare; get ready; arrange or plan in advance：精神准备 mental preparation准备发言提纲 draft an outline for a speech准备一个空箱子放书 prepare an empty case for books 2.打算 intend; plan; think：春节我准备回家。I intend to return home during the Spring Festival.昨天我本来准备去看你，因为临时有事没去成。I planned to come to see you yesterday, but I didn't as I was incidentally occupied.

准头
准头[zhǔn tou]（～儿 zhǔn·tour）射击、说话等的准确性 (of marksmanship, choice of words, etc.) accuracy：枪法挺有准头 shoot well; be a good or crack shot; be an expert marksman; shoot with great accuracy说话没个准头 speak without credibility

准定
准定[zhǔn dìng]〈副词 adv.〉表示可以肯定；一定 certainly; undoubtedly; for sure：吃下这药准定会好。You will surely recover after taking this medicine.我准定去，你就放心好了。I will go for sure. You can bet it.

准将
准将[zhǔn jiàng] 某些国家军衔的一级，在少将之下，校官之上 brigadier general; a grade of military rank in some countries, lower than a major general or rear admiral, and higher than a field officer

准尉
准尉[zhǔn wèi] 某些国家军衔的一级，在上士之上，少尉之下 warrant officer; a grade of military rank in some countries, higher than a sergeant and lower than a captain or lieutenant

准平原
准平原[zhǔn píng yuán] 隆起的地面经长期剥蚀而形成的平原 peneplain; plain forming with long-term erosion of the hilly ground

准时
准时[zhǔn shí] 按规定的时间 punctual; on time; on schedule; according to the prescribed time：准时出席 come on time列车准时到达。The train arrived on schedule (or at the scheduled time).

准星
准星[zhǔn xīng]1.秤上的定盘星 zero point on a steelyard他心眼儿太活，说话没准星。He is too unpredicative, and his words are not reliable. 2.枪上瞄准装置的一部分，在枪口上端 front sight (of a gun); cross-hair; the part of a gun-sighting device on the top of the muzzle

准点
准点[zhǔn diǎn]（～儿 zhǔndiǎnr）准时 on time; on the dot

准确
准确[zhǔn què] 行动的结果完全符合实际或预期 accurate; exact; precise; (of the result of an action) fully conform to reality or expectations：准确性 accuracy; precision; preciseness计算准确 be precise in calculations准确地击中目标 hit the target accurately

准稿子
准稿子[zhǔn gǎo zi] 准谱儿 certain; sure; definite：办事心里要有个准稿子才行。One must have a degree of certainty in doing things.

准绳
准绳[zhǔn shéng] 测定平直的器具 yardstick; tool to determine straightness;〈比喻 fig.〉言论、行动等所依据的原则或标准 principle or criterion serving as the basis of one's statements, actions, etc.

准许
准许[zhǔn xǔ] 同意人的要求 permit; allow; grant：准许通行 permit or allow to go through准许办理出境手续 permit to go through the formalities for leaving a country

准话
准话[zhǔn huà]（～儿 zhǔnhuàr）确定的话 definite message or information：什么时候定好日子，我再给您个准话。I'll give you a definite answer when we have fixed the date.

准谱儿
准谱儿[zhǔn pǔ r] 准儿 certain; sure：下一步怎么个搞法儿，至今还没准谱儿。We are not yet certain what the next step is.

凇
凇[sōng]（ㄙㄨㄥ）另见  雾凇 wù·sōng and 雨凇 yǔsōng相关词组雾凇 | 雨凇

凉
凉[liáng]（ㄌㄧㄤˊ）（涼）1.温度低；冷（指天气时，比‘冷’的程度浅 lesser in degree than ‘cold’ when referring to weather）cool; cold：阴凉 shady and cool凉水 cool water过了秋分天就凉了。It gets cool after Autumnal Equinox. 2.〈比喻 fig.〉灰心或失望 disheartened or disappointed; lose heart; discouraged：听到这消息，他心里就凉了。His heart sank at the news.爹这么一说，我就凉了半截儿。My heart sank at what Father had said.另见  liàng凉[liàng]（ㄌㄧㄤˋ）（涼）把热的东西放一会儿，使温度降低 cool：粥太烫，凉一凉再喝。The porridge is too hot. I'll have it after it cools a bit.另见  liáng相关词组悲凉 | 冰凉 | 苍凉 | 乘凉 | 冲凉 | 风凉 | 荒凉 | 纳凉 | 凄凉 | 清凉 | 秋凉 | 受凉 | 歇凉 | 炎凉 | 阴凉 | 荫凉 | 着凉 | 风凉话 | 清凉油 | 树凉儿 | 手搭凉棚 | 树阴凉儿 | 世态炎凉凉拌 | 凉菜 | 凉碟 | 凉粉 | 凉快 | 凉帽 | 凉棚 | 凉薯 | 凉爽 | 凉水 | 凉台 | 凉亭 | 凉席 | 凉鞋 | 凉药 | 凉意 | 凉白开 | 凉爽呢 | 凉丝丝 | 凉飕飕

凉丝丝
凉丝丝[liáng sī sī]（～的 liángsīsī·de）形容稍微有点儿凉 coolish; rather cool; a bit cool：清晨的空气凉丝丝的，沁人心肺。The cool air in the early morning is most refreshing.

凉亭
凉亭[liáng tíng] 供休息或避雨的亭子 wayside pavilion; summer house; kiosk

凉台
凉台[liáng tái] 可供乘凉的阳台或晒台 balcony; veranda

凉席
凉席[liáng xí] 夏天坐卧时铺的席，多用竹蔑、草等编成 summer sleeping mat, usu. woven of split bamboo, straw, etc.

凉帽
凉帽[liáng mào] 夏天戴的遮挡阳光的帽子 summer hat; sun hat; straw hat

凉快
凉快[liáng kuai]1.清凉爽快 nice and cool; pleasantly cool：下了一阵雨，天气凉快多了。It's much cooler after the rain. 2.使身体清凉爽快 cool oneself; cool off：坐下凉快凉快再接着干。Let's sit down and cool off a bit before we start working again.到树阴下凉快一下。Let's sit in the shade and cool off a bit.

凉意
凉意[liáng yì] 凉的感觉 slight chill in the air：立秋过后，早晚有些凉意了。After the Beginning of Autumn there is a slight chill in the air in the mornings and evenings.

凉拌
凉拌[liáng bàn] 把凉的食品加调料拌和 (of food) cold and dressed with sauce：凉拌菜 cold dish凉拌粉皮 cold sheet jelly with dressings黄瓜可以凉拌着吃。Cucumber can be eaten when it is cold and dressed with sauce.

凉棚
凉棚[liáng péng] 夏天搭起来遮蔽太阳的棚 mat awning; mat shed手搭凉棚（把手掌平放在额前）往前看 put one's hand before one's forehead and look ahead

凉水
凉水[liáng shuǐ]1.温度低的水 cool water 2.生水 unboiled water

凉爽
凉爽[liáng shuǎng] 清凉爽快 delightfully cool; pleasantly cool：晚风习习，十分凉爽。It's cool and soothing in the evening breeze.

凉爽呢
凉爽呢[liáng shuǎng ní] 一种平纹的花呢，织后经热定型处理，具有坚固耐穿、挺括、光滑等优点，多用来做男女服装 plain fancy suiting, which is heat set after it is woven, durable, glossy and smooth, and used for making men's and women's suits; 俗称 popularly known as 毛的确良 máodíquèliáng

凉白开
凉白开[liáng bái kāi] 放凉了的白开水 cold boiled water

凉碟
凉碟[liáng dié]（～儿 liángdiér）盛在碟子或小盘子里的凉菜 cold dish

凉粉
凉粉[liáng fěn]（～儿 liángfěnr）一种食品，用绿豆粉等制成，多用作料凉拌着吃 bean-starch noodles, oft. served cold with dressings

凉药
凉药[liáng yào] 一般指败火、解热的中药，如黄连、大黄、黄芩等 antipyretic; traditional Chinese medicine of a cold nature for reducing fever or inflammation, such as the rhizome of Chinese gold thread (Coptis chinensis), rhubarb, the root of large-flowered skullcap (Scutellaria baicalensis)

凉菜
凉菜[liáng cài] 凉着吃的菜 cold dish

凉薯
凉薯[liáng shǔ]〈方 dial.〉豆薯 yam bean

凉鞋
凉鞋[liáng xié] 夏天穿的鞋帮通风的鞋 sandals

凉飕飕
凉飕飕[liáng sōu sōu]（～的 liángsōusōu·de）形容有些凉 chilly; chill：早立秋，凉飕飕；晚立秋，热死牛。If autumn begins early, it will be cool in the weeks to come; if autumn begins late, it will stifle even the cattle to death.

凊
凊[qìng]（ㄑㄧㄥˋ）〈书 fml.〉凉 cool

凋
凋[diāo]（ㄉㄧㄠ）（彫）凋谢 wither; fade (away); wilt：凋零 wither; wilt松柏后凋。The pine and the cypress do not wither.相关词组凋败 | 凋敝 | 凋零 | 凋落 | 凋谢

凋敝
凋敝[diāo bì]（生活）困苦；（事业）衰败 (of life) hard; destitute; (of business) depressed：民生凋敝。The people live in destitution.百业凋敝。All business languished.

凋落
凋落[diāo luò] 同 same as 凋谢 diāoxiè

凋谢
凋谢[diāo xiè]1.（草木花叶）脱落 (of flowers and leaves of plants) fall off：百花凋谢。All the flowers have withered and fallen. 2.指老年人死 (of old people) die; pass away：老成凋谢 passing away of a worthy old person

凋败
凋败[diāo bài] 凋谢衰败 wither; wilt：草木凋败。All the trees and plants have withered.

凋零
凋零[diāo líng]1.（草木）凋谢零落 (of plants) wither; wilt：万木凋零。All the trees have withered. 2.衰落 decline; fall; go downhill：家道凋零。The fortune of the family is waning.

凌
凌1[líng]（ㄌㄧㄥˊ）（淩） 1.侵犯；欺侮 bully; insult：欺凌 bully and humiliate凌辱 insult; humiliate; maltreat; treat insolently盛气凌人 domineering; arrogant; of an overweening manner 2.逼近 approach; draw close：凌晨 before dawn; in the small hours 3.升高；在空中 rise high; tower or soar aloft：凌空 soar high into the sky; be high up in the sky凌云 reach the clouds; soar to the sky凌霄 reach the clouds; soar to the sky 4.(Líng) 姓 a surname凌2[líng]（ㄌㄧㄥˊ）〈方 dial.〉冰（多指块状或锥状的 usu. shaped like cubes or cones）ice：冰凌 icicle凌锥 icicle相关词组冰凌 | 防凌 | 驾凌 | 欺凌 | 侵凌 | 清凌凌 | 冰激凌 | 盛气凌人凌 | 凌晨 | 凌迟 | 凌驾 | 凌空 | 凌厉 | 凌轹 | 凌乱 | 凌虐 | 凌辱 | 凌侮 | 凌汛 | 凌夷 | 凌云 | 凌杂 | 凌锥 | 凌霄花

凌乱
凌乱[líng luàn] 不整齐；没有秩序 in disorder; in a mess; in confusion：凌乱不堪 in a state of utter confusion; in a fearful mess楼上传来凌乱的脚步声。A flurry of footsteps was heard upstairs.亦 also 零乱 língluàn

凌云
凌云[líng yún] 直上云霄 reach the clouds; soar to the skies：高耸凌云 reach for the clouds凌云壮志 high aspirations

凌侮
凌侮[líng wǔ] 欺侮；侮辱 bully; insult; humiliate

凌厉
凌厉[líng lì] 形容迅速而气势猛烈 swift and fierce; quick and powerful：朔风凌厉 fierce north wind凌厉的攻势 rapid and fierce attacks

凌夷
凌夷[líng yí]〈书 fml.〉衰败；走下坡路 decline; deteriorate：风俗凌夷。The customs are dying out or in decline.国势凌夷。The state is declining or in decline.亦 also 陵夷 língyí

凌晨
凌晨[líng chén] 天快亮的时候 before dawn; in the small hours

凌杂
凌杂[líng zá] 错杂凌乱 in disorder; in a mess

凌汛
凌汛[líng xùn] 江河上游冰雪融化，下游还没有解冻而造成的洪水 ice run; flood caused when snow and ice has thawed on the upper, but not the lower, reaches of a river

凌空
凌空[líng kōng] 高高地在天空中或高升到天空中 soar high into the sky; be high in the sky; soar or tower aloft：高阁凌空 towering pavilion雪花凌空飞舞。Snowflakes whirled down from the sky.飞机凌空而过。The plane zoomed through the sky.

凌虐
凌虐[líng nüè]〈书 fml.〉欺侮；虐待 maltreat; tyrannize; treat cruelly：凌虐百姓 tyrannize the masses备受凌虐 suffer all kinds of maltreatment

凌轹
凌轹[líng lì]〈书 fml.〉1.欺压 bully and oppress 2.排挤 push out; squeeze out; exclude：凌轹同人 squeeze out or exclude one's colleague亦 also 陵轹 línglì

凌辱
凌辱[líng rǔ] 欺侮；侮辱 bully; insult; humiliate：凌辱弱小 ride roughshod over the small and weak受尽凌辱 suffer all kinds of humiliation

凌迟
凌迟[líng chí] 古代的一种残酷死刑，先分割犯人的肢体，然后割断咽喉 put to death by dismembering the body, and ultimately cutting the throat (a cruel ancient form of capital punishment)亦 also 陵迟 língchí

凌锥
凌锥[líng zhuī]〈方 dial.〉冰锥 icicle：屋檐上挂着一尺来长的凌锥。Long icicles hung more than a foot long from the eaves.

凌霄花
凌霄花[líng xiāo huā]落叶藤本植物，攀援茎，羽状复叶，小叶卵形，边缘有锯齿，花鲜红色，花冠漏斗形，结蒴果。花、茎、叶都可入药。Chinese trumpet creeper (Campsis grandiflora); deciduous liana with a climbing stem, pinnately compound leaves, oval, saw-tooth edged leaflets, bright red flowers, funnel-shaped corollas, and capsules, whose flowers, stem and leaves can be used as medicine; 亦 also 鬼目 guǐmù 或 or 紫葳 zǐwēi

凌驾
凌驾[líng jià]高出（别人）；压倒（别的事物）place oneself above; override：不能把自己凌驾于群众之上。One should not lord it over the masses.救人的念头凌驾一切，他转身向大火冲去。His logic overridden by his desire to save the people, he turned round and rushed into the blaze.

凌
凌[líng duó]〈方 dial.〉冰锥 icicle

减
减[jiǎn]（ㄐㄧㄢˇ）（減）1.从总体或某个数量中去掉一部分 subtract from the total or a certain number：削减 cut down裁减 reduction; cut减员 reduce the staff偷工减料 do shoddy work and use inferior material; scamp work and stint material五减三是二。Five minus three is two. or Three from five is two. 2.降低；衰退 reduce; decrease; cut：减色 fade; pale; lose colour; lose lustre; impair the excellence of工作热情有增无减 work with ever increasing zeal人虽老了，干活还是不减当年！Although he is old, he works as energetically as he did before.相关词组裁减 | 递减 | 核减 | 节减 | 清减 | 衰减 | 缩减 | 消减 | 削减 | 偷工减料减仓 | 减产 | 减低 | 减法 | 减肥 | 减负 | 减河 | 减缓 | 减亏 | 减免 | 减轻 | 减弱 | 减色 | 减少 | 减速 | 减损 | 减缩 | 减退 | 减刑 | 减削 | 减员 | 减灾

减亏
减亏[jiǎn kuī] 减少亏损（多用于企业 usu. of enterprises）reduce losses：减亏增盈 reduce losses and increase profits这家钢厂今年减亏三千万元。This year the steel plant has reduced losses by 30 million yuan.

减产
减产[jiǎn chǎn] 产量减少；减少生产 reduction of output; drop in production：粮食减产 grain output drops; cut or drop in the grain production采取减产措施，降低库存 adopt output-control measures to cut down the grain stock (or reserve)

减仓
减仓[jiǎn cāng] 指投资者减轻仓位 (of investors) sell shares：逢高减仓，注意风险。Sell shares when their price is high as a precaution against risk.

减低
减低[jiǎn dī] 降低 reduce; lower; bring down; cut; go down; fall：减低物价 reduce prices; cut down prices减低速度 lower the speed; slow down

减免
减免[jiǎn miǎn]减轻或免除（捐税、刑罚等）reduce or remit (taxation, punishment, etc.); reduction of or exemption from (taxation); mitigate or annul (a punishment)

减刑
减刑[jiǎn xíng] 法院根据犯人在服刑期间改恶从善的程度，依法把原来判处的刑罚减轻 reduce a penalty; reduce a sentence; commute (or mitigate) a sentence; court reduces the sentence passed on a convict in the light of his conduct during his term of imprisonment

减削
减削[jiǎn xuē] 削减 cut down; reduce：减削经费 cut down the funds (or outlay)

减员
减员[jiǎn yuán]1.由于伤病、死亡等原因而人员减少（多指部队 oft. in an armed force）depletion of members as a result of casualties, illnesses，etc. 2.裁减人员 cut down on the size of a staff

减少
减少[jiǎn shǎo] 减去一部分 pare down; reduce; decrease; lessen; cut down：减少人员 reduce the staff减少麻烦 take less trouble to do sth.工作中的缺点减少了。There are fewer mistakes in our work.

减弱
减弱[jiǎn ruò]（气势、力量等）变弱 weaken; abate：风势减弱。The wind has subsided.兴趣减弱 become less interested凝聚力减弱了。The organization is losing its rallying power among its staff.

减损
减损[jiǎn sǔn] 减少；减弱 reduce; weaken：虽经磨难，而斗志丝毫没有减损。Despite the hardships, the morale is not at all sapped.

减河
减河[jiǎn hé] 为了减少河流的水量，在原来河道之外另开的通入海洋、湖泊、洼地或别的河流的河道 water conservancy distributary; cut an additional canal to the sea, a lake, a low-lying land or another river apart from the original course in order to reduce the flow of a river

减法
减法[jiǎn fǎ]数学中的一种运算方法。最简单的是数的减法，即从一个数减去另一个数的计算方法。subtraction; mathematical process of finding the difference between two numbers or quantities; the simplest process is subtraction of numbers, namely, the process of subtracting a number from another number

减灾
减灾[jiǎn zāi] 采取措施，减少自然灾害造成的损失 disaster mitigation;take measures to reduce damage caused by natural disasters： 科技减灾 mitigate the effects of disasters by science and technology减灾贵在预防。Prevention is what counts in disaster mitigation.

减缓
减缓[jiǎn huǎn]（程度）减轻；（速度）变慢 retard; slow down：老年人新陈代谢减缓。Metabolism in old people invariably slows down.

减缩
减缩[jiǎn suō] 缩减 reduce; cut down; retrench：减缩课时 reduce class hours; reduce the number of class periods

减肥
减肥[jiǎn féi] 指采取节制饮食、增加锻炼等办法减轻肥胖的程度 lose weight; slim：减肥茶 weight-losing tea减肥健美操 pound-shedding exercises

减色
减色[jiǎn sè] 指事物的精彩程度降低 lose lustre; mar the excellence of; detract from the merit of：原定的一些节目不能演出，使今天的晚会减色不少。Some items on the programme were cancelled, greatly spoiling the performance this evening.

减负
减负[jiǎn fù] 减轻过重的、不合理的负担 alleviate an excessive, unreasonable burden：治理乱收费现象，给农民减负 rectify arbitrary exaction of fees and alleviate the burden on farmers少留家庭作业是对学生减负的主要措施。A major measure in alleviating the burden on students is to give them less homework.

减轻
减轻[jiǎn qīng] 减少重量、数量或程度 abate; decrease; reduce; lighten; ease; alleviate; mitigate：减轻负担 lighten the burden; reduce the burden病势减轻。The patient's condition has eased. or The patient's condition is getting better.

减退
减退[jiǎn tuì]（程度）下降；减弱 (of degree) drop; go down：近年视力有些减退。My eyesight has been failing these years.雨后，炎热减退了许多。The heat abated considerably after the rain.

减速
减速[jiǎn sù] 降低速度 slow down; decelerate; retard：减速行驶 drive at a reduced speed

凑
凑[còu]（ㄘㄡˋ）（湊）1.拼凑；聚集 gather; pool; collect：凑钱 pool money; start a fund凑足了人数 gather together enough people; get quorum大家凑到这里来听他讲故事。People gathered here to listen to his story-telling. 2.碰；赶；趁 happen by chance; take advantage of：凑巧 luckily凑热闹 join in the fun 3.接近 move close to; press near：往前凑凑 move closer to the front凑到跟前 press near sb. or a place她拿起一束鲜花凑着鼻子闻。She picked up a bouquet of fresh flowers and pressed it to her nose.相关词组帮凑 | 紧凑 | 拼凑 | 生凑 | 杂凑凑搭 | 凑合 | 凑集 | 凑近 | 凑拢 | 凑钱 | 凑巧 | 凑手 | 凑数 | 凑胆子 | 凑份子 | 凑趣儿 | 凑热闹 | 凑整儿

凑份子
凑份子[còu fèn zi]1.各人拿出若干钱合起来送礼或办事 pool money to give to sb. as a gift or to achieve sth. 2.〈方 dial.〉指添麻烦 add to the trouble

凑合
凑合[còu he]1.聚集 gather together; collect; assemble：下班以后大伙儿都凑合在一起练习唱歌。People gathered together after work to practise singing. 2.拼凑 improvise：预先把发言提纲准备好，不要临时凑合。Please prepare your speech beforehand, don't improvise. 3.将就 make do; not too bad：没有什么好菜，凑合着吃点吧。Sorry that the dishes are nothing special. We'll just make do.这两年日子过得还凑合。Life wasn't too bad the past two years.

凑巧
凑巧[còu qiǎo] 表示正是时候或正遇着所希望的或所不希望的事情 luckily; fortunately; as luck would have it：我正想去找他，凑巧他来了。I was just about to look for him when he showed up.真不凑巧，我还没有赶到车站，车就开了。What bad luck! The train left just before I got to the station.

凑手
凑手[còu shǒu]使用起来方便；顺手（常指手边的钱、物、人等）at hand; within easy reach：这把钳子凑手。This pair of pliers is easy to use.钱不凑手，下次再买吧。I don't have that much money on me; let's buy it next time.

凑拢
凑拢[còu lǒng] 朝一个地点靠近 get closer：大伙凑拢一点，商量一下明天的工作。Come closer, everybody, we'll discuss what to do tomorrow.

凑搭
凑搭[còu da]〈方 dial.〉拼凑 rake together; pool

凑数
凑数[còu shù]（～儿 còu∥shùr）1.凑足数额 make up the number or amount 2.充数 serve as a stopgap：人员要精干，不能随便找几个人凑数。The employees must be capable and efficient, and not just anyone to fill the vacancies.

凑整儿
凑整儿[còu zhěng r] 凑成整数 make a round number：这里有九十八元，你再出两元，凑个整儿吧。I've got 98 yuan with me. Please give me two yuan to make a round hundred.

凑热闹
凑热闹[còu rè nao]（～儿 còu rè·naor）1.到热闹的地方跟大家一起玩儿 join in the fun; take part in the merry-making：孩子们玩得很起劲，我也去凑个热闹。The children are playing with such spirit that I'm going to join in the fun. 2.指添麻烦 add trouble to：这里够忙的，别再来凑热闹了！We're already busy enough, don't make more trouble for us.

凑胆子
凑胆子[còu dǎn zi]〈方 dial.〉聚合许多人以壮声势 build up strength by gathering a lot of people

凑趣儿
凑趣儿[còu qù r]1.迎合别人的兴趣，使高兴 join in (a game, etc.) just to please others 2.逗笑取乐 make a joke about; poke fun at：他跟我很熟，所以故意拿我凑趣儿。As a close acquaintance, he often pokes fun at me.没事时姐妹们在一起凑趣儿。The girls joke around when they have free time together.

凑近
凑近[còu jìn] 朝某个目标靠近 get closer; get nearer：他凑近小王的耳朵，叽里咕噜说了一阵。He whispered something in Xiao Wang's ear.

凑钱
凑钱[còu qián] 凑集钱（办某事）；筹集款项 pool money; start a fund：大家凑钱买了些图书资料。Everyone chipped in to buy some books and materials.

凑集
凑集[còu jí] 凑在一起；聚集 gather together：人烟凑集 be densely populated凑集技术力量 pool a technical force

凓
凓[lì]（ㄌㄧˋ）〈书 fml.〉寒冷 cold：凓冽（非常寒冷）very cold

凘
凘[sī]（ㄙ）〈书 fml.〉解冻时流动的冰 floating ice; (ice) floe

凛
凛[lǐn]（ㄌㄧㄣˇ）（凜）1.寒冷 cold; frigid：凛冽 bitingly cold; bitter cold; piercingly cold 2.严肃；严厉 rigorous; strict; severe; stern：凛遵（严肃地遵照）strictly follow凛然 severe; awe-inspiring凛若冰霜 (of manners) as cold as ice; look severe or stern; of a forbidding manner 3.〈书 fml.〉畏惧；害怕 afraid; fearful; apprehensive：凛于夜行 be afraid of or dread going on a journey by night相关词组大义凛然凛冽 | 凛凛 | 凛然

凛冽
凛冽[lǐn liè] 刺骨地寒冷 bone-chilly; bitingly cold; bitter cold; piercingly cold：北风凛冽。The north wind is bitterly cold.

凛凛
凛凛[lǐn lǐn]1.寒冷 cold; frigid：寒风凛凛 piercing wind 2.严肃；可敬畏的样子 stern; awe-inspiring：凛凛正气 awe-inspiring integrity威风凛凛 majestic-looking; of an awe-inspiring demeanour; of a dignified bearing

凛然
凛然[lǐn rán] 严肃；可敬畏的样子 stern; awe-inspiring：大义凛然 inspire awe by upholding justice态度凛然 stern in manner; with a severe manner凛然不可侵犯 stern and inviolable; of a stern and forbidding countenance

凝
凝[níng]（ㄋㄧㄥˊ）1.凝结 congeal; coagulate; curdle; condense：凝固 solidify凝冻 freeze冷凝 condensate; condensation 2.注意力集中 with riveted attention：凝思 think hard; contemplate凝视 gaze; fix one's eyes on相关词组冷凝 | 混凝土 | 钢筋混凝土凝冻 | 凝固 | 凝合 | 凝华 | 凝集 | 凝结 | 凝聚 | 凝练 | 凝眸 | 凝目 | 凝神 | 凝视 | 凝思 | 凝望 | 凝想 | 凝脂 | 凝滞 | 凝重 | 凝固点 | 凝固热 | 凝聚力 | 凝固汽油弹

凝冻
凝冻[níng dòng] 凝结；冻结 freeze：河水凝冻。The river is frozen.

凝华
凝华[níng huá] 物质由气态不经液态直接变为固态 sublimate; transform directly from a gaseous state to a solid without first becoming a liquid

凝合
凝合[níng hé] 凝结，聚合 coagulate; congeal; solidify

凝固
凝固[níng gù]1.由液体变成固体 solidify; turn from liquid into solid：蛋白质遇热会凝固。Protein becomes solid when heated. 2.〈比喻 fig.〉固定不变：停滞 stiff; fixed; stubborn; inflexible：思想凝固 stubborn thought凝固的目光 fixed eyes

凝固汽油弹
凝固汽油弹[níng gù qì yóu dàn] 一种爆炸时能发出高温火焰的炸弹，内装用汽油和其他化学药品制成的胶状物，爆炸时向四周溅射，发出1，000℃左右的高温，并能粘在其他物体上长时间燃烧 napalm bomb; bomb that emits high-temperature flames upon explosion, containing a gelatinous substance made of gas and other chemicals, which sprays when the bomb explodes, releasing heat of around 1,000℃, and which can adhere itself to other matters and burn for a prolonged time

凝固点
凝固点[níng gù diǎn] 晶体物质凝固时的温度，也就是这种物质液态和固态可以平衡共存的温度 solidifying point; temperature at which a crystal matter solidifies, that is, the temperature at which both the liquid and solid states of the matter coexist

凝固热
凝固热[níng gù rè] 单位质量的某种物质在熔点时，从液态变成固态所放出的热量，叫做这种物质的凝固热 heat of solidification; heat released by a unit mass of a certain matter on solidification

凝思
凝思[níng sī] 集中精神思考 meditate; be lost in thought; be in deep thought; brood：凝思默虑 mull over; contemplate; ponder

凝想
凝想[níng xiǎng] 凝思 meditate; ponder; contemplate：他时而奋笔疾书，时而又搁笔凝想。He now wrote quickly and energetically, now put down the pen and fell deep into a reverie.

凝望
凝望[níng wàng] 目不转睛地看；注目远望 gaze at; stare at; look with fixed eyes; be all eyes

凝滞
凝滞[níng zhì]1.停止流动；不灵活 stagnant; static; immobile; unmoving：两颗凝滞的眼珠出神地望着窗外 look out of the window with dull (or vacant) eyes 2.〈书 fml.〉凝聚 condense; cohere; thicken

凝目
凝目[níng mù] 目不转睛地（看） fix one's eyes on; focus one's eyes upon：凝目注视 stare at; gaze with fixed eyes

凝眸
凝眸[níng móu]〈书 fml.〉凝目 fix one's eyes on; focus one's eyes upon：凝眸远望 gaze into the distance

凝神
凝神[níng shén] 聚精会神 with fixed (concentrated; rapt) attention; attentively：凝神思索 be deep in contemplation凝神端详 scrutinize (examine) attentively

凝练
凝练[níng liàn]（文字）紧凑简练 (of language) condensed; concise; compact; laconic; terse：文笔凝练 write in a laconic style亦 also 凝炼 níngliàn

凝结
凝结[níng jié] 由气体变成液体或由液体变成固体 coagulate; (of gas) transform into liquid; (of a liquid) transform into a solid：池面上凝结了薄薄的一层冰。The pond is covered with a thin layer of ice.鲜血凝结成的战斗友谊 friendship between comrades-in-arms baptized by blood

凝聚
凝聚[níng jù]1.气体由稀变浓或变成液体 (of vapour or gas) condense; become denser or change into liquid：荷叶上凝聚着晶莹的露珠。Glistening dewdrops have formed on the lotus leaves. 2.聚集；积聚 accumulate; concentrate：这部作品凝聚着他一生的心血。This work is a crystallization of his life-long efforts.

凝聚力
凝聚力[níng jù lì]1.内聚力 cohesive force; cohesion 2.泛指使人或物聚集到一起的力量 cohesion; force that brings people or things together：加强社会和民族的凝聚力 increase the cohesion of the society and the nation

凝脂
凝脂[níng zhī]〈书 fml.〉凝固了的油脂 congealed fat;〈比喻 fig.〉洁白细嫩的皮肤 fair, soft and glossy skin：肤如凝脂 have fair, soft and glossy skin

凝视
凝视[níng shì] 聚精会神地看 gaze fixedly; stare; be all eyes：凝视谛听 watch and listen with rapt attention

凝重
凝重[níng zhòng]1.端庄；庄重 dignified; noble：雍容凝重 have a dignified bearing神态凝重 look dignified 2.（声音）浑厚 (of sound or voice) resonant; deep and powerful：凝重深沉的乐曲 deep, solemn music声音凝重有力 deep, powerful voice 3.浓重 heavy; dense; thick：凝重的乌云 heavy dark clouds

凝集
凝集[níng jí] 凝结在一起；聚集 agglomerate; agglutinate：心中疑云凝集。Suspicion grows in one's heart.诗篇凝集着诗人对祖国的真挚感情。The poem embodies the poet's genuine feelings towards his motherland.

几
几1[jī]（ㄐㄧ）（几儿 jīr）小桌子 small table：茶几儿 tea table; coffee table窗明几净 (of a room or house) spotlessly clean几2[jī]（ㄐㄧ）（幾）〈书 fml.〉几乎；近乎 almost; nearly; virtually：歼灭敌军，几三千人。Nearly 3,000 enemy troops were wiped out.另见  jǐ几[jǐ]（ㄐㄧˇ）（幾）1.询问数目（估计数目不太大）how many (with a small number anticipated)：来了几个人？How many people have come here?你能在家住几天？For how many days can you stay home? 2.表示大于一而小于十的不定的数目 a few; several; some：几本书 a few books十几岁 a little older than 10几百人 several hundred people另见  jī相关词组茶几 | 大几 | 好几 | 老几 | 庶几 | 未几 | 无几 | 曾几何时 | 窗明几净 | 解析几何 | 立体几何 | 平面几何 | 不知凡几几案 | 几曾 | 几多 | 几儿 | 几何 | 几乎 | 几经 | 几率 | 几时 | 几许 | 几何体 | 几何学 | 几次三番 | 几何图形

几乎
几乎[jī hū]1.将近于；接近于 close to; virtually：今天到会的几乎有五千人。Close to 5,000 were present at the meeting today. 2. 同 same as 差点儿 chà∥diǎnr ：不是你提醒我，我几乎忘了。I all but forgot had you not reminded me.两条腿一软，几乎摔倒。My legs buckled, and I almost fell to the ground.亦 also 几几乎 jījīhū

几何
几何[jǐ hé]1.〈书 fml.〉多少 how much; how many：价值几何？How much is its worth?曾几何时 only a short while ago 2.几何学的简称 abbr. for 几何学 jǐhéxué

几何体
几何体[jǐ hé tǐ]空间的有限部分，由平面和曲面所围成。如棱柱体、正方体、圆柱体、球体。solid; body or magnitude of three dimensions consisting of planes and /or curved surfaces, such as prism, cube, cylinder and spheroid; 亦 also 立体 lìtǐ

几何图形
几何图形[jǐ hé tú xíng] 点、线、面、体或它们的组合 geometric figure，referring to point, line, surface, solid, or their combination; 简称 abbr. 图形 túxíng

几何学
几何学[jǐ hé xué] 研究空间图形的形状、大小和位置的相互关系的学科 geometry; branch of mathematics concerned with the properties and relations of points, lines, surfaces and solids

几儿
几儿[jǐ r]〈方 dial.〉哪一天 what date：你几儿来的？When did you get here?今儿是几儿？What's the date today?

几多
几多[jǐ duō]〈方 dial.〉1.〈疑问代词 interrog. pron.〉(a)询问数量 how many; how much：几多人？How many people are there?这袋米有几多重？How much does this sack of rice weigh? (b)表示不定的数量 who knows how much：在他身上，父母不知花费了几多精力，几多钱财。Who knows how much energy and money his parents have spent on him. 2.多么 how：这孩子几多懂事！How well-behaved the child is!

几时
几时[jǐ shí] 什么时候 what time; when：你们几时走？What time are you leaving?你几时有空儿过来坐吧。Come when you are free.

几曾
几曾[jǐ céng] 用反问的语气表示未曾；几时曾经 (in a rhetorical question) when; at what time (past tense)：在他重病期间，我几曾安睡过一夜。When did I have a single night's good sleep when he was so ill?

几案
几案[jī àn] 条案，也泛指桌子 long table; (in a broad sense) table

几次三番
几次三番[jǐ cì sān fān] 一次又一次；屡次 time and again：朋友们几次三番地劝说，他都当成了耳旁风。Time and again his friends' persuasions fell on deaf ears.

几率
几率[jī lǜ] 概率 probability

几经
几经[jǐ jīng] 经过多次 several times; time and again：几经波折 after a lot of bother几经交涉 through repeated negotiations; after making repeated representations

几许
几许[jǐ xǔ]〈书 fml.〉多少 how much; how many：不知几许 have no idea how much it is

凡
凡1[fán]（ㄈㄢˊ）（凢）1.平凡 ordinary; commonplace：凡庸 mediocre自命不凡 think oneself a prodigy; have a bloated image of oneself 2.宗教迷信和神话故事中称人世间 (in religious or superstitious stories and mythology) mundane world; earth：思凡 (of an immortal) long for the mortal world天仙下凡。A fairy descended on the mundane world.凡2[fán]（ㄈㄢˊ）（凢）1.凡是 all; every; any：凡年满十八岁公民都有选举权与被选举权。Every citizen who has reached the age of 18 has the right to vote and stand for election. 2.〈书 fml.〉总共 altogether; in all：不知凡几 innumerable; countless全书凡二十卷。The book comprises 20 volumes. 3.〈书 fml.〉大概；要略 outline; gist：大凡 generally; mostly发凡起例 introduction and guide (to a book or a subject)凡3[fán]（ㄈㄢˊ）（凢）我国民族音乐音阶上的一级，乐谱上用做记音符号，相当于简谱的‘4’fan, a note of traditional Chinese music scale, used on a music score as a symbol, equivalent to‘4’in numbered musical notation另见  工尺 gōngchě相关词组不凡 | 超凡 | 大凡 | 但凡 | 发凡 | 非凡 | 举凡 | 平凡 | 是凡 | 思凡 | 下凡 | 超凡入圣 | 不同凡响 | 不知凡几 | 一表非凡凡尘 | 凡夫 | 凡例 | 凡人 | 凡事 | 凡是 | 凡俗 | 凡响 | 凡心 | 凡庸 | 凡尔丁 | 凡士林

凡事
凡事[fán shì] 不论什么事情 no matter what：凡事多跟群众商量总有好处。It is always beneficial to consult the masses before doing anything.

凡人
凡人[fán rén]1.平常的人 ordinary (or common) people：凡人琐事 ordinary people and trifling matters 2.指尘世的人（区别于‘神仙’as compared with‘immortals’）mortals

凡例
凡例[fán lì] 书前关于本书体例的说明 notes on or guide to the style of a book

凡俗
凡俗[fán sú] 平凡庸俗；平常 ordinary; common：不同凡俗 out of the ordinary; out of the common run流于凡俗 end up in mediocrity

凡响
凡响[fán xiǎng] 平凡的音乐 common or ordinary music：不同凡响 outstanding; out of the ordinary非同凡响 quite extraordinary

凡士林
凡士林[fán shì lín]石蜡和重油的混合物，半透明，半固态，淡黄色，精炼后成纯白色。医药上用来制油膏，工业上用做防锈剂和润滑剂。Vaseline; soft yellow semitranslucent and semisolid mixture of paraffin wax and heavy oil, which turns pure white after refinement, used to make ointment and other medical products, and industrial products such as anti-rusting agents and lubricants; 亦 also 矿脂 kuàngzhī

凡夫
凡夫[fán fū] 凡人 mortal man; ordinary person; common folk：凡夫俗子 ordinary people; common run

凡尔丁
凡尔丁[fá něr dīng] 一种平纹单色毛织品，常用线做经、纱做纬织成，质地薄而挺括，适宜于做夏季服装 valitin; plain monochromatic wool fabric, often woven with threads as warps, and yarns as wefts, with a thin and strong texture, suitable for making summer clothes

凡尘
凡尘[fán chén] 佛教、道教或神话故事中指人世间；尘世 (in Buddhism, Taoism or Chinese mythology) this mortal world; mundane world

凡庸
凡庸[fán yōng]平平常常；普普通通（多形容人）(of a person) ordinary; commonplace：才能凡庸 ordinary talent凡庸之辈 common herd; person of mediocre abilities

凡心
凡心[fán xīn] 僧道指对尘世的思念、留恋之心 (of Buddhists and Taoists) reluctance to renounce the temporal world

凡是
凡是[fán shì] 总括某个范围内的一切 every; any; without exception：凡是新生的事物总是在同旧事物的斗争中成长起来的。All new things achieve development during the course of fighting against the old.

凤
凤[fèng]（ㄈㄥˋ）（鳳）1.凤凰 phoenix：龙凤 dragon and phoenix鸾凤 husband and wife丹凤朝阳。The scarlet phoenix flies towards the sun. 2.(Fèng) 姓 a surname相关词组鸾凤 | 丹凤眼 | 西凤酒 | 麟凤龟龙 | 龙飞凤舞 | 攀龙附凤凤冠 | 凤凰 | 凤梨 | 凤尾鱼 | 凤毛麟角

凤冠
凤冠[fèng guān]〈古代 arch.〉后妃所戴的帽子，上面有用贵金属和宝石等做成凤凰形状的装饰，旧时妇女出嫁也用做礼帽 phoenix coronet (worn by an empress or imperial concubine); head gear decorated with a phoenix-shaped ornament made of precious metal and embossed with gems; (old) bridal headdress：凤冠霞帔 phoenix coronet and embroidered tassel cape

凤凰
凤凰[fèng huáng]〈古代 arch.〉传说中的百鸟之王，羽毛美丽，雄的叫凤，雌的叫凰。常用来象征祥瑞。phoenix; legendary king of the birds, with beautiful plumage；凤 being the male and 凰 the female

凤尾鱼
凤尾鱼[fèng wěi yú] 鲚的通称 popular name for 鲚 jì

凤梨
凤梨[fèng lí]1.多年生草本植物，叶子大，边缘有锯齿，花紫色，果实密集在一起，外部呈鳞片状，果肉味甜酸，有很浓的香味。产于热带，我国广东、台湾等地都有出产。pineapple (Ananas comosus); tropical perennial plant, grown in Guangdong and Taiwan provinces with large, serrated leaves, purple flowers, and bunched scaly fruits whose flesh is sour and sweet with a strong fragrance 2.这种植物的果实 pineapple; fruit of such plant亦 also 菠萝 bōluó；俗称 popularly known as 菠萝蜜 bōluómì

凤毛麟角
凤毛麟角[fèng máo lín jiǎo]〈比喻 fig.〉稀少而可贵的人或事物 phoenix feathers and unicorn horn - unique and valuable person or object

凫
凫[fú]（ㄈㄨˊ）（鳧）1.野鸭 wild duck：凫趋雀跃（比喻人欢欣鼓舞）jubilant; elated; in high spirits 2. 同 same as 浮 fú ②：凫水 swim相关词组凫茈

凫茈
凫茈[fú cí] 古书上指荸荠 water chestnut as mentioned in ancient books

凭
凭1[píng]（ㄆㄧㄥˊ）（憑、凴）1.（身子）靠着 (of body) lean on; lean against：凭几 lean on a small table 2.倚靠；倚仗 depend on; rely on：劳动人民凭着智慧和双手创造世界。The working people create the world with their intelligence and labour. 3.证据 evidence; proof：凭据 evidence文凭 diploma口说不足为凭。Oral expressions cannot be taken as evidence. 4.根据 base on; take as the basis：凭票付款 payable to bearer凭2[píng]（ㄆㄧㄥˊ）（憑、凴）〈连词 conj.〉无论 no matter：凭你跑多快，我也赶得上。I'll catch up with you no matter how fast you run.相关词组任凭 | 听凭 | 文凭 | 依凭 | 真凭实据 | 空口无凭凭单 | 凭吊 | 凭借 | 凭据 | 凭空 | 凭栏 | 凭陵 | 凭恃 | 凭眺 | 凭险 | 凭信 | 凭依 | 凭仗 | 凭照 | 凭证

凭仗
凭仗[píng zhàng] 倚仗 rely on; depend on：凭仗着顽强不屈的精神克服了重重困难 overcome all kinds of difficulties with an indomitable spirit

凭依
凭依[píng yī] 根据；倚靠 base oneself on; rely on：无所凭依 have nothing to go by

凭信
凭信[píng xìn] 信赖；相信 trust; believe：不足凭信 not trustworthy

凭借
凭借[píng jiè] 依靠 rely on; depend on：人类的思维是凭借语言来进行的。Humankind thinks in words.

凭单
凭单[píng dān] 做凭证的单据 bill or document of warrant

凭吊
凭吊[píng diào] 对着遗迹、坟墓等怀念（古人或旧事） visit a historical site, a tomb, etc., and think of (persons who have passed away or past events)：凭吊烈士墓 pay a visit to a martyr's tomb到杭州西湖去的人，总要到岳王坟前凭吊一番。A visit to the Tomb of Yue Fei is a must for visitors to the West Lake in Hangzhou.

凭恃
凭恃[píng shì] 倚仗；仗恃 rely on; depend on：凭恃天险 rely on natural barriers for defence

凭据
凭据[píng jù] 作为凭证的事物 evidence; proof; sth. used as testimonial

凭栏
凭栏[píng lán] 靠着栏杆 lean on a railing：凭栏远眺 lean on a railing and gaze into the distance

凭照
凭照[píng zhào] 证件或执照 certificate or license：领取凭照 obtain (be granted with) a license

凭眺
凭眺[píng tiào] 在高处向远处看（多指欣赏风景 usu. referring to enjoyment of landscape, view, etc.）gaze from a high place into the distance：依栏凭眺 lean on a railing and enjoy the view in the distance

凭空
凭空[píng kōng] 没有依据地 without foundation; out of the void：凭空捏造 make something out of nothing; fabricate凭空想像 imagine without foundation亦 also 平空 píngkōng

凭证
凭证[píng zhèng] 证据 proof; evidence; certificate

凭险
凭险[píng xiǎn] 依靠险要的地势 rely on a place strategically located and of difficult access：凭险抵抗 make use of a strategic place to fight back凭险据守 hold fast to natural barriers as defences

凭陵
凭陵[píng líng]〈书 fml.〉1.仗势侵犯；欺凌 encroach on; ride roughshod over 2.凭借 rely on; depend on

凯
凯[kǎi]（ㄎㄞˇ）（凱）1.胜利的乐歌 triumphant strains; victorious：凯歌 song of victory凯旋 triumphant homecoming奏凯而归 return in triumph 2.(Kǎi) 姓 a surname相关词组奏凯凯歌 | 凯旋

凯旋
凯旋[kǎi xuán] 战胜归来 triumphant return

凯歌
凯歌[kǎi gē] 打了胜仗所唱的歌 song of triumph; paean：高唱凯歌而归 sing a song of victory on the way home

凰
凰[huáng]（ㄏㄨㄤˊ）另见  凤凰 fènghuáng相关词组凤凰

凳
凳[dèng]（ㄉㄥˋ）（櫈）（凳儿 dèngr）凳子 stool; bench：方凳 square stool板凳 bench竹凳儿 bamboo stool相关词组板凳 | 春凳 | 杌凳 | 老虎凳 | 冷板凳 | 桌椅板凳 | 坐冷板凳凳子

凳子
凳子[dèng zi] 有腿没有靠背的、供人坐的家具 stool; bench; furniture with legs but without a back, for people to sit on

凶
凶[xiōng]（ㄒㄩㄥ）（兇）1.不幸的（形容死亡、灾难等现象，跟‘吉’相对 as opposed to ‘auspicious’）inauspicious; ominous：凶事 unfortunate events such as death, injury, accident, etc.凶信 news of sb.'s death 2.年成很坏 famine; crop failure：凶年 year of crop failure; year of famine 3.凶恶 vicious; fierce; ferocious; brutal：穷凶极恶 extremely vicious and brutal; ferocious; fierce这个人样子真凶。This chap looks really fierce. 4.厉害 terrible; fearful：病势很凶 be seriously ill闹得太凶。What a terrific row! 5.指杀害或伤害人的行为 act of violence; murder：行凶 assault; murder 6.行凶作恶的人 murderer; criminal：正凶 principal criminal帮凶 accomplice; accessory元凶 chief culprit; arch criminal; ring leader相关词组帮凶 | 逞凶 | 行凶 | 吉凶 | 疑凶 | 元凶 | 正凶 | 穷凶极恶凶案 | 凶暴 | 凶残 | 凶恶 | 凶犯 | 凶服 | 凶悍 | 凶耗 | 凶狠 | 凶横 | 凶狂 | 凶猛 | 凶年 | 凶虐 | 凶气 | 凶器 | 凶杀 | 凶煞 | 凶神 | 凶手 | 凶死 | 凶嫌 | 凶险 | 凶相 | 凶信 | 凶焰 | 凶宅 | 凶兆

凶信
凶信[xiōng xìn]（～儿 xiōngxìnr）不好的消息，特指人死亡的消息 bad news, esp. of sb.'s death：报凶信 tell the news of sb.'s death

凶兆
凶兆[xiōng zhào]不吉祥的预兆（迷信 superstition）ill omen; boding of evil

凶器
凶器[xiōng qì] 行凶用的器具 tool or weapon for criminal purposes; lethal weapon：杀人凶器 weapon used in murder or homicide

凶嫌
凶嫌[xiōng xián] 凶杀案的犯罪嫌疑人 murder suspect

凶宅
凶宅[xiōng zhái]不吉利的或闹鬼的房舍（迷信）(superstition) haunted house; unlucky abode

凶年
凶年[xiōng nián] 荒年 year of crop failure or famine; famine year; bad year：凶年饥岁 year of crop failure; year of famine

凶恶
凶恶[xiōng è]（性情、行为或相貌）十分可怕 (of temper, appearance or behaviour) fierce; ferocious; fiendish：凶恶的目光 fierce look in the eyes凶恶的敌人 ferocious enemies

凶悍
凶悍[xiōng hàn] 凶猛强悍 fierce and tough：为人凶悍 be fierce and tough

凶手
凶手[xiōng shǒu] 行凶的人 murderer; assassin; assailant (who has caused injury to sb.)

凶暴
凶暴[xiōng bào]（性情、行为）凶狠残暴 fierce and brutal (disposition, act)：脾气凶暴 of brutal and bestial temper凶暴残忍 brutal and ferocious

凶服
凶服[xiōng fú]〈书 fml.〉丧服；孝衣 mourning apparel

凶杀
凶杀[xiōng shā] 杀害人命 homicide; murder：凶杀案 murder case

凶案
凶案[xiōng àn] 杀害人命的案件 murder case

凶横
凶横[xiōng hèng] 凶恶蛮横 fierce and arrogant; rude and ferocious：满脸凶横 ferocious features on one's face态度粗暴，说话凶横 behave rudely and speak truculently

凶死
凶死[xiōng sǐ] 指被人杀害或自杀而死 die by violence; meet a violent end; get killed or kill oneself

凶残
凶残[xiōng cán] 凶恶残暴 fierce and cruel; savage and cruel：凶残成性 be cruel by nature

凶气
凶气[xiōng qì] 凶狠的气势；凶恶的神色 fierce manner; ferocious expression：一脸凶气 with murder written on one's face

凶焰
凶焰[xiōng yàn] 凶恶的气焰 ferocity; aggressive arrogance

凶煞
凶煞[xiōng shà] 同 same as 凶神 xiōngshén

凶犯
凶犯[xiōng fàn] 行凶的罪犯 one who has committed homicide or mayhem; murderer：杀人凶犯 murderer

凶狂
凶狂[xiōng kuáng] 凶恶猖狂 fierce; savage; ferocious

凶狠
凶狠[xiōng hěn]1.（性情、行为）凶恶狠毒 fierce and malicious：凶狠的豺狼 ferocious jackals and wolves 2.猛烈 powerful; vigorous：扣球凶狠 powerful smashes

凶猛
凶猛[xiōng měng]（气势、力量）凶恶强大 (of force, strength) violent; ferocious：来势凶猛 bear down with a devastating force虎豹都是凶猛的野兽。Both tigers and leopards are ferocious beasts.

凶相
凶相[xiōng xiàng] 凶恶的面目；凶恶的相貌 ferocious features; fierce look; fiendish look：凶相毕露 look thoroughly ferocious; fully reveal one's ferocity一脸的凶相 look fiendish

凶神
凶神[xiōng shén] 迷信者指凶恶的神，常用来指凶恶的人 demon; fiend：凶神恶煞 devils; fiends

凶耗
凶耗[xiōng hào] 人死亡的消息 news of sb.'s death; death notice

凶虐
凶虐[xiōng nüè] 凶恶暴虐 brutal; tyrannical

凶险
凶险[xiōng xiǎn]1.（情势等）危险可怕 dangerous; perilous; critical; fiendish：病情凶险 dangerously ill; critically ill; in a critical condition地势凶险 dangerous place; perilous terrain 2.凶恶阴险 ruthless and treacherous：凶险的敌人 treacherous enemy

凷
凷[kuài]（ㄎㄨㄞˋ）〈书 fml.〉土块 clod

凸
凸[tū]（ㄊㄨ）高于周围（跟‘凹’相对 as opposed to‘hollow’,‘concave’,‘sunken’,‘dented’）protruding; raised; bulging; convex; higher than the surrounding area：凸出 bulging; protruding; projecting凸起 swelling; bulging; doming挺胸凸肚 throw out one's chest and distend one's belly相关词组凸版 | 凸轮 | 凸显 | 凸现 | 凸版纸 | 凸面镜 | 凸透镜

凸显
凸显[tū xiǎn] 清楚地显出 show clearly; set off; stand out：草地上凸显出一座花坛。A flower bed stands out clearly on the lawn.市场规范化的问题日益凸显出来。The problem of market standardization is manifesting itself clearly day after day.

凸版
凸版[tū bǎn] 版面印刷的部分高出空白部分的印刷版，如木版、铅版、锌版等 relief printing plate; printing plate with a raised print sheet layout, as in a printing block, or lead and zinc plates

凸版纸
凸版纸[tū bǎn zhǐ]供凸版印刷用的纸，用化学纸浆制成。质量比胶版纸、凹版纸差。relief printing paper; paper made of chemical pulp for relief printing, of a quality inferior to that of offset or intaglio paper

凸现
凸现[tū xiàn] 清楚地显现 figure prominently; come into focus; appear clearly：在一排排的校舍中凸现出图书馆的高楼。The tall building that houses the library figures prominently in the rows of school buildings.经济的高速发展，使不少历史遗留问题凸现出来。A host of problems left over from history came into sharp focus in the fast development of the economy.

凸轮
凸轮[tū lún]一种具有曲面周缘或凹槽的零件。种类很多，可以推动从动零件做往复运动或摆动。cam; mechanical part in many varieties, which has camber rims or concave troughs and that pushes the driven parts into reciprocal movements or swings

凸透镜
凸透镜[tū tòu jìng]透镜的一种，中央比四周厚，平行光线透过后，向轴线的方向折射聚集于一点上。物体放在焦点以内，由另一侧看去就得一个放大的虚像。远视眼镜的镜片就属于这个类型。convex lens; a kind of lens that is thicker at the centre than the edge, through which parallel light refracts in the direction of the axis and concentrates at one point, and which creates an enlarged virtual image of an object at the other side within its focus, used in spectacle lenses for long sight; 亦 also 会聚透镜 huìjù tòujìng；通称 generally called 放大镜 fàngdàjìng

凸面镜
凸面镜[tū miàn jìng]球面镜的一种，反射面为凸面，焦点在镜后。凸面镜所成的像为正立的缩小的虚像。convex mirror; spherical mirror with a convex reflective surface whose point of focus is behind it, and which creates upright reduced virtual images; 亦 also 凸镜 tūjìng 或 or 发散镜 fāsànjìng

凹
凹[āo]（ㄠ） 低于周围（跟‘凸’相对 as opposed to‘convex’） concave; sunken; dented; sag：凹地 depression凹凸不平 bumpy另见  wā凹[wā]（ㄨㄚ）〈方 dial.〉 同 same as 洼 wā，用于地名 used in place names：核桃凹（在山西）Hetaowa (in Shanxi Province)另见  āo相关词组凹版 | 凹陷 | 凹面镜 | 凹透镜

凹版
凹版[āo bǎn]雕刻的部分凹入版面的印刷版，如铜版、钢版、照相凹板。凹版印刷品，纸面上油墨稍微鼓起，如钞票、邮票等。intaglio; gravure (copper or steel plate for the intaglio process of photomechanical printing); banknote, stamp, etc. produced by gravure

凹透镜
凹透镜[āo tòu jìng]透镜的一种，中央比四周薄，平行光线透过后向四外散射。近视眼镜的镜片就属于这个类型。concave lens, with its centre thinner than its edge, diverging in all directions the parallel rays that have penetrated its surface. The lenses of spectacles worn by a nearsighted person are of this type.亦 also 发散透镜 fāsàn tòujìng

凹陷
凹陷[āo xiàn] 向内或向下陷进去 cave in; sink：两颊凹陷 sunken or hollow cheeks地形凹陷。The ground caved in.

凹面镜
凹面镜[āo miàn jìng] 球面镜的一种，反射面为凹面，焦点在镜前，当光源在焦点上，所发出的光反射后形成平行光束 concave mirror; reflecting mirror with a concave spherical reflecting surface with its focus in front of it, and when the source of light is on the focus, the light reflected on the mirror's surface is converted into parallel rays亦 also 凹镜 āojìng 或 or 会聚镜 huìjùjìng

出
出1[chū]（ㄔㄨ）1.从里面到外面（跟‘进’、‘入’相对 as opposed to‘enter’）proceed from inside to outside：出来 come out出去 go out出门 go out of the house; leave home出国 go abroad出院 be discharged from hospital 2.来到 be at (an event)：出席 be present出场 go on stage 3.超出 exceed：出轨 derail出界 go beyond the boundary不出三年 within three years 4.往外拿 give：出钱 pay money出布告 put up a bulletin出题目 prepare (exam) questions出主意 put forth ideas 5.出产；产生；发生 produce; give rise to; happen：出煤 produce coal出活儿 get work done我们厂里出了不少劳动模范。Many model workers have come forth in our factory.出问题 get into trouble这事儿出在1962年。This happened in 1962. 6.出版 publish：这家出版社出了不少好书。This press has published many good books. 7.发出；发泄 emit; give vent to：出芽儿 sprout出汗 sweat出天花 suffer from smallpox出气 vent one's anger 8.引文、典故等见于某处 (of a quotation or allusion) quoted from：语出《老子》quoted from Laozi 9.显露 become conspicuous：出名 become famous出面 appear personally; take it upon oneself (to do sth.)出头 act as the leader; act on behalf of出丑 make a fool of sb. or oneself 10.显得量多 appear in big quantity：机米做饭出饭。Long-grained non-glutinous rice rises well when cooked.这面蒸馒头出数儿。Buns made of this flour swell big when steamed. 11.支出 spend：出纳 expenditure and income量入为出 spend within the limit of one's income; live within one's means 12.〈方 dial.〉跟‘往’连用，表示向外 [used after 往 wǎng to mean‘outward’]：散会了，大家往出走。When the meeting was over, everyone walked out.出2[chū]（ㄔㄨ）（齣）一本传奇中的一个大段落叫一出。戏曲的一个独立剧目也叫一出 classifier for a chapter of a classical novel; classifier for an opera or play：三出戏 three plays出3[chū]（ㄔㄨ）用在动词后表示向外、显露或完成 [used after a verb to indicate an outward movement, a conspicuous state or sth. accomplished]：看得出 clear to see看不出 cannot see clearly; cannot tell拿出一张纸 take out a sheet of paper跑出大门 run out of the gate看出问题 discern a problem做出成绩 accomplish相关词组百出 | 辈出 | 超出 | 淡出 | 嫡出 | 迭出 | 发出 | 付出 | 复出 | 革出 | 公出 | 杰出 | 进出 | 娩出 | 旁出 | 歧出 | 胜出 | 输出 | 庶出 | 四出 | 岁出 | 特出 | 突出 | 退出 | 外出 | 析出 | 演出 | 正出 | 支出 | 重出 | 打出手 | 大出血 | 豁出去 | 内出血 | 派出所 | 戏出儿 | 别出心裁 | 层出不穷 | 初出茅庐 | 传出神经 | 导出单位 | 独出心裁 | 浮出水面 | 里出外进 | 令出法随 | 青出于蓝 | 如出一辙 | 神出鬼没 | 师出无名 | 事出有因 | 喜出望外 | 言出法随 | 自出机杼 | 半路出家 | 当场出彩 | 当行出色 | 门里出身 | 入主出奴 | 扫地出门 | 推陈出新 | 引蛇出洞 | 悖入悖出 | 层见叠出 | 和盘托出 | 呼之欲出 | 量入为出 | 入不敷出 | 深居简出 | 深入浅出 | 水落石出 | 脱口而出 | 脱颖而出 | 电子出版物 | 枪打出头鸟 | 一鼻孔出气 | 狗嘴吐不出象牙 | 一言既出，驷马难追出版 | 出榜 | 出奔 | 出殡 | 出兵 | 出彩 | 出操 | 出差 | 出产 | 出厂 | 出场 | 出超 | 出车 | 出乘 | 出丑 | 出处 | 出倒 | 出道 | 出典 | 出店 | 出顶 | 出动 | 出发 | 出饭 | 出访 | 出伏 | 出阁 | 出格 | 出工 | 出恭 | 出轨 | 出国 | 出海 | 出行 | 出航 | 出号 | 出活 | 出击 | 出继 | 出家 | 出价 | 出嫁 | 出尖 | 出界 | 出借 | 出警 | 出境 | 出镜 | 出九 | 出局 | 出具 | 出科 | 出口 | 出来 | 出栏 | 出力 | 出列 | 出猎 | 出溜 | 出笼 | 出炉 | 出路 | 出落 | 出马 | 出卖 | 出没 | 出梅 | 出门 | 出面 | 出苗 | 出名 | 出纳 | 出盘 | 出品 | 出聘 | 出圃 | 出奇 | 出气 | 出勤 | 出去 | 出圈 | 出缺 | 出让 | 出任 | 出入 | 出丧 | 出色 | 出山 | 出身 | 出神 | 出生 | 出师 | 出使 | 出示 | 出世 | 出仕 | 出事 | 出手 | 出首 | 出售 | 出台 | 出摊 | 出逃 | 出挑 | 出粜 | 出庭 | 出头 | 出徒 | 出土 | 出脱 | 出外 | 出亡 | 出息 | 出席 | 出险 | 出现 | 出线 | 出项 | 出血 | 出巡 | 出芽 | 出言 | 出演 | 出洋 | 出游 | 出语 | 出院 | 出月 | 出展 | 出战 | 出账 | 出蛰 | 出诊 | 出阵 | 出征 | 出众 | 出资 | 出走 | 出租 | 出岔子 | 出发点 | 出份子 | 出风头 | 出家人 | 出乱子 | 出毛病 | 出门子 | 出气筒 | 出圈儿 | 出生率 | 出世作 | 出数儿 | 出虚恭 | 出洋相 | 出月子 | 出尔反尔 | 出将入相 | 出口成章 | 出口伤人 | 出类拔萃 | 出谋划策 | 出其不意 | 出奇制胜 | 出人头地 | 出人意料 | 出神入化 | 出生入死 | 出头露面 | 出租汽车

出丑
出丑[chū chǒu] 露出丑相；丢人 be disgraced; lose face：当众出丑 lose one's face in public

出世
出世[chū shì]1. 同 same as 出生 chūshēng：那年他还没有出世。He was not yet born that year. 2.产生 come into being：旧制度灭亡，新制度出世。At the demise of the old system, a new one took shape. 3.超脱人世，摆脱世事的束缚 be detached from the world; extricate oneself from the bondage of worldly affairs：出世思想 thoughts to renounce the world 4.指高出人世 way above the human world：横空出世 span the sky（横亘太空 héng gèn tài kōng 和 and 高出人世 gāo chū rén shì，形容山极高 describe the great height of a mountain）

出世作
出世作[chū shì zuò]〈旧时 old〉指一生中最早问世的作品 first work known to the public in one's life; maiden work

出丧
出丧[chū sāng] 同 same as 出殡 chū∥bìn

出乘
出乘[chū chéng]（乘务员）随车、船等出发工作 serve as an attendant on a vehicle, ship, etc.

出九
出九[chū jiǔ] 出了数九的日子 be over with the cold season：虽说还没有出九，天气却暖和多了。Although the cold season has yet to end, the weather is turning much warmer.另见  九 jiǔ

出乱子
出乱子[chū luàn zi] 出差错；出毛病 go wrong; be in trouble：你放心，出不了乱子。Don't worry; nothing will go wrong.

出事
出事[chū shì] 发生事故 meet with an accident or mishap：出事地点 site of an accident那里围了很多人，好像出了什么事。People have crowded over there. Something seems to have happened.

出亡
出亡[chū wáng] 出走；逃亡 run away (from one's home); flee for life：出亡他乡 flee home and live in exile

出产
出产[chū chǎn]1.天然生长或人工生产 naturally available or artificially produced：云南出产大理石。Yunnan produces marble.景德镇出产的瓷器是世界闻名的。Chinaware manufactured in Jingdezhen is world-famous. 2.出产的物品 things that are produced：出产丰富 rich produce or products

出人头地
出人头地[chū rén tóu dì] 超出一般人；高人一等 rise head and shoulders above others; make one's mark

出人意料
出人意料[chū rén yì liào]（事物的好坏、情况的变化、数量的大小等）出于人们的意料之外 (of the good or bad side of sth., the change of a situation, or the size of a quantity) be beyond people's expectations亦 also 出人意表 chū rén yì biǎo

出仕
出仕[chū shì]〈书 fml.〉出任官职 take up an official post

出价
出价[chū jià] 在商品交易中买方提出愿付的价格 price offered by a buyer in a deal：这幅山水画他出价三千元。He offered 3,000 yuan for this landscape painting.您要真想买，就出个价吧。If you really want it, please offer a price.

出任
出任[chū rèn]出来担任（某种官职）take up (an official post)：出任要职 assume an important position出任驻外使节 take up the mission as an envoy abroad

出份子
出份子[chū fèn zi]1.各人拿出若干钱合起来送礼 club together to buy a gift 2.指到办红白事的人家去送礼并参加庆贺或吊唁 bring a present to a wedding or funeral to express congratulations or condolences

出伏
出伏[chū fú] 出了伏天；伏天结束 over with or end of the hot season：一出伏，天就凉快了。The weather turns cool as soon as the hot season is over.

出众
出众[chū zhòng] 超出众人 stand out among the ordinary：成绩出众 accomplish outstanding achievement

出使
出使[chū shǐ] 接受外交使命到外国去 take on a diplomatic mission abroad：出使北欧诸国 visit North European countries in the capacity of an envoy

出倒
出倒[chū dǎo] 私营工商业主因亏损或其他原因，将企业的设备、商品和房屋、地基等全部出售，由别人继续经营 sale of a private industrial or commercial company, including its equipment, products, and property, to someone else to operate, due to financial failure or other reasons

出借
出借[chū jiè] 借出去（多指物品 oft. things）lend：新到的期刊暂不出借。We do not loan out new periodicals.

出入
出入[chū rù]1.出去和进来 go out and come in：出入随手关门。Close the door behind you.东西堆在过道，出入不方便。Things stacked in the corridor are getting in the way. 2.（数目、内容等）不一致；不相符 (of numbers, contents, etc.) inconsistent; discrepant：现款跟账上的数目没有出入。The cash on hand tallies with the figure in the accounts.你俩说的话有出入。The two of you have different stories of the same event.

出兵
出兵[chū bīng]出动军队（作战）dispatch troops (for a battle)

出其不意
出其不意[chū qí bù yì]趁对方没有料到（就采取行动）take the opponent by surprise：出其不意，攻其无备 take action out of (an opponent's) expectation and attack where (the opponent) is not prepared

出具
出具[chū jù]开出；写出（证明、证件等）issue; write (certificate, papers, etc.)：出具介绍信 provide a letter of introduction出具健康证明 issue a health certificate

出典
出典1[chū diǎn] 典故的来源；出处 source of an inference; source：‘守株待兔’这个成语的出典见《韩非子·五蠹》。The idiom‘expect gains without pains’comes from Hanfeizi·Five Vermin.出典2[chū diǎn] 指一方把土地、房屋等押给另一方使用，换取一笔钱，不付利息，议定年限，到期还款，收回原物 mortgage; transfer the use of land or a house by one party to another in return for the use of a sum of money without paying interest for an agreed period of time, at the end of which each shall get back what has been contributed

出击
出击[chū jī]1.部队出动，向敌人进攻 (of troops) launch an attack on the enemy 2.泛指在斗争或竞赛中发动攻势 attack first in a fight or competition：发现罪犯踪迹，主动出击。Start the offensive as soon as we discover the criminal's traces.

出列
出列[chū liè] 从队列中向前走出并立定 step out of the ranks and stand still

出力
出力[chū lì] 拿出力量；尽力 exert oneself; do one's best：出力不讨好 receive no credit for one's effort他为人耿直，干工作又肯出力。He is honest and straightforward, and hardworking, too.

出动
出动[chū dòng]1.（队伍）外出活动 (of troops) set out：队部命令一分队做好准备，待令出动。The headquarters ordered the first squad to be prepared for action. 2.派出（军队）dispatch (troops)：出动伞兵，协同作战 send paratroopers to coordinate in a battle 3.（许多人为某些事）行动起来 (of many people) get into action：昨天大扫除，全校师生都出动了。All the teachers and students of the school joined yesterday's cleaning-up.

出勤
出勤[chū qín]1.按规定的时间到工作场所工作 show up for work on time：出勤率 ratio of attendance 2.外出办理公务 go out for business

出卖
出卖[chū mài]1.卖；出售 sell; offer for sale：出卖房屋 sell a house出卖劳动力 offer one's labour 2.为了个人利益，做出有利于敌人的事，使国家、民族、亲友等利益受到损害 do sth. for personal interest, to the benefit of the enemy and at the expense of the state, nation, family or friends：出卖灵魂 sell one's soul出卖情报 sell information出卖民族利益 betray national interests

出厂
出厂[chū chǎng] 产品运出工厂 ship products out of the factory：产品注明出厂日期。Products are stamped with the date of manufacture.

出去
出去[chū qù]从里面到外面去 go from inside to outside：出得去 be able to go out出不去 be unable to go out出去走走，呼吸点新鲜空气。Let's get out to breathe some fresh air.出去[chū qù] 用在动词后，表示动作由里向外离开说话的人 [used after a verb to indicate an act directed away from the speaker]：走得出去 be able to leave走不出去 be unable to go away送出大门去 see sb. off outside the gate

出发
出发[chū fā]1.离开原来所在的地方到别的地方去 leave the original location for another place：出发日期还没有确定。The date of departure has not been set.收拾行装，准备出发。Pack up and get ready to leave. 2.考虑或处理问题时以某一方面为着眼点 focus of attention when considering or handling an issue：从生产出发 as regards production从长远利益出发 keep long-term interest in mind

出发点
出发点[chū fā diǎn]1.旅程的起点 starting point of a journey 2.最根本的着眼的地方；动机 most essential point of emphasis; motive：全心全意地为人民服务，一切为了人民的利益，这就是我们的出发点。Our point of departure is to serve the people whole-heartedly and to proceed in all cases from the interest of the people.双方的出发点不同，而要达到的目的则是一致的。Despite different intentions, the two sides seek for the same goal.

出口
出口[chū kǒu]1.说出话来 speak out：出口伤人 speak bitingly出口成章 talk eloquently; make a polished impromptu speech 2.（船只）驶出港口 (of a ship) depart from the port 3.本国或本地区的货物运出去 (of goods) transport out of a country or locality：出口货 export goods出口税 export tax出口[chū kǒu] 从建筑物或场地出去的门或口儿 door or opening through which one leaves a building or place：车站出口 exit of a railway or bus station会场的出口 exit of a meeting place

出口伤人
出口伤人[chū kǒu shāng rén] 一张口说话就污辱人、伤害人 talk harshly; offend people the moment one begins to talk; insult or offend sb. with rude remarks

出口成章
出口成章[chū kǒu chéng zhāng]话说出来就是一篇文章。形容文思敏捷或言语精炼，擅长辞令。What one speaks is like a written article. (fig.) quick in writing or succinct in speech; have the gift of gab

出台
出台[chū tái]1.演员上场 (of an actor or actress) appear onstage：出台演出 perform onstage 2.〈比喻 fig.〉公开出面活动 do sth. in public：出台干涉 openly intervene 3.（政策、措施等）公布或予以实施 publish or implement (a policy, measure, etc.)：管理体制的改革方案正式出台。The reform plan for the management system has been formally promulgated.

出号
出号[chū hào]〈旧时 old〉指商店里的伙计离开商店 (of a shop assistant) leave the place of employment出号[chū hào]（～儿 chūhàor）比头号的还大；特大号的 bigger than the large size; (of size) extra-large; outsize：小伙子挑着两个出号的大水桶。The young man carries a pair of extra-large wooden pails.

出名
出名[chū míng]1.有名声；名字为大家所熟知 be famous; (of one's name) be well known：他是我们厂里出名的先进生产者。He is a renowned advanced worker in our factory. 2.（出名儿 chū∥míngr） 同 same as 出面 chū∥miàn

出品
出品[chū pǐn]1.制造出来产品 manufacture a product：这个牌子的彩电是本厂出品的。This brand of colour TV is made in my factory. 2.生产出来的物品；产品 things produced; product：这是本厂的新出品。This is a new product of my factory.这些出品经过检验，完全合格。These products have passed quality tests and proved fully up to standard.

出售
出售[chū shòu] 卖 sell：出售商品 sell commodities降价出售 sell sth. at a reduced price

出国
出国[chū guó] 离开本国到别国去 go abroad：出国留学 study abroad出国考察 go on a fact-finding tour abroad

出圃
